Authors: [No author name available]
Title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Abstract: The proceedings contain 20 papers. The topics discussed include: a calculation method of electric distance and subarea division application based on transmission impedance; turbine inlet air cooling for industrial and aero-derivative gas turbine in Malaysia climate; enhanced thermal performance of mosques in Qatar; analysis of factors influencing PM2.5 in Beijing: a microcosmic and dynamic perspective for sustainable development; a low cost approach to the design of autopilot for hypersonic glider; joint planning of energy storage and transmission considering wind-storage combined system and demand side response; optimal output of distributed generation based on complex power increment; the vulnerability formation mechanism and control strategy of the oil and gas pipeline city; an equivalent fracture modeling method; evaluation of losses of cold energy of cryogen products in the transport systems; an input and output analysis of the quaternity-dominating energy engineering model from China's countryside; the combustion performance and ingredient ratio of thermite; effect of structural parameters on the combustion performance of platelet engines; research on application of automatic weather station based on internet of things; residents' perceptions of walkability attributes in mainland china: reliability and validity; empirical study on total factor productive energy efficiency in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei region-analysis based on Malmquist index and window model; and based on the theory of TRIZ solving the problem of 18650 battery electrolyte filling.

Authors: [No author name available]
Title: 2017 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2017
Source title: 2017 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2017
Abstract: The proceedings contain 33 papers. The topics discussed include: magnetic properties degradation due to the cutting procedures in the case of electrical steel used in energy efficient electrical machines; influence of cutting technologies on the magnetic anisotropy of grain oriented electrical steel; soft magnetic composites used in the special electric motor magnetic cores; localization based mobile application for shopping malls; promoting battery energy storage systems to support electric vehicle charging strategies in smart grids; optimization and validation of a 10 KW permanent magnet brushless motor for small electric vehicles; design and validation of a 2.5 KW electric naval propulsion system with rim driven propeller; digital system for rotational direction detection using a FPGA; simulation of lithium-ion batteries from a electric vehicle perspective; the urban electric bus, a sustainable solution to increase energy efficiency of public transport and reduce atmospheric pollution in the cities; current study, design and construction of a wireless energy transfer system for mobile devices; constructal optimization of an elemental proton exchange membrane fuel cell used in the electric vehicles; advanced modular photovoltaic system for plug-in small electric vehicles (PsEV); urban ecological transport - a priority of the human society in crowded urban centers; method for calculating coupling coefficients in dynamic energy transfer for electric vehicles; a smart solution for a smart grid: unbalanced reactive power compensation; and on the procedures for optimal wireless energy transfer systems.

Authors: Radu A.T., Eremia M., Toma L.
Title: Promoting battery energy storage systems to support electric vehicle charging strategies in smart grids
Source title: 2017 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Power Systems, University 'Politehnica' Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Radu, A.T., Department of Electrical Power Systems, University 'Politehnica' Bucharest, Romania; Eremia, M., Department of Electrical Power Systems, University 'Politehnica' Bucharest, Romania; Toma, L., Department of Electrical Power Systems, University 'Politehnica' Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: In this paper an optimal strategy for electric vehicle (EV) charging is proposed to achieve the best network operating conditions, with the help of battery energy storage systems (BESS), while integrating photovoltaic power plants (PV). The electric vehicles can both participate in demand response (DR) and serve as energy storage facilities. They can respond to DR signals, such as price variations or direct control messages by modulating their power consumption, thus providing necessary flexibility to the grid operator. The simulations are performed on a test network, and the mathematical model has been implemented in Microsoft's CPLEX tool. The results have shown that in order to cope with the challenges generated by a large number of EVs, coordination of the EV charging not only reduces the difference between the peak and valley of the load demand, but also generates a number of favorable factors and improving the network operation. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Data storage equipment; Electric power plants; Electric power system control; Electric power transmission networks; Electric vehicles; Photovoltaic cells; Secondary batteries; Vehicle-to-grid; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery energy storage systems; Electric vehicle charging; Network operating conditions; Network operations; Optimal strategies; Photovoltaic power plant; Storage facilities; Charging (batteries)

Authors: Onose B.-A., Hanek M.A., Vataselu G., Demeter L.N.
Title: Advanced modular photovoltaic system for Plug-in Small Electric Vehicles (PsEV)
Source title: 2017 Electric Vehicles International Conference, EV 2017
Affiliations: Icpe: Energy Department, Bucureşti, Romania; Icpe: Electrotechnical Materials and Environmental Technologies Department, Bucureşti, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Onose, B.-A., Icpe: Energy Department, Bucureşti, Romania; Hanek, M.A., Icpe: Energy Department, Bucureşti, Romania; Vataselu, G., Icpe: Energy Department, Bucureşti, Romania; Demeter, L.N., Icpe: Electrotechnical Materials and Environmental Technologies Department, Bucureşti, Romania
Abstract: The paper presents an advanced modular photovoltaic system designed for Pug-in Small Electric Vehicles (PsEV) electricity supply in remote applications. The concept is based on the modularity of the photovoltaic (PV) power supply system (PVbox) that can be multiplied in order to fully cover the electricity demand of each application. Based on that the interconnection between multiple PVboxes is done via an Intelligent Connection System (ICS) specially designed for this application. During the design phase the adaptability of the system was the primary focus that determined the PVbox to work as an off-grid system with the battery storage capacity included and an on-grid back-up (in available). The idea was to make the PVbox compact and lightweight, with the maximization of the photovoltaic (PV) power output of the system. Another key factor was the development of an innovative energy management system to cover the possibility of supplying a wide range of plug-in small electric vehicles (PsEV). An in-depth analysis was made to refine the PV system solution in order to maximize the system potential with the results presented below. The results of the paper show that the advanced modular photovoltaic system for plug-in small electric vehicles (PsEV) can be a good alternative for off the grid and remote applications. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Electric power systems; Electric vehicles; Energy management systems; Photovoltaic cells; Electricity demands; Electricity supply; In-depth analysis; Off-grid system; Photovoltaic systems; Remote applications; Small electric vehicles; Storage capacity; Intelligent control

Authors: Guo Y., Xue X., Li Q., Li Z., Si Y., Li K., Mei S.
Title: Experimental study of solar chimney power plant system
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Qinghai Key Lab of Efficient Utilization of Clean Energy, Qinghai University, Xining, 810016, China; Hebei Electric Power Design and Research Institute, Shijiazhuang, 050031, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China

Abstract: In the view of the complex environment of high altitude areas, a solar chimney power plant experimental setup with a chimney 15 m in height and a collector 15 m in diameter was built. The temperature and velocity of air flow within the collector were tested and analyzed. The results show that the variation of air flow temperature and velocity are similar to the solar radiation. Furthermore, the energy storage layer provides an efficient energy supply for supporting continuous operation at night. The air flow temperatures at different locations inside the collector are different. From the comparison results of air temperature within the collector along each direction, the air temperature in the west side is relatively large and the temperature in the north side is relatively low due to the geographical reason. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: collector; energy storage layer; solar chimney power plant system
Index Keywords: Air; Atmospheric temperature; Chimneys; Energy storage; collector; Comparison result; Complex environments; Continuous operation; Energy storage layer; Energy supplies; Solar chimney power plant; Solar chimney power plant system; Solar chimneys

Authors: Liu D., Sun B., Zhang L., Pan X.
Title: Integrated scheduling of generation and load in micro combined cooling heating and power system
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Lishan College, Shandong Normal University, Weifang, 262500, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, D., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Sun, B., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Zhang, L., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, 250061, China; Pan, X., Lishan College, Shandong Normal University, Weifang, 262500, China
Abstract: The renewable energy and Demand Response in the combined cooling heating and power (CCHP) system operation is considered in this paper. The authors propose a kind of integrated scheduling of energy supply and demand which considers the coupling between them. In energy demand side, smart appliances are introduced to participant Demand Respond. In energy supply side, solar energy, storage device and heat recovery technology are adopted to satisfy multiple load. Moreover, a comprehensive evaluation index is established to evaluate the system from economic, environmental and energy-related aspects. The result shows advantages in economic, environment and energy, thus this approach provides a feasible and effective approach to handle dispatch problem in CCHP system. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Jia L., Du C., Zhang C., Chen A.
Title: An improved droop control method for reducing current sensors in DC microgrid
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Jia, L., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Du, C., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Zhang, C., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Chen, A., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Abstract: The voltage droop control technology is commonly adopted to control the power sharing between parallel energy storage units in island dc microgrid for its low cost on the control and communication system, but a large number of voltage and current sensors are needed in the traditional droop control method. An improved droop control method for reducing current sensors is proposed. To achieve voltage droop control, the power transferred by converters is analyzed and calculated without detecting output current, then, a function of converter input/output variables and control variables which is proportional to the output power of converters is adopted in the improved droop controller. Verification results are provided to validate the effectiveness and reasonability of the proposed control method. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: current sensors; dc microgrid; energy storage units; power sharing; voltage droop control
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Current sensors; Dc micro-grid; Energy storage unit; Power sharing; Voltage droop; Power control

Authors: Zhang Z., Zhang X., Cheng Q., Ge Y., Sun Q., Yu H., Wang G.
Title: Power distribution strategy of the energy router based on energy storage multi-mode operation
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid, Shenyang, China; School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Z., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid, Shenyang, China; Zhang, X., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Cheng, Q., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Ge, Y., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid, Shenyang, China; Sun, Q., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Yu, H., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid, Shenyang, China; Wang, G., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid, Shenyang, China
Abstract: A new topology of the energy router is proposed in this paper to achieve a richer power distribution scheme, which contains DC interface, DC energy storage, loads, photovoltaic power generation and other equipment. A power control algorithm based on droop control of the DC bus is proposed to solve the problem of frequent fluctuations of the power and unstable of the DC bus voltage caused by access of the multiple devices. This algorithm realizes the adjustment to the working mode, the direction of the power flow and the value of each unit according to the bus voltage to ensure that the energy router realizes the voltage constant and the power balance of the DC bus without affecting the operation of each device. Characteristic of "resource" or "load" for ER and storage can be switched adaptively, and dynamic power regulation is achieved by droop control. Droop control for "resource" and "load" is similar to the characteristic for "generator-load" in conventional power system, whose purpose is to restrain the power fluctuation and to realize the stable control of dc bus voltage. Finally, according to the proposed topology of the energy router and the control strategy, the simulation is carried out on the MATLAB platform to verify the analysis. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Control algorithm; Droop control; Energy router; Multi - mode operation; Power balance
Index Keywords: Algorithms; Electric load flow; Energy policy; Energy storage; MATLAB; Photovoltaic cells; Solar energy; Topology; Droop control; Energy routers; Multimode operations; Photovoltaic power generation; Power balance; Power distribution strategy; Power distributions; Power fluctuations; Power control

Authors: Li Y., Chen C., Zhang J., Xu Y.
Title: The optimal control strategy for integrated system of wind/photovoltaic/energy storage considering the frequency constraint
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Xining, China; Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Y., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Xining, China; Chen, C., State Grid Qinghai Electric Power Company, Xining, China; Zhang, J., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, China; Xu, Y., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Nanjing, China
Abstract: As more and more clean energy is exploited and utilized, absorption is one of the hot issues of research nowadays. The proportion of new energy in the system is higher and higher, which poses a great challenge to the system frequency stability and energy storage life and capacity. This paper proposes a new optimal scheduling model for system of wind/photovoltaic/ storage. Because of the complementarity of wind and photovoltaic energy, the combination of the two can effectively reduce the randomness of the output. Using the frequency modulation capability of the wind turbine and PV unit to track the prediction curve can reduce the burden of energy storage equipment and increase economy. An optimal dispatching model aimed at generation cost is established, and the frequency constraint is added based on traditional constraint conditions to prevent the frequency deviation from exceeding the allowable value. Finally, the actual data is used for simulation analysis to compare the results of different regulatory strategies and verify the advantages of the proposed strategy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Control Strategy; Energy Storage; Frequency Constraint; Wind/photovoltaic
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Optimal control systems; Wind turbines; Constraint conditions; Control strategies; Frequency constraint; Modulation capability; Optimal control strategy; Optimal dispatching; Photovoltaic energy; Simulation analysis; Digital storage

Authors: Xue T., Zhao J., Wang J.
Title: Motion control for variable stiffness SLIP model of legged robot single leg
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Intelligent Control and Decision of Complex Systems, Department of Automation, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xue, T., Key Laboratory of Intelligent Control and Decision of Complex Systems, Department of Automation, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China; Zhao, J., Key Laboratory of Intelligent Control and Decision of Complex Systems, Department of Automation, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China; Wang, J., Key Laboratory of Intelligent Control and Decision of Complex Systems, Department of Automation, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China
Abstract: The Spring Loaded Inverted Pendulum (SLIP) model has been extensively investigated and used as an inspiration to the study of legged locomotion. Biological data suggest that legs regulate energy production and removal via adjusting muscle stiffness, therefore the classical SLIP is energetically conservative model, and cannot fully explain the robustness and flexibility of many legged animals during running and hopping gaits. In this work we extend the classical SLIP model to an active SLIP model, an energetically non-conservative model with variable stiffness spring. Additionally, we propose a control strategy to regulate the SLIP system energy to drive the system to a desired motion state. Finally, we illustrate through simulations that the variable stiffness SLIP model is applied with our proposed control strategy reveals high tracking accuracy and rapidly converges to a desired motion state. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Motion control; Spring Loaded Inverted Pendulum; Variable stiffness
Index Keywords: Capillary flow; Digital storage; Motion control; Pendulums; Conservative modeling; Control strategies; Energy productions; Non conservative model; Spring loaded inverted pendulums; Tracking accuracy; Variable stiffness; Variable stiffness spring; Stiffness

Abstract: Supercapacitor, as a new type of energy storage device, has broad application prospect in the power system and others. It is very significant to establish an accurate model to reflect the actual job characteristics for supercapacitor reasonable use, performance optimization and system simulation. This article summarizes all kinds of supercapacitor model, points out the characteristics of the existing model, and looks forward to the supercapacitor modeling research development trend. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Liu B., Lin L., Yin A., Li L., Wang Q., You D., Han D.
Title: Control and sizing methodology of BESS in wind farms considering adaptive adjustment of SOC
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, B., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Lin, L., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Yin, A., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Li, L., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Wang, Q., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; You, D., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Han, D., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China
Abstract: Battery energy storage system (BESS) has been used to smooth the wind power fluctuations. However, because of the cost of BESS is relatively high, the effectiveness of fluctuation smoothing has been limited. Meanwhile, capacity optimization of energy storage can reconcile the relationship between energy storage cost and the smoothing effectiveness. Thus, a novel sizing algorithm of BESS is proposed to optimize the capacity of BESS. Firstly, state-of-charge (SOC) of energy storage system is used as index to avoid over-charge/-discharge of energy storage system to prolong the lifespan of BESS. Secondly, an objective function is presented to minimize the overall cost including the invest cost, operation cost and punishment cost to determine the optimal BESS capacity. At last, improved partial swarm optimization algorithm is adopted to deal with this problem. The calculation results prove the proposed algorithm is good. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; capacity; optimization; PSO; SOC
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Costs; Energy storage; Optimization; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); System-on-chip; Wind power; Battery energy storage system (BESS); BESS; Calculation results; capacity; Capacity optimization; Energy storage systems; Fluctuation smoothing; Partial swarm optimizations; Charging (batteries)

Abstract: The station microgrid technology provides a flexible and efficient platform for the integration of distributed generation and renewable energy power generation technology and its application in substations. With the further upgrading of renewable energy power generation products and technologies and the further development of new energy technologies in substations, new energy and micro-grid technology will be popularized and applied in substation station power system. In this paper, the power supply system of 500kv substation in Leezhou is taken as an example, and the system of wind storage system is used as the supplementary power supply of UHV station. The distributed power capacity and energy storage in microgrid planning are designed respectively. System capacity for joint solution, while optimizing the configuration. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Song Y., Wang H., Zhang C., Yan J., Yang L., Wei Y.
Title: Research on photovoltaic grid-connected system with energy storage based on improved energy management strategy
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China
Authors with affiliations: Song, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China; Wang, H., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China; Zhang, C., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China; Yan, J., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China; Yang, L., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China; Wei, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation Shandong, University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, 266590, China
Abstract: This paper proposes an improved energy management strategy for simultaneous power management of the photovoltaic grid-connected system with energy storage. Based on the DC bus voltage and the working states of grid, the PV system is divided into six working modes by the proposed energy management strategy. This can avoid the effect of grid failure on PV system, and achieve the optimal utilization of light energy. Firstly, based on the management strategy, a photovoltaic grid-connected system with energy storage units is constructed in this paper, which is consisted of the photovoltaic units, energy storage units, an inverter and the local loads. Then, the working conditions of different modes and the switching process between modes are described in detail. Finally, the control method of the photovoltaic system is given, so that the system can be switched smoothly between different working modes. The simulation results show that, through the improved energy management strategy, the PV grid-connected system with energy storage units is capable of ensuring normal running of the local loads when the grid fails and achieving system stability when the local loads are changed. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: control strategy; energy management strategy; energy storage unit
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Photovoltaic cells; Power management; Storage management; System stability; Control strategies; Energy management strategies; Energy storage unit; Management strategies; Optimal utilization; Photovoltaic grid connected system; Photovoltaic systems; PV grid-connected systems; Energy management systems

Authors: Wang H., Zhang C., Li K.
Title: Study of cooling, heating and power characteristics of the improved multi-stage AA-CAES system
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Zhang, C., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Li, K., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Abstract: Advanced adiabatic compressed air energy storage (AA-CAES) system can effectively stabilize the fluctuations of new energy, and supply cooling, heating and power. This paper proposes an improved multi-stage AA-CAES system, in which a dual preheating structure is innovatively used between the expanders. And combined cooling, heating, and power (CCHP) model of AA-CAES system is proposed, in order to analyze the output characteristics of cool, heat and electricity. Considering the energy quality, the overall energy efficiency is selected as evaluation index, and simulation has been finished with experimental data. The results show that the performance of this proposed system is improved by trigeneration. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wen X., Kai W., Shengzhe Z.
Title: Research on hierarchical control strategy of hybrid energy storage system in microgrid
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Authors with affiliations: Wen, X., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Kai, W., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Shengzhe, Z., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Abstract: Distributed generation units in the microgrid are intermittent and random, which can't meet the demand of grid power stability. In this paper, hierarchical control strategy is used to research hybrid storage system: The superstratum is the microgrid central management and control system, and it contains both distributed generation units and load requirements; the lower layer is the local control system of the hybrid energy storage system, and the high/low frequency fluctuation power of the system is distinguished by moving average filtering. The Ampere-hour integral method combined with the open circuit voltage method to calculate state of charge (SOC) in lithium battery and supercapacitor. The simulation results show that the proposed hybrid energy storage system can meet the requirements of distributed generation in microgrid, and the energy storage units in the hybrid energy storage system can avoid excessive charging and discharging. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hierarchical control strategy; Hybrid energy storage; Moving average filter; State of charge (SOC)

Authors: Shang W., Yu S., Zhang G., Li Q., Chen W.
Title: Fuel cell hybrid locomotive system based on equivalent consumption minimization strategy
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Shang, W., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; Yu, S., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; Zhang, G., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; Li, Q., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; Chen, W., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China
Abstract: In order to bring the simulation system closer to the actual locomotive run properties, ease to observe locomotive system response in real-time. The fuel cell hybrid locomotive system established in this paper, consists of 150 kW proton exchange membrane fuel cell (PEMFC) power generation system, DC/DC converter, battery energy store system, three-phase asynchronous traction motor, etc. And designs the fuel cell hybrid power systems energy management strategy based on equivalent hydrogen consumption minimum. As simulation tests shows, Based on traction inverter-fed induction motor of hybrid system, in the energy management strategy of equivalent hydrogen consumption minimum, when the load and speed changes, fuel cell hybrid locomotive system with Inverter-fed induction motor traction can respond accurately and rapidly. Meanwhile, equivalent hydrogen consumption Minimum energy management strategy to reduce the total equivalent hydrogen consumption of the system, reduces the volume and weight of the hydrogen storage device, and improve the economy. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors with affiliations: Liu, B., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Yin, M., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Lin, Q., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Lin, L., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Yuan, S., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Ma, J., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China; Guan, T., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan Shandong, 250061, China
Abstract: Recently, the penetration of photovoltaic (PV) power in power system has being promoted rapidly. However, the PV power shows drastic fluctuation which presents great challenge to the power grid. Thus, how to mitigate the fluctuation of PV station needs to be solved. Battery energy storage system (BESS) is flexible to charge/discharge and track the fluctuation of PV power, and also BESS integrated with PV station has fast response capability, so it is well suited for smoothing PV power fluctuations. At the same time, it should be noted that BESS has relatively high price per unit size. So how to prolong its lifetime and decrease the average cost per time unit is significant for the application of BESS. In this paper, a control strategy of BESS based on fuzzy control theory is presented to avoid the overdischarge of BESS, accordingly decrease the potential damage to BESS to decrease its lifetime. Also the fuzzy control theory based charge/discharge scheme is presented to adjust SOC to maintain the state of health (SOH) of BESS. The effectiveness of the proposed method has been demonstrated by case study with actual PV power data. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Capacity; energy storage; photovoltaic power; SOC
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Charging (batteries); Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Energy storage; Fuzzy control; Photovoltaic cells; System-on-chip; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Capacity; Charge/discharge; Control strategies; Overdischarge; Photovoltaic power; Power fluctuations; State of health; Control theory

Authors: Shengzhe Z., Kai W., Wen X.
Title: Fuzzy logic-based control strategy for a battery/supercapacitor hybrid energy storage system in electric vehicles
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Authors with affiliations: Shengzhe, Z., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Kai, W., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Wen, X., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Abstract: In order to optimize the operation status of hybrid energy storage system in electric vehicles, a novel fuzzy logic control strategy is proposed. This strategy adopts Kalman filtering algorithm to estimates state of charge (SOC) and state of power (SOP), which can calculate the optimum power and alleviate the errors of SOC effectively. Besides, the framework of the strategy and the model of both battery and supercapacitor are introduced. The proposed control strategy will help to deal with energy storage system problem of relatively short lifespan and poor limited range in electric vehicles. So stability and efficiency of hybrid energy storage system (HESS) improve greatly. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Eectric vehicles; Energy management system; Fuzzy Logic-Based Control; Hybrid energy storage system; Kalman filtering algorithm

Authors: Zha H., Wei A., Fang Y.
Title: Application of data fusion in water quality monitoring
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Zha, H., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Wei, A., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Fang, Y., School of Control Science and Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Abstract: In view of monitoring of water quality in Penaeus vannamei culture pond, this paper puts forward a method of two-level data fusion which is usually used to solve the problems of limited resources such as network energy, storage capacity and processing capacity of wireless sensor networks. The data transmitted from the sensor group distributed in the field can be processed and compressed to obtain the decision-making information of the water quality of the culture pond through BP neural network. MATLAB simulation shows that the data obtained by data fusion are consistent with expected values. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Model predictive control of energy storage converter with feedback correction
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Faculty of Automation and Information Engineering, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; State Key Lab of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China

Abstract: A model predictive control method for a bi-directional DC/DC converter with feedback correction is presented. This method can improve the ability of energy storage system to maintain the stability of the DC voltage, and the converter inductor current track the given fast. The bus voltage overshoot is inhibited. The response speed of storage system to the power fluctuation of DC microgrid is enhanced. Simulation results show the correctness and effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Power optimization control strategy of peak load shifting of energy storage system in business park
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017

Ltd., Jilin, China; Jianhua, Z., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: With economic and industrial restructuring, the number and size of commercial parks are increasing. The most basic function of energy storage system in commercial parks is to carry out the load side, Which also brings economic benefits and ensures the reliability of power grid. Therefore, it is of practical significance to study the control strategy of energy storage system in business parks. In this paper, a variable parameter power difference control strategy for energy storage system is proposed. Based on the typical daily load of the park, it divides the load interval and the SOC of the energy storage system. Different subspaces are provided with different strategies. Finally, a simulation analysis, taking a Shanghai business park as an actual data sample shows that the proposed method for the energy storage system is effective. © 2017 IEEE.

Ltd, Fushun, China
Abstract: Traditional substation station power are taken from the grid system, power consumption is relatively large, not only increases the power loss, but also the consumption of nonrenewable energy. With the development of micro-network technology, more power users tend to use the new micro-grid power supply mode to improve power supply reliability. In this paper, the power supply system of 500kv substation in Leezhou is taken as an example, and the scheme of using optical storage micro-grid system as supplementary power supply for UHV station is designed respectively. The distributed power capacity and energy storage System capacity for joint solution, while optimizing the configuration. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Feng X., Tao Y., Wan M.
Title: Energy management and control strategy for multiport power supply system based on energy storage
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Department of College of Information and Control Engineering, China University of Petroleum (East China), Qingdao, China
Authors with affiliations: Feng, X., Department of College of Information and Control Engineering, China University of Petroleum (East China), Qingdao, China; Tao, Y., Department of College of Information and Control Engineering, China University of Petroleum (East China), Qingdao, China; Wan, M., Department of College of Information and Control Engineering, China University of Petroleum (East China), Qingdao, China
Abstract: The MPSS (multiport power supply system) is consist of fuel cell, super capacitor and two DC/DC converters. The energy management scheme, along with the allocation principle of energy storage unit is analyzed. The paper establishes the mathematical model and proposes a composite control strategy. The strategy fuses subsection PI (Proportional and Integral) control and SMC (Sliding Mode Control) based on super capacitor energy storage device. It also realizes the current sharing control, the rapid energy transfer control and the voltage stability control based on voltage and current double closed-loop control strategy. The bidirectional DC/DC converter provides instantaneous energy; the unidirectional DC/DC converter transfers energy from fuel cell to loads and capacitor energy storage unit. Both of the converters circuit component parameters are designed for the system need. The simulation and experimental analysis verify the effectiveness of the composite control strategy for the MPSS. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bidirectional DC/DC converter; energy storage; multiport power supply system; sliding mode control; subsection PI control

Authors: Xu D., Deng J., Yan W., Yang W.
Title: Adaptive nonlinear controller design for fuel cell/supercapacitor hybrid energy storage system with model uncertainties
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering and Intelligent Equipment, School of Internet of Things Engineering, Jiangnan University, Wuxi, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering and Intelligent Equipment, Jiangnan University, Wuxi, China

Abstract: In this paper, an adaptive nonlinear control method based on Lyapunov function is proposed for fuel cell/supercapacitor hybrid energy storage system (HESS) used in electric vehicles. The fuel cell (FC) acts as the main energy storage device, which is connected with a boost converter. And the supercapacitor (SC) acts as the auxiliary energy system, which is connected with a bi-directional DC-DC converter. Based on the two energy storage devices and connected converters, the integral system model is obtained. In the design process of the control scheme, the adaptive controller is utilized to solve the problems of external disturbance and uncertain parts in the system model. The Lyapunov based stability analysis is given to prove the convergence of the proposed control method. And the final simulation results show the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Controllers; DC-DC converters; Design; Electric inverters; Energy storage; Fuel cells; Fuel storage; Lyapunov functions; Uncertainty analysis; Adaptive controllers; Adaptive nonlinear control; Adaptive nonlinear controllers; Bidirectional DC-DC converters; External disturbances; Hybrid energy storage systems; Hybrid energy storage systems (HESS); Lyapunov-based stability analysis; Adaptive control systems

Authors: Jun R., Kai W., Liwei L.
Title: Characteristics analysis of ultracapacitor-battery hybrid energy storage system
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Authors with affiliations: Jun, R., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Kai, W., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China; Liwei, L., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Qingdao University, Qingdao, 266071, China
Abstract: The structure and working principle of hybrid energy storage system are introduced. The classical RC model of ultracapacitor is analyzed, and the topology of charging and discharging converter of energy storage system is studied. A ultracapacitor-battery hybrid energy storage system model based on bidirectional boost-buck circuit is constructed, and the charging and discharging process of the energy storage system is simulated by Simulink circuit according to the power tracking strategy. The simulation results show that the hybrid energy storage system has a better dynamic response than the single battery energy storage system, and it can quickly complete the power requirement of the system. The addition of the ultracapacitor can reduce the impact damage to the battery due to the sudden change of the load, and prolong the service life of the battery. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wei Y., Zhang C., Dou G., Song Y., Lin M.
Title: A bidirectional DC-DC converters for photovoltaic generation energy storage system
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China; Zhang, C., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China; Dou, G., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China; Song, Y., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China; Lin, M., College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Shandong University of Science and Technology, Qingdao, China
Abstract: Photovoltaic energy storage system meets the ever-growing demand for electricity, while ensuring the stability of power supply. Research of renewable energy-based microgrid system has become a hot topic, especially the study of Maximum Power Point Tracking (MPPT) and energy storage unit control strategies. This paper proposes an MPPT technique that combines gradient step size with conductance increment method, in order to achieve fast maximum power tracking and to avoid shock and error at the Maximum Power Point (MPP). On the basis of small signal model, bidirectional Buck/Boost converter and full bridge converter are designed to form the inner current loop and the outer voltage loop of battery charging/discharging controller under different control strategies, so as to realize the bidirectional flow of energy. A simulation model of energy storage unit is built in MATLAB/Simulink environment, and the simulation results verify the effectiveness of the control strategy. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Contrast and analysis between two pulsed power supply modes based on superconducting pulsed transformers
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017

Authors with affiliations: Liu, S., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China; Li, X., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China; Huang, R., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China; Ai, J., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China; Hu, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China; Wang, S., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, Shandong, China
Abstract: High power pulsed power supply is the basis of electromagnetic emission. In this paper, the capacitor voltage limit mode and non-linear resistor voltage limit mode power pulsed power supply are common models. In this paper, two circuit modes based on high temperature superconducting (HTS) pulsed transformers were introduced and the working principle were analyzed respectively. In accordance with the actual parameters of a small experimental superconducting pulsed transformer, the discharging process of two modes was simulated and the characteristics of outputted current pulse were analyzed at different limited primary voltage conditions. The results show that both two circuit modes can effectively limit the primary voltage. However, the overall performance by the capacitor voltage limit mode is better than the use of non-linear resistor voltage limit mode. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Shi C., Tang X., Zhang G., Li N.
Title: Research on power sharing control strategy in distributed energy storage system-based DC distribution network
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Shi, C., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Tang, X., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Zhang, G., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Li, N., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper deeply researches the power sharing issue of the distributed energy storage system in DC distribution network. Through in-depth study, finding the traditional voltage droop control strategy has a weakness that the existence of line impedance leads to the power outputs of energy storage units are completely coupled in distributed energy storage system. To overcome the weakness, a current droop control strategy is proposed in this paper which includes the key control parameters calculation method and complete impedances' decoupling approach for distributed energy storage system. In order to solve the start-up problem of current droop control strategy, an improve scheme of the strategy is also studied in this paper. At last, experimental results verify the correctness of the theory analysis and the effectiveness of the proposed control approach. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC distribution network; Distributed energy storage system; Droop control strategy; Line impedance
Index Keywords: Data storage equipment; Energy storage; Control approach; Control strategies; DC distribution network; Distributed energy storage systems; Droop control strategies; Energy storage unit; Line impedance; Startup problems; Distributed computer systems

Authors: Shujun M., You Z., Ye Y., Ding Z., Jin L., Kai S.
Title: A curtailed wind power accommodation strategy based on wind-hydrogen-heat-storage integrated energy network
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Department of Energy Intelligence, Nation Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Shujun, M., Department of Energy Intelligence, Nation Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; You, Z., Department of Energy Intelligence, Nation Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; Ye, Y., Department of Energy Intelligence, Nation Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; Ding, Z., Department of Energy Intelligence, Nation Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; Jin, L., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Kai, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The wind power curtailment issue has been recognized extensively and it can't be solved by upgrading the electric power alone. Meanwhile, the chemical or physical energy storage system, like battery-storage or pumped-storage, are also not able to solve the issue cost-effectively due to either economical or geographical limitations. This paper adopts hydrogen and heat as energy storage media to alleviate the wind power curtailment issue. Based on hydrogen production by electrolysis of water, power generation by fuel cell and methane synthesis from hydrogen and carbon dioxide, the electricity, gas and heat can be integrated in one network. In another word, a 'wind-hydrogen-heat-storage' integrated energy network can be formed sophisticatedly. Based on the integrated energy network, a curtailed wind power accommodating strategy will be presented specifically. Detailed realization methods of the integrated energy network and operation modes of the proposed accommodating strategy will also be discussed in the paper. The results can prove that the curtailed wind power accommodating strategy is able to greatly increase the absorptive capacity of the abandoned wind power. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Integrated energy network; Wind power curtailment problem; Wind-hydrogen-heat-storage
Index Keywords: Carbon dioxide; Electric energy storage; Fuel cells; Heat storage; Hydrogen production; Wind power; Abandoned wind power; Absorptive capacity; Energy networks; Geographical limitations; Hydrogen production by electrolysis; Wind hydrogens; Wind power accommodations; Wind power curtailments; Hydrogen storage

Abstract: Energy saving of compressed air system was studied in this work. The whole process model including compressor's performance, pressure loss of pipeline and pressure change of storage tank was founded. And then compared with performance equations of FSD compressors, energy cost and related Volumetric efficiency change along the variable frequency was achieved. With these models founded, simulations of the compressed air system with different number and type of compressors were carried out, meaningful results including the dperformance and internal state were obtained, which is helpful for the analysis and understanding of the process, also from the comparison of cascaded control mode and frequency control mode for complex system with multi-compressors, specific energy saving and stable pressure control for output pressure can be demonstrated with frequency control mode. The work is quite good for the performance analysis and energy saving instruction of compressed air system. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: A modified model of supercapacitors and its thermal behavior research

Abstract: Supercapacitor is a new type of energy storage element, and its performance is easily influenced by temperature. In order to have more precise energy storage characteristic research of supercapacitor, a modified porous circuit equivalent model is proposed on the basis of porous circuit equivalent model in electric double layer supercapacitor. The simulation results show that modified porous circuit equivalent model can reflect impedance performance more accurately. Besides, changing rule of the supercapacitor impedance spectroscopy under different temperature is analyzed briefly. The modified porous circuit equivalent model can describe the self discharge (mainly caused by leakage current) of supercapacitor. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Chang L., Wang X., Mao M.
Title: Transactive energy scheme based on multi-factor evaluation and contract net protocol for distribution network with high penetration of DERs
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China
Authors with affiliations: Chang, L., Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China; Wang, X., Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China; Mao, M., Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 230009, China
Abstract: Distributed energy resources (DERs) include distributed generations (DGs), distributed energy storages (DESs), and the demand response resources (DRRs). With the increasing penetration of DERs in distribution network, more and more users change from power consumers to prosumers which have great influences on distribution network as well as generate new business models on the demand side. Based on the emerging change of the power system, this paper proposes a transactive energy scheme (TES) based on multi-factor evaluation and contract net protocol to determine energy trading strategies among prosumers to realize economic and stable operation of distribution network. In the proposed TES, a TE market is built in the deregulatory retail power market. Power consumers, smart homes, industrial parks, or virtual power plants with DERs take the initiative as transactive nodes (TNs), and the peer to peer transactions among TNs in TE market can be carried out based on the multi-factor evaluation and contract protocol. When a TN cannot meet its own electricity demand, it launches the contract net to other TNs, requests to carry on the electric energy transaction, and determines the selected TNs according to the multi-factor evaluation. The simulation results show compared with the traditional electricity business model, the market participants who use the proposed TES can gain more economic benefits as well as protecting their own privacy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: contract net protocol; distributed energy resources; high penetration; multifactor; transactive energy; transactive node
Index Keywords: Automation; Commerce; Energy resources; Industrial plants; Intelligent buildings; Power markets; Contract net protocols; Distributed Energy Resources; High penetrations; Multi-factor; transactive energy; transactive node; Internet protocols

Authors: Zhai J., He W., Hua G., Zheng H., Liu H.
Title: GSA based optimal capacity configuration of wind-solar-storage system in microgrid
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Company, Hefei, China; College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhai, J., School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, China; He, W., New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Hua, G., New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Zheng, H., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Company, Hefei, China; Liu, H., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: For the poor operation reliability and low economic benefit of wind-photovoltaic generation system in microgrid, an optimal capacity configuration method based on gravitational search algorithm (GSA) is proposed in this paper, to increase reliability and economic benefits of combined wind-solar-storage system in microgrid. Based on power output models of different types of renewable power resources, an optimal mathematical model is established with multiple objective functions of minimal costs, energy wastage rate and loss of power supply probability. The concept of GSA is introduced and specific steps of solving this problem is explained. Eventually, a case studied is discussed and analyzed to verify the feasibility and effectiveness of proposed method. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Dong W., Kun L., Yi W.
Title: Model predictive control of a large temperature difference refrigerating station with ice cold thermal energy storage
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beijing University of Civil Engineering and Architecture, Beijing, China; China Construction First Division, Group Real Estate Development Co. Ltd, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Dong, W., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beijing University of Civil Engineering and Architecture, Beijing, China; Kun, L., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beijing University of Civil Engineering and Architecture, Beijing, China; Yi, W., China Construction First Division, Group Real Estate Development Co. Ltd, Beijing, China
Abstract: In this study, a model predictive control (MPC) algorithm is developed to optimize the operation of a large temperature difference refrigerating station with external-melt ice cold thermal energy storage (CTES) for the cooling system of a large office building in Beijing, China. The chillers and ice CTES equipment are connected in series to cool the chilled water so that large temperature difference and ultra low temperature air supply are realized to achieve small flow for energy saving. This study involves two phases: Development of the mathematical model of the plant development and testing of model predictive control algorithms. A co-simulation environment based on Matlab and TRNSYS is developed. The thermal behavior of the ice tank and plate heat ex-changer is analyzed by lumped formulas of the conservation equations in Matlab while models of other equipment such as chillers, pumps and cooling towers are developed in TRNSYS. The ice CTES system is modeled as a hybrid system, where the water phase transitions (solid-melting-liquid) are described by combining continuous and discrete dynamics. The model predictive control algorithm is designed and developed in Matlab to determine the required ice tank outlet water temperature to minimize operating expenses while meeting equipment and thermal comfort constraints under varying loads. The controller is optimized based on a forward neural network dynamic optimization algorithm. The objective function is a constant coefficient quadratic cost function of the ice tank outlet water temperature response and the use of control effort. This paper validates and compares the advantages of the MPC over PID. The findings illustrate that the MPC achieves shorter regulation time and smaller overshoot when compared with PID. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Co-simulation; Model predictive control; Neural networks; TRNSYS

Authors: Lin Q., Yin M., Shi D., Qu H., Huo J., Cheng Y., Li G., Li J.
Title: Optimal control of battery energy storage system integrated in PV station considering peak shaving
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 Chinese Automation Congress, CAC 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, Shandong, 250010, China
Authors with affiliations: Lin, Q., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Yin, M., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Shi, D., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Qu, H., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Huo, J., State Grid Jinan Power Supply Company, Jinan, Shandong, 250061, China; Cheng, Y., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, Shandong, 250010, China; Li, G., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, Shandong, 250010, China; Li, J., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Research Institute, Jinan, Shandong, 250010, China
Abstract: A novel control strategy for battery energy storage system (BESS) which is integrated within photovoltaic power station is presented in this paper. Normally the function of BESS is to mitigate the power fluctuation of PV to meet the requirements of dispatch center. In this paper, besides PV fluctuation smoothing, peak power shaving is also considered in the control strategy of BESS, which means part capacity of BESS is idle when fluctuations of PV power is small and not all BESS capacity is needed, and then on basis of time-in-use electricity price, this part of idle BESS can take part in peak shaving to earn extra benefits. Thus, the size-limited BESS can be fully utilized and meanwhile extra benefits from peak shaving can be achieved. Using actual PV power data, the proposed strategy is verified and the simulation results show that this strategy not only smooth the PV fluctuations, but also creates profits from peak shaving. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; capacity; operation; optimization; photovoltaic power

Title: Real-time analysis and visualization for big data of energy consumption

Abstract: This paper proposes a research on real-time analysis and visualization for big data of energy consumption. In this research, we access real-time energy consumption data from cloud storage by a Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP). In order to optimize K-Means clustering algorithm, we implement CUDA C programming to finish data-intensive calculation in the Graphic Processing Unit (GPU), which enhances the efficiency of analysis for big data of energy consumption. Meanwhile, to realize data visualization, we draw the data mining results in a multidimensional plane utilizing DirectX, which is a standard graphics API. We also render the original energy consumption data directly in the form of four-dimensional geometry with the plane together, so as to obtain more useful information intuitively. © 2017 Association for Computing Machinery.

Authors: Badea G., Felseghi R.A., Aşchilean I., Raboaca S.M., Soimoşan T.
Title: The role of hydrogen as a future solution to energetic and environmental problems for residential buildings
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Badea, G., Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Felseghi, R.A., Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Aşchilean, I., Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Raboaca, S.M., Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania; Soimoşan, T., Technical University of Cluj-Napoca, Memorandumului 28, Cluj-Napoca, Romania
Abstract: The concept of sustainable development aims to meet the needs of the present without compromising the needs of future generations. In achieving the desideratum "low-carbon energy system", in the domain of energy production, the use of innovative low-carbon technologies providing maximum efficiency and minimum pollution is required. Such technology is the fuel cell; as these will be developed, it will become a reality to obtain the energy based on hydrogen. Thus, hydrogen produced by electrolysis of water using different forms of renewable resources becomes a secure and sustainable energy alternative. In this context, in the present paper, a comparative study of two different hybrid power generation systems for residential building placed in Cluj-Napoca was made. In these energy systems have been integrated renewable energies (photovoltaic panels and wind turbine), backup and storage system based on hydrogen (fuel cell, electrolyser and hydrogen storage tank), and, respectively, backup and storage system based on traditional technologies (diesel generator and battery). The software iHOGA was used to simulate the operating performance of the two hybrid systems. The aim of this study was to compare energy, environmental and economic performances of these two systems and to define possible future scenarios of competitiveness between traditional and new innovative technologies. After analyzing and comparing the results of simulations, it can be concluded that the fuel cells technology along with hydrogen, integrated in a hybrid system, may be the key to energy production systems with high energy efficiency, making possible an increased capitalization of renewable energy which have a low environmental impact. © 2017 Author(s).

Authors: Pavelek M., Matej Z., Herman O., Mravec F., Veskrna M., Prenosil V., Cvachovec F., Kost'Al M.
Title: Fast digital spectrometer for mixed radiation fields
Source title: Proceedings of IEEE Sensors
Affiliations: Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Department of Mathematics and Physics, Faculty of Military Technology, University of Defence, Brno, Czech Republic; Research Centre Rez, Husinec-Řež, Czech Republic
Authors with affiliations: Pavelek, M., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Matej, Z., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Herman, O., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Mravec, F., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Veskrna, M., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Prenosil, V., Department of Machine Learning and Data Processing, Faculty of Informatics, Masaryk University, Brno, Czech Republic; Cvachovec, F., Department of Mathematics and Physics, Faculty of Military Technology, University of Defence, Brno, Czech Republic; Kost'Al, M., Research Centre Rez, Husinec-Řež, Czech Republic
Abstract: We present a digital system for measurement of neutron spectra in mixed gamma-neutron fields. The signal from a standard scintillation detector is sampled at rate up to 1 GHz, using 12-bit analog-to-digital converters. First stage of the signal processing is performed on a Virtex 6 FPGA and partial results are streamed through a fast Ethernet link to a computer, where the final processing takes place. The combination of high performance ADCs and flexible FPGA fabric allows the system to reliably process up to 100,000 detection events per second. This greatly reduces the time needed for data acquisition, compared to its analog predecessor that reached count rates approximately 30 times lower. The second main advantage over old analog spectrometers and earlier digital systems with similar parameters is a great reduction of storage space requirements, achieved by performing particle discrimination on-the-fly using the FPGA. A typical experiment that previously required several gigabytes of storage space to store all the raw data samples now requires only a few megabytes to store the measured energy and discrimination parameter for each detected particle. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: digitizer; FPGA; mixed fields; neutron spectrometry; pulse-shape discrimination; scintillation

Authors: Liu W., Liu J.
Title: Energy-efficient dynamic resource control for buffer-aided hybrid sensor networks
Source title: 2017 9th IEEE International Conference on Communication Software and Networks, ICCSN 2017
Affiliations: National Key Laboratory of Science and Technology On Communications, University of Science and Technology of China Chengdu, Sichuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, W., National Key Laboratory of Science and Technology On Communications, University of Science and Technology of China Chengdu, Sichuan, China; Liu, J., National Key Laboratory of Science and Technology On Communications, University of Science and Technology of China Chengdu, Sichuan, China
Abstract: Energy-efficient dynamic resource control problem in buffer-aided hybrid sensor networks is investigated, where each sensor with one buffer is introduced for data storage. The considered problem is formulated as a stochastic optimization problem, which jointly considers the quality-of-service requirements and dynamic characteristics. The Lyapunov optimization theory is applied to transform the intractable stochastic optimization problem into a tractable deterministic optimization problem, which can be further decomposed into two separate subproblems. A dynamic resource control algorithm is proposed to efficiently solve the original stochastic optimization problem. Finally, we conduct simulations to evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithm and provide some insights. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Yang S., Liu H., Dai C., Li Y.
Title: An application of virtual synchronous generator technology in wave energy
Source title: OCEANS 2017 - Anchorage
Affiliations: College of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, Heilongjiang, 150001, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, S., College of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, Heilongjiang, 150001, China; Liu, H., College of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, Heilongjiang, 150001, China; Dai, C., College of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, Heilongjiang, 150001, China; Li, Y., College of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, Heilongjiang, 150001, China
Abstract: With the global energy crisis and environmental pollution intensified, the development of new energy has become the consensus of the world. Among them, ocean, which accounts for 70.8% of the Earth's surface area, contains a wide range and considerable storage of renewable energy. Energy flow density of wave energy is large, which is a low-cost energy source that can provide considerable power through smaller devices. The rational use of marine wave power generation consumes no fuel and resources, does not produce any pollution, less investment and quick return. Therefore, wave power generation has great potential for development. However, there are some problems to be solved urgently in the wave power generation. The wave energy has the characteristics of large amplitude and variable frequency. Therefore, the input power of the wave power generator is generally unstable, discontinuous and abrupt. And facing of changing climate conditions and other factors, wave power generation devices often work in abnormal conditions, which will cause some degree of impact on some devices, also the power quality of the reliability and stability are affected. A single wave power generation system is usually an independent power generation system or directly connected to the offshore power distribution system and is currently the main form of running wave power generation. Directly connected to the offshore power distribution system in the wave power generation system is not enough to cause a significant impact on the voltage and frequency of large systems, but its impact on the voltage, power quality, power electronic devices of the local power distribution network can not be ignored. Through the analysis of wave power generation characteristics, this paper proposes a inverter control strategy based on the principle of virtual synchronous generator (VSG) to introduce the wave power generation system. Because of its similar characteristics of synchronous generators, such as large output impedance, large inertia, power by droop feature distribution, it is suitable for wave energy this low stability, high mutation rate power generation system. Through the introduction of virtual inertia and damping coefficient, it can improve the stability of wave power generation, improve the efficiency of inverter utilization, reduce the cost of system configuration and improve the service life of converter. © 2017 Marine Technology Society.
Author Keywords: marine renewables; virtual synchronous generator; wave energy; wave energy power quality

Authors: Li Y., Liu H., Zhang Q., Yang S., Li Z.
Title: Distributed power planning on pelagic clustering islands
Source title: OCEANS 2017 - Anchorage

Abstract: Integrated energy supply system of pelagic clustering islands (IESS-PCI) can meet the load demand of the main island more effectively. It strengthens the sense of cooperation between the islands and improves the stability of renewable power supply. It provides a more reliable mode of operation for pelagic clustering islands. The operation mode of IESS is introduced and the preliminary planning of IESS's production capacity and transport capacity is achieved in this paper. Combining the geographical conditions and natural data, the installation capacity of wind turbines, photovoltaic panels and wave power generation devices on satellite island is optimized by the algorithm of multi-objective particle swarm optimization (MOPSO). The model of the transportation is transformed into the specific problem of linear programming to determine the optimal capacity of the battery and the storage tank on the transport vessel. Taking Paracel Islands of China for an example proves the feasibility of IESS and the rationality of the whole system. © 2017 Marine Technology Society.

Authors: Qi X., Liu H., Wang K., Zhang Q., Dai C.
Title: An improvement of the optimal capacity and economic analysis of micro-grid on island
Source title: OCEANS 2017 - Anchorage
Affiliations: Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China
Authors with affiliations: Qi, X., Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China; Liu, H., Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China; Wang, K., Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China; Zhang, Q., Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China; Dai, C., Department of Automation, Harbin Engineering University, Harbin, China
Abstract: The islands have plentiful renewable energy resources. Fully use of these renewable energy sources will greatly improve the power supply capacity and quality of the offshore micro grid. Considering the randomness and intermittence of the output of these renewable energy sources, it is a good choice to add energy storage devices into the grid to improve the reliability and stability of the system output power. Therefore, how to scientifically and rationally configure the capacity of new energy power generation equipment and energy storage devices becomes an important issue. In research, it was usually regarded as a multi-objective optimization problem, but the solution is usually the Pareto solution set, the decision makes need to choose a better solution which is suitable for practical engineering problems according to their experience, but in real life their experience is usually limited. Therefore, in this paper two methods-fuzzy theory to get the compromise solution recommended and game theory to get the Nash equilibrium, were proposed to solve the problem of Pareto solution set and joined it into the designed software. The methods that proposed in this paper increase the practicality of the software and provide a great help to design the micro grid on the independent island. © 2017 Marine Technology Society.

Title: Evaluating the effect of wind-hydro hybrid power stations on the operation of Cretan power system
Source title: 2017 52nd International Universities Power Engineering Conference, UPEC 2017
Affiliations: Technological Educational Institute of Crete, Greece; Hellenic Electricity Distribution Network Operator (HEDNO) S.A., Greece
Authors with affiliations: Fiorentzis, K.E., Technological Educational Institute of Crete, Greece; Katsigiannis, Y.A., Technological Educational Institute of Crete, Greece; Karapidakis, E.S., Technological Educational Institute of Crete, Greece; Tsikalakis, A.G., Hellenic Electricity Distribution Network Operator (HEDNO) S.A., Greece
Abstract: The Cretan power system is the largest autonomous power system in Greece, and it consumes around 5% of the total Greek electricity demand. It contains a large number of conventional power stations that are combined with significant installed capacity of wind farms and photovoltaics. This paper is evaluating the effect of a large wind-hydro hybrid power station installation in this system. The analysis is implemented by using PowerWorld simulator, and it contains a large number of alternative scenarios, which combine different values of load demand and renewable energy production. The results show that with the inclusion of the hybrid station, significant economical benefits in Cretan power system operation can be achieved, without affect the safe operation of the system. © 2017 IEEE.
