Authors: Van Blijderveen M., Joskin D., Garthoff J.
Title: Practical and theoretical potential of demand side management in SMEs to balance wind power
Source title: CIRED - Open Access Proceedings Journal
Affiliations: Liandon Energy Consulting and Alliander Innovation Realisation, Alliander, Arnhem, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Van Blijderveen, M., Liandon Energy Consulting and Alliander Innovation Realisation, Alliander, Arnhem, Netherlands; Joskin, D., Liandon Energy Consulting and Alliander Innovation Realisation, Alliander, Arnhem, Netherlands; Garthoff, J., Liandon Energy Consulting and Alliander Innovation Realisation, Alliander, Arnhem, Netherlands
Abstract: In this study, we have investigated both the theoretical and the practical potential of demand side management at small- and medium-enterprises (SMEs) to balance wind power. Our models and experiments indicate that the practical potential for demand side management for this goal is limited. This has several reasons: (i) the willingness and technical potential of SMEs to apply demand side response is limited; (ii) due to the wide variety of processes in SMEs, the application of demand side management demands custom made solutions, which makes large-scale application difficult; (iii) the available potential of demand side management is hardly suitable to follow the electricity production of wind turbines; (iv) the local balancing of wind power results in using more electricity at expensive moments and therefore higher energy costs. © 2017 The Institution of Engineering and Technology. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric utilities; Wind power; Wind turbines; Custom-made solutions; Demand side response; Electricity production; Energy cost; Large-scale applications; Local balancing; Small and medium enterprise; Technical potential; Demand side management

Authors: Zhang K., Song Y., Yan Z., Yu Y.
Title: Energy storage capacity optimisation for load aggregators considering the probability of demand response resources' breach
Source title: CIRED - Open Access Proceedings Journal
Affiliations: Power system technology department, Electric Power Research Institute, SMEPC, Shanghai, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, SJTU, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, K., Power system technology department, Electric Power Research Institute, SMEPC, Shanghai, China; Song, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, SJTU, Shanghai, China; Yan, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, SJTU, Shanghai, China; Yu, Y., Power system technology department, Electric Power Research Institute, SMEPC, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Load aggregators (LAs) aggregating demand-response resources to participate in market transactions will reduce the peak power demand and bring huge benefits to the power system. However, the uncertainty factors resulting from electricity users will exert an effect on its economic benefits. To compensate for power shortage, an energy storage capacity optimisation model is developed based on grading compensation rules. The bounded unresponsive load caused by customers' usage habits and subjectivity is represented by a truncated normal distribution model. Moreover, according to the percentage of unresponsive load, LAs are classified into four grades, facing different compensation standards and market admission rules. Through examples of Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) historical load data, it is proved that the model is capable of solving energy storage capacity optimisation problems for LAs to reduce the effects of unresponsive load. Besides, another conclusion can be drawn that rational market rules can spur LAs onto upgrade their resources, which will definitely contribute to stable and reliable market operation. © 2017 The Institution of Engineering and Technology. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Digital storage; Economic and social effects; Electric utilities; Grading; Normal distribution; Optimization; Compensation standards; Demand response resources; Energy storage capacity; Market transactions; Optimisation models; Optimisation problems; Truncated normal distributions; Uncertainty factors; Electric energy storage

Authors: Ma T., Wu J., Niu X.
Title: Reliability assessment indices and method for urban microgrid
Source title: CIRED - Open Access Proceedings Journal
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Haidian District, Beijing, 100044, China; EDF-Asia Pacific Branch-China Division, Henderson Center Tower 2, 18 Jianguomennei Avenue, Beijing, 100005, China

Abstract: To assess the reliability of urban microgrid, a set of novel reliability indices are proposed, including Microgrid System Important Load Average Interruption Frequency Index, Microgrid System Important Load Average Interruption Duration Index, Microgrid System Important Load Average Service Availability Index and Microgrid System Important Load Energy Not Service Index. Meanwhile, the Energy Storage Optimisation Degree Index is introduced to evaluate the optimal capacity of energy storage system to improve the microgrid reliability. To verify the effectiveness of these reliability indices, case studies are performed on the improved main feeder line 4 of IEEE RBTS 6 with the Monte Carlo simulation method. The simulation results demonstrate that novel indices and method are available for the reliability assessment of urban microgrid. © 2017 The Institution of Engineering and Technology. All rights reserved.

Authors: Niehoff R., Kuipers F., Stokman H.
Title: Adjustment of available and needed energy and necessary additional functionalities in the distribution grid, caused by the energy transition, can better be solved by DC distribution grids
Source title: CIRED - Open Access Proceedings Journal
Affiliations: Eaton Industries B.V., Hengelo, Netherlands; Direct Current B.V, Aalsmeer, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Niehoff, R., Eaton Industries B.V., Hengelo, Netherlands; Kuipers, F., Eaton Industries B.V., Hengelo, Netherlands; Stokman, H., Direct Current B.V, Aalsmeer, Netherlands
Abstract: As a result of the present energy transition, grid operators are facing problems caused from fast changes of (electronic) loads and their functionalities. With increasing usage of photovoltaic, electric vehicles, local storage, and de-centralised feed-in, the present AC distribution grid in the 'last mile' is not suitable anymore. Additional IT infrastructure for AC networks to manage demand and supply in a dynamic way is necessary. The latter is complex and with IT infrastructures, the failure sensitivity will increase. DC grids do not need additional IT infrastructure to solve congestion in the distribution grid. With a suitable DC grid, the energy supply and demand can be managed much better. With DC, it is also possible to create a meshed network, so that local feed-in of various sources can be managed as well. Naturally, DC introduces the necessity of additional and different type protection devices. Eaton's smart breakers and Direct Current B.V.'s current routers are specially designed for protecting DC grids. © 2017 The Institution of Engineering and Technology. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Economics; Electric utilities; Ac distribution grids; Demand and supply; Distribution grid; Energy supplies; Energy transitions; IT infrastructures; Meshed networks; Protection device; Vehicle-to-grid

Abstract: This study considers the effects of distributed energy storages on electricity distribution systems in the situation where the storages are used in system services such as frequency containment. Authors: Zanabria C., Andrén F.P., Kathan J., Strasser T.
Title: Approach for handling controller conflicts within multi-functional energy storage systems
Source title: CIRED - Open Access Proceedings Journal
Affiliations: AIT Austrian Institute of Technology, Seibersdorf, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Zanabria, C., AIT Austrian Institute of Technology, Seibersdorf, Austria; Andrén, F.P., AIT Austrian Institute of Technology, Seibersdorf, Austria; Kathan, J., AIT Austrian Institute of Technology, Seibersdorf, Austria; Strasser, T., AIT Austrian Institute of Technology, Seibersdorf, Austria
Abstract: The integration of modern energy storage systems (ESS) into power grids allows the implementation of different use cases (UCs). However, the simultaneous activation of such UCs could lead to potential conflicting behaviour. Hence, this study assesses the causes of conflicts within multi-functional ESS. A methodology for the identification and handling of conflicts is suggested using a model-driven architecture approach together with the well-known smart grid architecture model (SGAM). The main goal of this study is to demonstrate the usability of SGAM for the identification of potential controller conflicts. As a main result of this investigation, the SGAM alone does not allow the identification of all possible types of conflicts; it needs to be complemented by other models. © 2017 The Institution of Engineering and Technology. All rights reserved.

Authors: Alaoui C., Zineddine M., Nourddin S.
Title: Towards the implementation of refurbished ev lithium-ion batteries for smart grid energy storage
Source title: 2017 Intelligent Systems and Computer Vision, ISCV 2017
Affiliations: INSA, Euro-Méditerraneé, Université Euromed, Fès, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Alaoui, C., INSA, Euro-Méditerraneé, Université Euromed, Fès, Morocco; Zineddine, M., INSA, Euro-Méditerraneé, Université Euromed, Fès, Morocco; Nourddin, S., INSA, Euro-Méditerraneé, Université Euromed, Fès, Morocco
Abstract: This paper presents an energy storage system (ESS) suitable for the Smart Grids. Nowadays, smart grids suffer from peak demands of electricity, which pushes the utility companies to resort to fossil fuels to satisfy the peak demands. Fossil fuels, such as natural gas, are the main cause of the global warming. The project presented in this paper is about the design and implementation of an ESS made from disposed electric vehicle (EV) li-ion batteries. These batteries can hold up to 80% of their initial rated capacity. The proposed ESS uses load demand forecasting using exponential smoothing method. The forecasts produced by the Holt-Winters Taylor exponential smoothing are fed to a microcontroller that controls the charging and the discharging of the proposed ESS through a bidirectional AC-to-DC converter. The charging of the ESS happens at low demand of electricity, or when the renewable resources have an output. The discharge happens when there is a peak demand. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Ameur C., Faquir S., Yahyaouy A., Sabri M.A.
Title: An approach for revising a fuzzy logic controller using Q-learning algorithm
Source title: 2017 Intelligent Systems and Computer Vision, ISCV 2017
Affiliations: LIIAN Laboratory, Computer Science Department, College of Science Dhar Mehraz, Sidi Mohamed Ben Abdallah University, Fez, Morocco; Faculté de Sciences de l'Ingénieure, Université Priveé de Fès, Fez, Morocco

Abstract: The use of renewable energies along with the unexpected changes in load and the intermittence in power transmission lines may cause a voltage drop in a stand-alone system and challenge the reliability of the system. One way to indemnify the changing nature of renewable energies in the short term without the need to disconnect loads or turn on other plants is the energy storage. This paper proposes an improvement of a fuzzy logic controller adopted to manage the energy in a stand-alone renewable energy system using the Q-learning algorithm. All the fuzzy rules generated by the controller were based on expert knowledge which means that they are obtained on the basis of observations by human operators. Modified fuzzy rules using the Q-learning algorithm are proposed to incorporate the reinforcement and therefore, present an optimal method for charge and discharge the storage devices which are the batteries. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Multi-agent system based on the fuzzy control and extreme learning machine for intelligent management in hybrid energy system
Source title: 2017 Intelligent Systems and Computer Vision, ISCV 2017

Abstract: Given the current energy challenge, renewable energy appear as a real and strategic solution for electricity generation, but its intermittent nature requires us to combine two or more power sources to ensure continuity of electricity supply. In this paper we present a multi-agent system based on wind and photovoltaic power prediction using neural network trained by Extreme Learning Machine algorithm, to estimate the amount of photovoltaic and wind energy produced by photovoltaic panels and wind turbines respectively. This process aims to implement a hybrid renewable energy system with generation units (wind turbines and photovoltaic panels) and storage units (batteries). To address uncertainties in the system, we use a fuzzy logic technique to decide which auxiliary energy source will fill the need energetic. For the simulation, we use Java Agent Development Framework to implement the approach and analyze the results. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wang X., Yue Y., Cai Y.
Title: A modified fast matching pursuit algorithm based on signal energy property
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 IEEE 2nd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2017
Affiliations: School of Science, Xi'An Institute of High Technology, Xi'an, 710025, China; Faculty 502, Xi'An Institute of High Technology, Xi'an, 710025, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, X., School of Science, Xi'An Institute of High Technology, Xi'an, 710025, China; Yue, Y., School of Science, Xi'An Institute of High Technology, Xi'an, 710025, China; Cai, Y., Faculty 502, Xi'An Institute of High Technology, Xi'an, 710025, China
Abstract: Decomposition of signals over a series of time-frequency atoms by the Matching Pursuit (MP) algorithm has found many applications in signal processing and harmonic analysis. But traditional MP algorithm, such as the method based on inner product lib, are not able to handle high-dimension signal in a reasonable memory requirement and computational time. Benefit from the best time-frequency resolution of Gabor atoms, through building new dictionaries from the over-complete dictionary exploiting the structure of the signal energy property, a novel fast MP algorithm which can reduce computation and storage requirement dramatically is proposed to solve this problem. Simulation shows that the speed of the novel algorithm is more than 100 times faster than that of the traditional MP algorithm and verifies the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Gabor atoms; Matching Pursuit algorithm; Signal energy property
Index Keywords: Atoms; Time series analysis; Gabor atoms; Matching pursuit algorithms; Memory requirements; Over-complete dictionaries; Signal energy; Storage requirements; Time-frequency atoms; Time-frequency resolution; Signal processing

Authors: Jie C., Si-Ran L.
Title: IC engine vibration time-frequency analysis based on a novel fast matching pursuit algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 IEEE 2nd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2017
Affiliations: Tianjin Institute of High Technology, Tianjin, 300309, China; Wuhan Institute of High Technology, Wuhan, 430000, China
Authors with affiliations: Jie, C., Tianjin Institute of High Technology, Tianjin, 300309, China; Si-Ran, L., Wuhan Institute of High Technology, Wuhan, 430000, China
Abstract: Decomposition of signals over a series of time-frequency atoms by the Matching Pursuit (MP) algorithm has found many applications in signal processing and harmonic analysis, which shows a time-frequency distribution with good resolution and no cross-term and makes it clear to find out physical meanings of each component in the distribution. The internal combustion engine vibration response signal is a kind of complex non-stationary signal and has severe coupling, the large computation and storage requirement of the traditional MP algorithm limits its application in this field. Through building new dictionaries from the over-complete dictionary by exploiting the structure of the signal energy property, a novel fast MP algorithm which can reduce computation and storage requirement dramatically is proposed to solve this problem. The experiment proved that the computing speed of the proposed algorithm is significantly higher than the traditional algorithm and the time-frequency distribution verifies the effectiveness of this proposed algorithm. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Dictionary; IC engine; Matching Pursuit; Time-frequency distribution

Authors: Chang L., Wang Z., Zhang Y., Zhao W.
Title: Reconfigurable processing in memory architecture based on spin orbit torque
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Nanoscale Architectures, NANOARCH 2017
Affiliations: Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China; School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China
Authors with affiliations: Chang, L., Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China; Wang, Z., Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China; Zhang, Y., Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China; Zhao, W., Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, 100191, China
Abstract: Data intensive workloads increase significantly bandwidth and power pressures to the memory system. One possible solution is processing-in-memory (PIM) which moves several logic components into the main memory to accelerate the logic computation. Recently, the concept of processing-in-nonvolatile-memory (PINVM) was proposed to against the technology issue in which the DRAM and logic technology require different metal layer. In addition, PINVM has the potential to mitigates the thermal influence of 3D-Technology based PIM. Spin-orbit-Torque (SOT) Magnetoresistive Random Access Memory (MRAM) is one of promising NVMs with high energy-efficiency, fast switching, separate read/write paths etc. In this paper, we propose a concept of reconfigurable processing-in-SOT MRAM (PISOTM) architecture to integrate reconfigurable logic into non-volatile memory. We extend the existing main memory interface and modify the controller to obtained various arithmetic function. Several dataintensive workloads are selected to evaluate the performance of our proposed PISOTM architecture. The simulation results show that the proposed architecture can achieve high-speedup improvement. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: MRAM; Processing in Memory; Reconfigurable Logic; Spin Orbit Torque

Authors: Hossain N., Iqbal A., Shishupal H., Chowdhury M.H.
Title: Tunneling transistor based 6T SRAM bitcell circuit design in sub-10nm domain
Source title: Midwest Symposium on Circuits and Systems
Authors with affiliations: Hossain, N.; Iqbal, A.; Shishupal, H.; Chowdhury, M.H.
Abstract: The Static Random Access Memory (SRAM) directly impacts the performance of the modern multi-core processor. Hence, the power, performance and area metrics are very crucial for SRAM design. In this article, we have successfully designed 10 nm TFET based 6T SRAM circuit at reduced supply voltage of 0.5 V. We also have optimized the circuit for high density, high performance, intermediate (trade-off between high density, high performance) 6T SRAM application. Later, we have estimated the dynamic 'Read' power, 'Read' energy, 'Write' power, 'Write' energy. The performance metrics: 'Read' delay and 'Write delay' are also analyzed precisely. These power, energy, delay metrics are also compared against the existing 10nm FinFET. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Impact of increased deployment of distributed photovoltaic systems on power grid in Jordan: Challenges and potential solutions
Source title: 2017 10th Jordan International Electrical and Electronics Engineering Conference, JIEEEC 2017
Affiliations: Department of Biomedical Engineering, German Jordanian University, Amman, 11180, Jordan; Department of Electrical Engineering, Al-Ahliyyah Amman University, Amman, 19328, Jordan
Authors with affiliations: Kloub, H.A., Department of Biomedical Engineering, German Jordanian University, Amman, 11180, Jordan; Alkhatib, F., Department of Electrical Engineering, Al-Ahliyyah Amman University, Amman, 19328, Jordan
Abstract: In Jordan, electrical power demands trend is continuously increasing in the following decade. In 2030, the peak load is expected to achieve 7375 MW, which is 2.12 times higher than the power demands in 2016. Utilization of fuel local resources especially oil shale and renewable energy resources helps in securing the needs of the Jordanian power system to the generation capacity. Renewable energy is considered as one of the most of important alternative sources available in Jordan. The rate of renewable energy contribution to the total energy mix is expected to reach 15% in 2020. Increased deployment of distributed renewable energy systems will be subjected to challenges such as efficient management of 'duck-curve' dilemma and electrical harmonics. Therefore, potential solutions such as installation of energy storage systems and smart inverter with advanced functions should be considered in the development process of power grid capacity in Jordan. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage systems; grid integration; inverter; PV systems; renewable energy
Index Keywords: Electric power utilization; Energy resources; Energy storage; Oil shale; Photovoltaic cells; Renewable energy resources; Shale oil; Energy storage systems; Grid integration; inverter; PV system; Renewable energies; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Xu H.
Title: An analytical method to find the effect of storage time on solderability of Sn plating
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 11th International Conference on Reliability, Maintainability and Safety: Integrating Big Data, Improving Reliability and Serving Personalization, ICRMS 2016
Affiliations: China Electronic Product Reliability and Environmental Testing Institute (CEPREI), Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, H., China Electronic Product Reliability and Environmental Testing Institute (CEPREI), Guangzhou, China
Abstract: This paper mainly studied the effect of storage time on solderability of two kinds of Sn plating of flat gull wing leads on plastic package IC component. Design the aging test, and then use Xray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), wetting balance test and data analysis, to obtain storage of coating aging degree and the change of the terminal wetting balance. Consequently, provided the criterion for establish the logical storage term of components. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao K., Zhao Y., Liang J.
Title: A vibration-powered Bluetooth wireless sensor node with running PFC power conditioning
Source title: Proceedings - IEEE International Symposium on Circuits and Systems
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, K., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China; Zhao, Y., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China; Liang, J., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, 201210, China
Abstract: The kinetic energy harvesting technologies have attracted extensive research interests with the purpose to enable more distributed and wearable electronics to be powered by their surrounding mechanical vibrations or motions. The power conditioning circuit is of importance for harvesting more energy from the vibration source and better managing the energy storage and power users. This paper introduces the design and implementation of a vibration-powered Bluetooth wireless sensor node, whose power is acquired by a low-cost piezoelectric transducer and processed by a self-powered synchronized switch power conditioning circuit. Given the capacitive feature of the piezoelectric transducers and the irregular feature of most vibration sources, the power conditioning circuit realizes the running power factor correction (PFC), making the piezoelectric voltage in phase with the equivalent current source at every current zero-crossing. As a result, it can significantly enhance the energy harvesting capability. Detailed analysis on the power consumption shows the feasibility of this design. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Bluetooth; Electric power factor correction; Energy harvesting; Kinetic energy; Kinetics; Piezoelectric transducers; Piezoelectricity; Sensor nodes; Transducers; Wearable technology; Design and implementations; Equivalent currents; Piezoelectric voltage; Power conditioning; Power factor corrections; Research interests; Vibration sources; Wireless sensor node; Vibrations (mechanical)

Authors: Li Q., Wang G., Li K., Liu C.
Title: Design of the security alarm control system for LNG-fueled vessels
Source title: 2017 4th International Conference on Transportation Information and Safety, ICTIS 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China; Wuhan Jiao da New Energy Technology Co., Ltd, Wuhan, 400039, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, Q., China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China; Wang, G., Wuhan Jiao da New Energy Technology Co., Ltd, Wuhan, 400039, China; Li, K., China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China; Liu, C., China Waterborne Transport Research Institute, Beijing, 100088, China
Abstract: With the rapid growth of the economy, air pollution becomes increasingly serious and environment protection has attracted more attention. It is a fact that ships produce enormous air pollution emissions with high energy consumption and research has been constantly carried out on clean energy applications. LNG as an alternative clean marine fuel to run on ships is still at an initial stage. Different from traditional energy resources, LNG may generate risks in the process of application. Security alarm control system will effectively monitor risk sources preventing the occurrence of danger. Based on the deep analysis of the pros and cons of the existing structure and mode of security alarm control system of LNG-fueled vessels combined with the work and risk characteristics of marine engine, storage tanks and gas supply piping which have different danger sources, design a new type security alarm control system to optimize the structure design and logic control mode and implement functions of automatic detection, alarm and device control of combustible gas from risk sources. The system is stable and reliable with easy operation effectively reducing the risks of LNG-fueled ships. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: automatic control; combustible gas detection; LNG-fueled ships; Security alarm control system
Index Keywords: Air pollution; Alarm systems; Automation; Control; Control systems; Energy resources; Energy utilization; Marine engines; Pollution; Risk assessment; Safety engineering; Security systems; Ships; Automatic Detection; Combustible gas; Environment protection; Existing structure; High energy consumption; Pollution emissions; Risk characteristics; Structure design; Tankers (ships)

Authors: Zhuang J., Shen G., Yu J., Xiang T., Wang X.
Title: Micro-grid energy storage location and sizing optimization method based on demand response
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 International Conference on Intelligent Transportation, Big Data and Smart City, ICITBS 2016
Affiliations: Tianjin Electric Power Corporation, Tianjin, 300010, China; Tianjin Tianda Qiushi Electric Power High Technology Co., Ltd, Tianjin, 300384, China

Abstract: To reduce the initial cost of battery energy storage and build basic construction of smart city, this paper proposes an optimization method of battery energy storage location and sizing based on demand response. It builds the battery energy storage site and capacity model, whose objective is the life cost cycle, income by load shifting and decrease of line loss. Demand response is imported to the model, and it is solved by genetic algorithm. It uses 34-node micro-grid as the example, and compare with the ordinary model to prove that this method is effective. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Ji X., An R., Wang C.
Title: Quasi in situ study about growth kinetics of Ag3Sn at the interface of eutectic SnPb/electroplated Ag soder joint in the long-term satellite
Source title: 18th International Conference on Electronic Packaging Technology, ICEPT 2017
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; MicrolNano Technology Research Center, Harbin Institute OfTechnology, Harbin, China
Authors with affiliations: Ji, X., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China, MicrolNano Technology Research Center, Harbin Institute OfTechnology, Harbin, China; An, R., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China, MicrolNano Technology Research Center, Harbin Institute OfTechnology, Harbin, China; Wang, C., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China, MicrolNano Technology Research Center, Harbin Institute OfTechnology, Harbin, China
Abstract: The interfacial reaction and the growth kinetics of intermetallic compounds between 63Sn37Pb (wt.%) solder and the electroplated silver layer during the solid-state aging were studied in this paper. To measure the growth kinetics of Ag3Sn, the product of the interfacial reaction, more accurately, we used the quasi in situ method. And three same joints between solar cells and solder were annealed at 100°C, 120°C and 150°C for various aging durations. The results showed that the electroplated Ag layer gradually transformed into scalloped Ag3Sn, and the growth kinetics of Ag3Sn was a diffusion-controlled process during isothermal aging. Through measuring the thickness of Ag3Sn during the isothermal storage, the activation energy for IMC at eutectic SnPb solder/electroplated Ag layer interface was calculated and the result was 106 kJ/mole. On the basis of the growth kinetics, a correspondence between long-term thermal recycle and isothermal aging was presented. And the relation could be used to replace the long-term thermal recycle with accelerated annealing experiment, which would have a significant meaning for testing the reliability of low earth orbit satellites' solar cells. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: accelerated test; Ag3Sn; Growth kinetics; thermal shock
Index Keywords: Activation energy; Binary alloys; Electronics packaging; Eutectics; Intermetallics; Isotherms; Kinetics; Lead alloys; Orbits; Reaction kinetics; Recycling; Satellite communication systems; Silver; Solar cells; Soldering; Soldering alloys; Thermal shock; Thickness measurement; Tin alloys; Accelerated tests; Ag3Sn; Annealing experiments; Diffusion-controlled process; Isothermal aging; Isothermal storage; Low earth orbit satellites; Solid-state aging; Growth kinetics

Authors: Dong Y., Ding Y., Wang X., Wu G., Xiao B., Tian Y.
Title: A significant blocking effect of Ni plating layer on the diffusion of Zn element of brass substrate
Source title: 18th International Conference on Electronic Packaging Technology, ICEPT 2017
Affiliations: Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, 100190, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, HIT, Harbin, China
Authors with affiliations: Dong, Y., Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, 100190, China; Ding, Y., Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, 100190, China; Wang, X., Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, 100190, China; Wu, G., Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, 100190, China; Xiao, B., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, HIT, Harbin, China; Tian, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Welding and Joining, Harbin Institute of Technology, HIT, Harbin, China
Abstract: With the development of space electronic products, spacecraft electronic devices tend to diversify and the structures become complicated gradually. In addition, the tight expense control of electronic products promotes the localization of devices, In which a variety of domestic devices have been used. The brass(Cu-Zn alloy) pins plated with gold(Au) and tin lead(SnPb) layers have poor solderability and frequent quality problems after a period of storage. By comparison, the main difference between the domestic device and the imported device is the plating layer structure. In this study, 3 kinds of samples are used. By SEM(Scanning Electron Microscope), EDS(Energy Dispersive Spectrometer) and XPS(X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy) tests, it was found that the sample with nickel(Ni) plating layer and the copper(Cu) plating layer had the best wettability between the pin and the solder, and the relative content of Zinc(Zn) diffused from the brass in the Au plating layer was below 5%, which was lower than that in the sample with neither Ni plating layer nor Cu plating layer, about 10%. The formation of Zinc oxide(ZnO) on the surface of unplated sample was also confirmed. The conclusion is that the Ni plating layer and the Cu plating layer played a role of the barrier layer, which effectively prevented the diffusion of zinc from brass to the plating layer and the surface oxidation, which resulted in the nonwetting behavior between pins and Pb37Sn63 solder. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: barrier layer; brass; diffusion of Zn; Ni plating layer

Authors: Zhang Y., Zhan J., Yang J., Jiang W., Li L., Li Y.
Title: Energy-aware page replacement for NVM-based hybrid main memory system
Source title: RTCSA 2017 - 23rd IEEE International Conference on Embedded and Real-Time Computing Systems and Applications
Affiliations: School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; School of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; State Key Lab of Mathematical Engineering and Advanced Computing, Wuxi, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Zhan, J., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Yang, J., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Jiang, W., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China, State Key Lab of Mathematical Engineering and Advanced Computing, Wuxi, China; Li, L., School of Computer Science and Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Li, Y., School of Information and Software Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China
Abstract: With the advantage of low power consumption, Non-Volatile Memories (NVMs) has been widely used in hybrid memory architecture. This paper presents a page replacement method based on NVM-DRAM hybrid main memory system for low power and consistency guarantee, called EAPR The energy consumption of page access in DRAMs and NVMs can be calculated according to the memory access, and the pages are migrated according to their energy consumption, by which the pages are determined to migrate from NVM to DRAM or from DRAM to NVM. Instead of deleting the logs directly, our approach guarantees the consistency of the hybrid memory architecture by optimizing the structure of logs after the transactions of the applications are submitted. Finally, the experimental results show that EAPR can not only reduce the energy consumption at least 20% compared with other page replacement algorithms but also guarantee the consistency of transactions in the NVM-DRAM hybrid memory system. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Consistency guarantee; Energy consumption; NVM; Page replacement
Index Keywords: Data storage equipment; Embedded systems; Energy utilization; Memory architecture; Power management; Real time systems; Consistency guarantee; Hybrid main memory; Hybrid memory; Low-power consumption; Memory access; Non-volatile memory; Page replacement; Page replacement algorithms; Dynamic random access storage

Authors: Zhou Y., Zhao M., Ju L., Xue C.J., Li X., Jia Z.
Title: Energy-aware morphable cache management for self-powered non-volatile processors
Source title: RTCSA 2017 - 23rd IEEE International Conference on Embedded and Real-Time Computing Systems and Applications
Affiliations: School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China; Department of Computer Science, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, Hong Kong
Authors with affiliations: Zhou, Y., School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China; Zhao, M., School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China; Ju, L., School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China; Xue, C.J., Department of Computer Science, City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, Hong Kong; Li, X., School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China; Jia, Z., School of Computer Science and Technology, Shandong University, China
Abstract: Wearable, implantable and Internet of Things devices are attracting increasing attention from both research and industry. Energy harvesting is a promising alternative of battery to power these embedded systems. However, the intrinsic instability of energy harvesting systems leads to potential frequent power interruptions. In order to survive the power failures, non-volatile processor (NVP) is proposed to back up volatile information before power depletion and recover the system status after power resumes. Non-volatile memory (NVM) is typically attached for cache and main memory backup. There are researches working on optimization of the backup, however, little of them involve multiple level cell (MLC) NVM. In this work, we first discuss the benefit of applying MLC NVM for cache backup, and then propose a three-stage energy-aware cache management strategy to improve the system performance and energy utilization while guaranteeing successful backups. Evaluation shows that the proposed scheme can achieve 16.7% energy reduction with comparative performance with the single level cell (SLC) based hybrid cache. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Cache memory; Data storage equipment; Digital storage; Embedded systems; Energy harvesting; Energy utilization; Industrial research; Outages; Real time systems; Comparative performance; Energy harvesting systems; Energy reduction; Intrinsic instability; Multiple-level cells; Non-volatile memory; Power interruptions; Single level cells; Power management

Authors: Khan S.I., Raihan S.A., Habibullah M., Abrar S.F.
Title: Reducing the cost of solar home system using the data from data logger
Source title: 2017 IEEE International Conference on Smart Grid and Smart Cities, ICSGSC 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Khan, S.I., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Raihan, S.A., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Habibullah, M., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Abrar, S.F., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Abstract: Installation of small low cost Solar Home Systems are on the rise in remote off-grid rural areas of Bangladesh. Initial investment of this units is prohibitively high for poor population of the concerned areas. The major cost of each Solar Home System is the battery used for energy storage for the use of electricity during night time. Study reported in this paper indicates that resizing the storage battery in a stand-alone Solar Home System by using the in-situ solar radiation data of a year will reduce the cost. Significant cost savings will result from the resizing of the storage battery from 55 Ah to 30 Ah of each stand-alone Solar Home System being installed in off-grid rural areas of Bangladesh. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Li W., Li X., Li H.
Title: MEET-IP: Memory and energy efficient TCAM-based IP lookup
Source title: 2017 26th International Conference on Computer Communications and Networks, ICCCN 2017
Affiliations: School of Electronic and Computer Engineering, Peking University, China; Shenzhen Key Lab of Information Theory and Future Network Architecture, Future Network PKU Lab of National Major Research Infrastructure, Shenzhen Engineering Lab of Converged Networking Technology, Huawei and PKU Jointly Engineering Lab of Future Network Based on SDN, PKU Institute of Big Data Technology, Shenzhen Graduate School, Peking University, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, W., School of Electronic and Computer Engineering, Peking University, China; Li, X., School of Electronic and Computer Engineering, Peking University, China; Li, H., School of Electronic and Computer Engineering, Peking University, China, Shenzhen Key Lab of Information Theory and Future Network Architecture, Future Network PKU Lab of National Major Research Infrastructure, Shenzhen Engineering Lab of Converged Networking Technology, Huawei and PKU Jointly Engineering Lab of Future Network Based on SDN, PKU Institute of Big Data Technology, Shenzhen Graduate School, Peking University, China
Abstract: Ternary Content Addressable Memory (TCAM) is becoming very popular for designing high-throughput forwarding engines on most of today's high-end routers. Despite its capability for line-speed queries, it is very power hungry and capacity inefficient. Many recent research efforts, such as CoolCAMs and SmartPC, were proposed to reduce power consumption by constructing a pre-classifier to activate TCAM blocks selectively. However, these efforts achieve power savings at the expense of poor utilization of TCAM capacity, and the potential of power reduction is not fully exploited in many cases. In this paper, we propose MEET-IP, a memory and energy efficient two-stage scheme for TCAM based IP routing table lookup. Based on a top-down optimization of partitioning algorithm, routing tables can be evenly split into TCAM blocks without memory holes or a large amount of index TCAM. Experimental results based on real routing tables show that our design achieves more than 98% power reduction with a TCAM storage overhead of less than 3% on average. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: IP routing table lookup; Memory efficient; Power reduction; TCAM
Index Keywords: Computer networks; Energy efficiency; Internet protocols; Logic gates; Routers; Table lookup; IP routing; Memory efficient; Partitioning algorithms; Power reductions; Recent researches; Storage overhead; TCAM; Ternary content addressable memory; Ternary content adressable memory

Authors: Zhang Y., Zhang B., Zhang S.
Title: Lifetime Enhanced Relay Selection Scheme in wireless body area networks
Source title: IEEE CITS 2017 - 2017 International Conference on Computer, Information and Telecommunication Systems
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Integrated Services Networks, Xidian University, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Integrated Services Networks, Xidian University, Xi'an, China; Zhang, B., State Key Laboratory of Integrated Services Networks, Xidian University, Xi'an, China; Zhang, S., State Key Laboratory of Integrated Services Networks, Xidian University, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Network lifetime is of great importance in WBANs that significantly influences the network performance and user experience. Among all the solutions to extend the network lifetime, relay mechanism plays a crucial role. However, previous works only concentrate on energy efficiency of sensor nodes regardless of energy storage diversity among sensor nodes, which may severely limit the performance of enhancing the network lifetime of WBANs. In this paper, a Lifetime Enhanced Relay Selection Scheme is proposed under the topology constrains specified in IEEE 802.15.6 standard which considers both energy consumption rate and sensor's energy condition. Numerical results demonstrate that, compared to existing relay selection methods, the proposed scheme is more suitable for WBANs and has better performance in extending lifetime of WBANs. The simulation results also show that maximizing network lifetime is equivalent to equalizing the residual energy among sensor nodes. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: consumption rate; lifetime; relay selection; residual energy; Wireless Body Area Networks(WBANs)
Index Keywords: Energy efficiency; Energy utilization; Numerical methods; Sensor nodes; Telecommunication repeaters; Wireless networks; Consumption rates; lifetime; Relay selection; Residual energy; Wireless body area network; Wireless local area networks (WLAN)

Authors: Duong T.T., Do D.V., Nguyen T.T.
Title: Research on using PID algorithm to control simulation model of regenerative braking system based on driving cycles
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on System Science and Engineering, ICSSE 2017
Affiliations: Faculty of Vehicle and Energy Engineering, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology and Education, Viet Nam; Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology and Education, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Duong, T.T., Faculty of Vehicle and Energy Engineering, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology and Education, Viet Nam; Do, D.V., Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology and Education, Viet Nam; Nguyen, T.T., Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology and Education, Viet Nam
Abstract: This study will calculate and simulate the energy recovered during braking or deceleration of the traditional vehicle (KERU: Kinetic Energy Recovery Unit). Using PID controllers to control the simulation model base on driving cycles such as FTP75, NEDC, EUDC and ECE-R15. Simulation results in Matlab Simulink shown that the energy recovered can reach 4.8 kW.h depending on the velocity at the beginning of deceleration, the variation of the acceleration as well as the duration and distance of the driving cycle. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Truong N.C., Dang T.G., Nguyen D.A.
Title: Development and optimization of automated storage and retrieval algorithm in warehouse by combining storage location identification and route planning method
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on System Science and Engineering, ICSSE 2017
Affiliations: Mechatronics Engineering Department, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, Viet Nam; Ho Chi Minh City University of Transport, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Truong, N.C., Mechatronics Engineering Department, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, Viet Nam; Dang, T.G., Ho Chi Minh City University of Transport, Viet Nam; Nguyen, D.A., Mechatronics Engineering Department, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, Viet Nam
Abstract: Construction of efficient process for managing goods and reducing distance movement of goods to save energy are two important tasks in management warehouse. This paper will present a combination of building algorithms to determine storage location in storage and retrieval process as well as planning optimal route in each travel cycle of goods, their combination helps to manage the goods effectively and reduce travel distance. A built-in management software makes it easy to evaluate the effectiveness of the algorithms, simulated warehouse contains 160 storage locations divided into 4 lines. The algorithm is designed to increase the efficiency of warehouse management as well as the plan optimal route for goods. Simulation program written in c # with intuitive interface to make more convenient for users. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Nguyen V.C., Nguyen T.D., Le N.A., Phan D.Q.
Title: Implementation for indirect matrix converter fed open-end winding load using space vector pulse width modulation
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on System Science and Engineering, ICSSE 2017
Affiliations: Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Bach Khoa University, BKU-VNU, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Nguyen, V.C., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Bach Khoa University, BKU-VNU, Viet Nam; Nguyen, T.D., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Bach Khoa University, BKU-VNU, Viet Nam; Le, N.A., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Bach Khoa University, BKU-VNU, Viet Nam; Phan, D.Q., Faculty of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Bach Khoa University, BKU-VNU, Viet Nam
Abstract: In this paper, the structure of indirect matrix converter (IMC) is presented and the space vector pulse width modulation method (SVPWM) is analyzed to apply for this converter. The advantage point of IMC is directly connected a load to a three-phase power source using six bidirectional switches and twelve unidirectional switches without using any intermediate energy storage element. IMC stands out with low input harmonic, while compact design. The main study idea is combining between an IMC and a dual two-level inverter for an open-end winding load to enhance the converter output quality as well as kept the IMCs advantage. The SVPWM is sequentially analyzed for rectifier and inverter stage to generate the switching pattern for the converter. Finally, experiment result is shown to demonstrate the reality of topology. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Meza H.M., Rodriguez-Martinez M.
Title: Cloud-Based and Big Data-Enabled Brokerage System for Smart Grids
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 IEEE 6th International Congress on Big Data, BigData Congress 2017
Affiliations: ECE Department, University of Puerto Rico, Mayagüez, Puerto Rico
Authors with affiliations: Meza, H.M., ECE Department, University of Puerto Rico, Mayagüez, Puerto Rico; Rodriguez-Martinez, M., ECE Department, University of Puerto Rico, Mayagüez, Puerto Rico
Abstract: Electric energy networks provide the energy necessary to carry out daily operations in education, health care, commerce, entertainment, defense, and government. Smart grids (SG) have been proposed as a mechanism to modernize and facilitate the operation of energy grids in the presence of multiple third-parties vying to sell electricity and related services. Recently, a new concept has emerged in relation with SG: transactive energy - a framework to integrate and coordinate multiple independent suppliers of electric services in an economic marketplace that enables purchases in a way that obeys the physical constrains of the underlying energy grid. Our team is developing a transactive energy framework called Open Access Smart Grids (OASIS). OASIS features a distribution-level marketplace where the underlying electric resources and services are open to access and provisioned by third parties. In this paper, we present a cloudbased and big data-enabled brokerage system for Smart grids, which is a critical component of OASIS. In this brokerage system, consumer energy requests, and energy bids issued by producers, are collected and matched to find a list of energy purchase orders to be dispatched to the winning producers. A central piece in the system is an energy broker software agent, which drives the bidding process. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: broker system; energy market; internet of things; smart grids
Index Keywords: Big data; Commerce; Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Internet of things; Purchasing; Sales; Software agents; broker system; Critical component; Distribution levels; Electric energies; Electric services; Energy markets; Physical constrains; Smart grid; Smart power grids

Authors: Gong Z., Qiu K., Chen W., Ni Y., Xu Y., Yang J.
Title: Pipeline optimizations of architecting STT-RAM as registers in rad-hard environment
Source title: Proceedings - 16th IEEE International Conference on Trust, Security and Privacy in Computing and Communications, 11th IEEE International Conference on Big Data Science and Engineering and 14th IEEE International Conference on Embedded Software and Systems, Trustcom/BigDataSE/ICESS 2017
Affiliations: Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Big Data and Brain Computing (BDBC), School of Computer Science and Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Gong, Z., Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Qiu, K., Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Chen, W., Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Ni, Y., Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Xu, Y., Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Imaging Technology, Information Engineering College, Capital Normal University, Beijing, China; Yang, J., Fert Beijing Research Institute, Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Big Data and Brain Computing (BDBC), School of Computer Science and Engineering, Beihang University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Electromagnetic radiation effects can cause several types of errors on traditional SRAM-based registers such as single event upset (SEU) and single event functional interrupt (SEFI). Especially in aerospace where radiation is quite intense, the stability and correctness of systems are greatly affected. By exploiting the beneficial features of high radiation resistance and non-volatility, spin-transfer torque RAM (STT-RAM), a kind of emerging nonvolatile memory (NVM), is promising to be used as registers to avoid errors caused by radiation. However, substituting SRAM with STT-RAM in registers will affect system performance because STT-RAM suffers from long write latency. The early write termination (EWT) method has been accepted as an effective technique to mitigate write problems by terminating redundant writes. Based on the above background, this paper proposes to build registers by STT-RAM for embedded systems in rad-hard environment. Targeting the microarchitecture level of pipeline, the impact of architecting STT-RAM-based registers is discussed considering data hazard due to data dependencies. Furthermore, integrated with the EWT technique, a Read Merging method is proposed to eliminate redundant normal reads or sensing reads which are conducted along with a write. As a result of carrying out these actions, the energy and performance can be improved greatly. The results report 68% (and 75%) and 32% (and 39%) improvements on performance (and energy) by the proposed Read Merging method compared to the cases where STT-RAM is naively used as registers and intelligently used by integrating EWT, respectively. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Big data; Data privacy; Electromagnetic waves; Embedded software; Embedded systems; Merging; Pipelines; Radiation effects; Radiation hardening; Random access storage; Static random access storage; Data dependencies; Emerging non-volatile memory; High radiation resistance; Micro architectures; Nonvolatility; Pipeline optimization; Single event upsets; Spin transfer torque; Data communication systems

Authors: Zhao R., Meng Z., Zheng Y., Jin Q., Ruan A., Xie H.
Title: SOMR: Towards a security-oriented mapreduce infrastructure
Source title: Proceedings - 16th IEEE International Conference on Trust, Security and Privacy in Computing and Communications, 11th IEEE International Conference on Big Data Science and Engineering and 14th IEEE International Conference on Embedded Software and Systems, Trustcom/BigDataSE/ICESS 2017
Affiliations: School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China; Octa Innovations Ltd., Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, R., School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China; Meng, Z., School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China; Zheng, Y., School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China; Jin, Q., School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China; Ruan, A., Octa Innovations Ltd., Beijing, China; Xie, H., School of Computer Software, Tianjin University, China
Abstract: MapReduce system over a cloud computing infrastructure has made an extensive use in the field of finance, medical health, scientific research, traffic, energy and so on which attracts more and more attention on the security of the platform. Due to the sensitivity of the data in these fields, the user suffers great threat on their privacy and security. And the wrong results produced by the MapReduce platform may mislead the user to a big disaster. Current solutions mainly focus on the procedure of encryption before transmission and storage and decryption when processing. However, these solutions cannot prevent the user data stolen by the data processing program and the wrong result produced by the platform. In this paper, we propose a Security-Oriented MapReduce (SOMR) infrastructure that integrates the big-data processing framework, key management system and trusted computing infrastructure to ensure the security of every operation. While big data processing framework controls the life cycle of the cloud computing platform, key management system provides the trust assurance of encryption and trusted computing infrastructure makes measurable verification on the platform, SOMR presents a persistent security guarantee on the user data and processing results. We implemented SOMR on the infrastructure of OpenStack with Sahara, Barbican and OAT. The evaluations on our prototype showed that the platform can resist many typical attacker behaviors, and the overheads can be reduced to a very low level. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: MapReduce Security; Security of data; Security-oriented infrastructure; Trusted big data platform; Trusted cloud computing
Index Keywords: Cloud computing; Computer privacy; Cryptography; Data communication systems; Data handling; Data privacy; Digital storage; Distributed computer systems; Embedded software; Embedded systems; Information management; Life cycle; Network function virtualization; Security of data; Trusted computing; Cloud computing infrastructures; Cloud computing platforms; Computing infrastructures; Data platform; Key management systems; Map-reduce; Security-oriented infrastructure; Trusted clouds; Big data

Title: Proceedings - 2017 IEEE 1st International Conference on Edge Computing, EDGE 2017
