Authors: Fu C., Lin J., Song Y., Zhou Y., Mu S.
Title: Model predictive control of an integrated energy microgrid combining power to heat and hydrogen
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiana University, Hangzhou, China; National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy, Beijng, China
Authors with affiliations: Fu, C., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Lin, J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Song, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiana University, Hangzhou, China; Zhou, Y., National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy, Beijng, China; Mu, S., National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy, Beijng, China
Abstract: With rapid development and high penetration of distributed generations (DG), energy storage devices (ESD) are becoming more important in nowadays integrated energy systems. Hydrogen takes a potential role in the future ESDs due to its cleanness and high energy density. Convert electricity into hydrogen is a relatively mature technology named the Power to Hydrogen (P2H). But during the conversion process, only 60% ∼ 70% consumed electricity is converted into hydrogen. To overcome the efficiency limitation of traditional P2H process, this paper proposes a P2HH (Power to Heat and Hydrogen) concept which not only works as a flexible load consuming the residual electricity, but also supplies extra heat partly instead of the gas boilers for the heat load. Temperature plays an important role in the efficiency management of P2HH, because it directly influences the proportion of power to Hydrogen and power to Heat. When applying in an integrated energy microgrid (P2HH-MG), P2HH could help increase the whole system efficiency in spite of the possible efficiency decrease of the P2H process. A MPC control strategy is adopted in this P2HH-MG to test the optimal economical operation. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: MPC; Power to Heat and Hydrogen (P2HH); Temperature control
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Predictive control systems; Temperature control; Conversion process; Economical operation; Efficiency limitations; Efficiency managements; Energy storage devices (ESD); High energy densities; Integrated energy systems; Power to Heat and Hydrogen (P2HH); Model predictive control

Authors: He X., Ji H., Song Y., Song G., Cai H., Mi Y.
Title: Voltage stability control for DC microgrid with energy storage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China
Authors with affiliations: He, X., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China; Ji, H., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China; Song, Y., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China; Song, G., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China; Cai, H., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China; Mi, Y., Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, 200090, China
Abstract: In order to maintain the bus voltage stability of isolated DC microgrid, it is necessary to configure the energy storage system (ESS) to realize the balance of energy supply and demand. When there are multiple energy storage units (ESUs) in the dc microgrid, the overcharge or over discharge is avoided. Therefore, a new adaptive droop control is proposed according to the state of charge (SOC). Once the ESS is out of work due to fault or fully charged, the renewable energy source needs to switch from the maximum power point tracking (MPPT) mode to the droop control mode. Meanwhile, the demand side power is distributed automatically by renewable energy source according to its maximum output power, which can assure the bus voltage stability. The proposed strategy can be verified through real time digital simulator (RTDS) in an isolated DC microgrid. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: adaptive droop control; bus voltage; DC microgrid; energy storage
Index Keywords: Economics; Electric fault currents; Energy storage; Maximum power point trackers; Natural resources; Bus voltage; Dc micro-grid; Droop control; Energy storage systems; Maximum Power Point Tracking; Real time digital simulator; Renewable energy source; Voltage stability controls; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Miao J., Zhang H., Tong C., Ding J., Lu Z.
Title: Optimal operation for CCHP with phase-change energy storage and demand response considerations
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Suzhou Power Supply Company, Suzhou, 215004, China; State Key Lab. of Power Systems, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Miao, J., State Grid Suzhou Power Supply Company, Suzhou, 215004, China; Zhang, H., State Grid Suzhou Power Supply Company, Suzhou, 215004, China; Tong, C., State Grid Suzhou Power Supply Company, Suzhou, 215004, China; Ding, J., State Grid Suzhou Power Supply Company, Suzhou, 215004, China; Lu, Z., State Key Lab. of Power Systems, Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Energy internet and energy system integration with multi-energy complementation are vital developing directions of future energy supply systems. Combined cooling, heating and power(CCHP) realizes the coupling use of various forms of energy, and is one of the fundamental elements of the energy internet. During the concentrated CCHP operation analysis, due to the restriction of the fixed heat-electricity ratio, the coordination of the system and the combustion units will greatly impact the running efficiency of concentrated CCHP. In this paper, optimal operation strategy for the concentrated CCHP with the incorporation of the phase-change energy storage devices is analyzed. The flexible load participating in the demand response is also taken into consideration. On this basis, the economy objective function of CCHP is established and the units' output is scheduled. The results of an example in a micro grid applying CCHP show that the energy consumption is reduced, and the working efficiency of the system is improved. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: combined cooling; demand response; Energy internet; heating and power(CCHP); phase-change energy storage
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Energy utilization; Combined cooling; Demand response; Energy internet; Heating and power; Phase change energy storage; Energy efficiency

Authors: Chen Y., Jing T.-J., Yi K., Xue L.
Title: An improved control method of high density distributed generation access to power distribution network
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, Y., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Jing, T.-J., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Yi, K., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Xue, L., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China
Abstract: As the proportion of intermittent renewable in the distribution network increased, control of distribution network becomes more difficult. An improved control strategy that combining droop and anti-droop control method is put forward in the paper. The reference point of voltage and frequency adopts droop control method. In response to voltage and frequency adjustment, WTG (wind turbine generator), PV and Energy storage device adopt anti-droop control method. In those processes of DG start-up and stop, generator source change, line failure and load cutting, the strategy can adjust the power automatically between generator and load, suppress voltage and frequency disturbance, and maintain distribution network operation stability. The proposed strategy is verified to be valid in the transient process of the system through the simulation results. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: anti-droop control; coordinated control; distributed generation; droop control; simulation
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Co-ordinated control; Distribution network operation; Droop control; Droop control method; Frequency adjustment; Frequency disturbances; Power distribution network; simulation; Distributed power generation

Authors: Chen Y., Yang Z., Guo L., Huang X., Wang Y.
Title: A composite estimation method for state of charge of batteries in a power station engineering
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Abstract: An energy storage power station combines with photovoltaic system, and the main role of power station are following time-of-use power price and smoothing photovoltaic power fluctuations. The energy storage batteries are the main part of the power station engineering. And the important parameters of batteries are voltage, current, temperature, state of charge (SOC) and so on. Among this parameters, the SOC is the most important parameter. This paper uses a composite method to estimate the SOC, which is the Extended Kalman estimation method combine the Ah integral and the Open Circuit Voltage method. And it finally verifies that this composite algorithm has a high accuracy, and the error within 6% in a power station engineering. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Ye J., Xue J., Wang D., Yin W., Chen M., Liu H.
Title: Design of an iterative bidding mechanism based regulation service contract market including energy storage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ye, J., New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Xue, J., New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Wang, D., New Energy Research Department, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Yin, W., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Chen, M., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Liu, H., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Great challenges has been put on ancillary services in electric power system, especially with the penetration of renewable energy generation. Bulk battery energy storage systems (ESS) has gain a worldwide population due to its high quality of regulation in recent years. In this paper, we focus on design of regulation service contract market, which is applicable for both traditional generators and ESS. To guarantee market fairness and make full use of high quality regulation resources, group bidding is introduced, meaning that resource acquisition is carried out through several bidding sections with different requirements for regulation performance. Transaction model in each section is established. Then, iterative bidding mechanism is also used so that market members are licensed to negotiate with each other, which makes final market clearing prices close to real regulation cost. A numeral example is studied to illustrate feasibility and merits of the proposed market mechanism, and then market benefit under this market mechanism for BESS is analyzed briefly. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ancillary service; contract markets; energy storage; Iterative bidding mechanism
Index Keywords: Contracts; Costs; Electric power systems; Energy storage; Maintenance; Renewable energy resources; Ancillary service; Battery energy storage systems; Contract markets; Iterative bidding mechanism; Market Clearing Price; Regulation services; Renewable energy generation; Resource acquisition; Commerce

Abstract: Making use of the characteristics of complementation of renewable energy, a new optimal control strategy for microgrid is proposed to choose the appropriate opening capacity of distributed energy such as wind power, photovoltaic, gas turbine and energy storage system. According to this strategy, this paper realizes analysis and evaluation of capacity optimization through establishing mathematical model. Then the optimal operation plan is solved by means of multi-objective optimization algorithm. Finally, a numerical example shows the applicability of the strategy. The optimal ratio of multi power supply is realized to guide engineering construction. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Liu Y., Xu Y., Li J., Kang M., Wang P.
Title: Dynamic SOC estimation method of energy storage battery against load power change
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Army Engineering University of PLA, Nanjing, China; Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Jiangsu Collaborative Innovation Center for Smat Distribution Network, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Y., Army Engineering University of PLA, Nanjing, China; Xu, Y., Army Engineering University of PLA, Nanjing, China; Li, J., Army Engineering University of PLA, Nanjing, China; Kang, M., Army Engineering University of PLA, Nanjing, China; Wang, P., Nanjing University of Science and Technology, Jiangsu Collaborative Innovation Center for Smat Distribution Network, Nanjing, China
Abstract: The existing definition of state of charge (SOC) cannot calculate under the circumstance of variable current or long-time heavy load discharge. Accordingly, it is necessary to propose a SOC definition based on energy theory. SOC is divided into static SOCs and dynamic SOCd to be applied the calculation of SOC in varied cases of energy storage battery. On this basis, considering the stored energy during the operation process is reduced constantly and the load power changes, dynamic SOCd estimation method is proposed. On a basis of experimental data on batteries carrying varied power loads, the algorithm fits the energy function of battery energy release with the changes of load power. According to the related standards, standard load is chosen. Refer to the definition of SOCS proposed in the preamble, the present stored energy of battery is calculated, the residual capacity from battery discharge until cut-off condition is solved, and estimation of dynamic SOCd is realized finally. As common energy storage equipment, the vanadium redox flow battery (VRB) is cited for experimental verification. The experiment proves that the method is easy to be implemented with less error. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: definition of state of charge (SOC); dynamic SOC estimation; energy storage battery; microgrid

Abstract: This optimizes DG operation performance by using hybrid-energy-storage-based adjustable DG control strategy according to distribution characteristics of DG. By improving droop control, it realizes the stable operation of micro grid in islanding & connected-grid operation statuses and smooth switch between the two operation statuses. Based on multiple-agent micro grid layered control strategy, it conducts micro grid layered control in network composed of multiple micro power supplies. Finally, by using the optimized control algorithm of multiple-agent distribution theory, it studies various distribution types of power supply optimization control strategies in micro grids, puts forward strategy and method of coordinated optimization control for multiple power supplies in micro grids, solves the optimized control of power distribution network with access of multiple micro grids and improves the effective use rate of renewable energy resources. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Optimal operation of multi-energy systems in distributed energy network considering energy storage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Abstract: Multi-energy system in distributed energy network consists of distributed heating, cooling, generation and other sub systems. This paper presented a multi-objective optimal scheduling strategy of multi-energy system which based on load forecast data and tight coupling for the relationship of supply and demand. According to different load characteristics, heat and cold energy storage energy hubs were designed. The multi-objective optimization strategy included that operational economic and comprehensive energy efficiency as multi-objective. The multi-objective model was performed based on two partial and global optimization scenarios in distributed energy network, which solved though the improved NAGA-II algorithm. A case study shows are carried out to examine the performance of the optimal scheduling strategy, which can effectively manage multi-energy in distributed energy network. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Optimal strategy of combined operation of wind, solar and storage units
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Chen, Q., Dept. Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Recently, considering the new round of deregulation and reform of power industry and the rapid development of renewables in China, it is of great importance to study the optimal bidding strategy of combined operation of wind, solar units and energy storage systems participating in the electricity markets, thereby making the renewable generation companies more competitive and improving more renewable integrations. Therefore, the profit-maximization problem of joint wind, solar units and energy storage systems is established in this paper and various technical constraints of renewables units and storages are considered, to optimize the generation outputs and scheduling in the market-based environment. Then, numerical examples are implemented to validate the optimal scheduling problem of joint wind, solar units and energy storage systems and to analyze the advantages of optimal strategy of the combined operation mode. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Island operation control strategy for BESS in parallel based on droop control
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

LTD, Haerbin, China; Bian, E., Heilongjiang Electric Power Co. LTD, Haerbin, China; Kang, C., Heilongjiang Electric Power Co. LTD, Haerbin, China
Abstract: During island operation, Micro-grid requires that battery energy storage systems in Parallel can distribute power reasonably. As load increases, the energy storage system needs to expand capacity, while reducing power consumption, and realizing the plug and play technology. Based on droop control, this paper analyzed the factors that affect the power sharing when the energy storage system is connected in parallel, and designed the method of proportionally distributing the power of the energy storage system. Finally, this paper established the simulation model under Matlab/Simulink, and hardware-in-the-loop experiments were build on the RT-LAB platform. The simulation and experimental results are provided to verify the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Sun M., Gui X.
Title: Optimal configuration of battery energy storage system for one hour independent power supply for specific loads
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 23009, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, M., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 23009, China; Gui, X., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, 23009, China
Abstract: In the new energy power generation intensive access area, the problem that the new energy power generation has strong random and intermittent cannot be ignored. The rational allocation of battery energy storage system can play a role in absorbing new energy surplus power generation, stabilizing new energy power generation fluctuation, improving power quality, reducing power load peak and filling trough load and so on. In addition, it can provide a certain length of emergency power support when unplanned outages occur in the areas where the multi-complementary energy device is running. In this paper, the mathematical model of economic benefit of energy storage system is established with the aim of the maximum annual return on investment of energy storage system in its whole life cycle. The model is optimized by extracting the key influence factors, and the economic benefit under different configuration schemes is analyzed under the premise of one hour independent power supply for the specific loads, and the optimal allocation scheme of the energy storage system is obtained. An example is given to analyze the energy storage scheme and the annual return on investment of the Pb-C battery energy storage system at different discharge depths during the typical working days. The feasibility of the model and the solution method is verified. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Research on application of integrated energy planning for island

Abstract: Micro-grid technology is becoming widely used in island power supply. And micro-grid applications are often considered for single energy-electricity energy. The research in island energy systems plan becomes an urgent requirement. In this document, a kind of energy configuration method is introduced. Based in variety of energy requirement, this integrated method compare with several scheme, evaluate of the indicators of whole system. Method of micro-grid of island design and evaluate is introduced. In this paper, the related micro-grid system is analyzed the operation of various energy sources, to achieve an integrated application of energy on the island. © 2017 IEEE.

Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Authors with affiliations: Song, Y., State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment and System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; Luo, J., State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment and System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; Luo, Y., State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment and System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China
Abstract: Micro-grid is a small power grid consisting of micro power, energy storage equipment, control devices and loads. In the resource shortage, environmental problems, power grid security and many other pressures, the concept of micro-grid once put forward quickly by the country's attention, become a hot issue. At the same time, with the gradual deepening of micro-grid research, micro-grid operation and island operation has become an urgent need to solve the problem. In this paper, the dynamic simulation model of photovoltaic power generation, permanent magnet direct drive wind power generation, micro gas turbine, fuel cell and battery is established. The correctness of the simulation model established in this paper is verified, which lays the foundation for the economic optimization of micro-grid by using PSCAD / EMTDC software. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed generation; island operation; microgrid

Authors: Wang Z., Luo D., Li R., Zhang L., Liu C., Tian X., Li Y., Su Y., He J.
Title: Research on the active power coordination control system for wind/photovoltaic/energy storage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Shaanxi Electric Power Corporation, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, shannxi, China; State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; State Grid Beijing Electric Power Corporation, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, Z., Shaanxi Electric Power Corporation, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, shannxi, China; Luo, D., Shaanxi Electric Power Corporation, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, shannxi, China; Li, R., Shaanxi Electric Power Corporation, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, shannxi, China; Zhang, L., Shaanxi Electric Power Corporation, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, shannxi, China; Liu, C., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Tian, X., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Li, Y., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Su, Y., State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; He, J., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Corporation, Beijing, China
Abstract: The renewable energy can't respond the frequency change of system because of the use of converters and its control systems, which has become a novel challenge to frequency stability of system with large-scale renewable energy. The paper give an active power coordination control system for wind/photovoltaic/energy storage system, whose principle is analyzed. When the system frequency decreases, the wind/photovoltaic/energy storage system should increase output active power, then the renewable energy is firstly used to increase output active power. When the system frequency increases, the wind/photovoltaic/energy storage system should decrease output active power, then the energy storage is firstly used to decrease output active power. The effectiveness of the proposed control can be proved. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: active power coordination control; energy storage; frequency stability; photovoltaic; wind turbine
Index Keywords: Control systems; Energy storage; Frequency stability; Wind turbines; Active power; Frequency changes; Photovoltaic; Renewable energies; Storage systems; System frequency; Power control

Authors: Qian Y., Zhang Y., Tang Y., Ye P.
Title: Mathematical modeling and control optimization for energy internet
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: NARI Technology Co. Ltd., Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Qian, Y., NARI Technology Co. Ltd., Nanjing, China; Zhang, Y., NARI Technology Co. Ltd., Nanjing, China; Tang, Y., NARI Technology Co. Ltd., Nanjing, China; Ye, P., NARI Technology Co. Ltd., Nanjing, China
Abstract: With the development of Energy Internet in recent years, the rapid promotion of new energy emerging facilities highlights the trend of the future energy interconnection. Under the system architecture, renewable energy and grid, energy storage, energy deployment and transportation problems require a flexible grid scheduling strategy to deal with complex consumer tasks. The optimization of electric-gas-thermal mixed energy supply system is an effective way to solve the rational allocation of energy. Optimizing the network power flow can not only improve the efficiency of energy utilization, Optimizing the network power flow can not only improve the efficiency of energy use, but also minimize network redundancy through the high degree of coupling. In this paper, the mathematical model of multi-energy load is established under the framework of advanced measurement system and energy Internet. Based on the load forecasting of LMBP algorithm, an optimal genetic algorithm is used to solve the establishment of an example to achieve optimal allocation of multi-energy flow and capacity allocation. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: coordination control; Energy Internet; LMBP; mathematical modeling; multi-energy flow
Index Keywords: Energy efficiency; Energy utilization; Genetic algorithms; Mathematical models; Coordination control; Energy internet; Energy supply system; LMBP; Modeling and control; Multi energy; System architectures; Transportation problem; Electric load flow

Authors: Guo X., Zheng J.
Title: Optimization configuration method for microgrid based on electric energy router
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Guo, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Zheng, J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The electric energy router (EER) based on power electronic transformation technology provides a flexible and diversified electrical interface for micro-grid. This paper presents a typical microgrid model based on EER in which every electronic converter's efficiency curve is segmented according to its output level. Based on the microgrid model, an optimization configuration method to minimize the loss of the microgrid system is presented. The method uses genetic algorithm and it can configure the proportion of electric energy storage system (ESS) and photovoltaic (PV) system on the DC side and the AC side. The optimization method is compared with traditional optimization method. The results show that the proposed method is more efficient and flexible than the traditional configuration method in complex scenarios. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: efficiency curve; Electric energy router; genetic algorithm; microgrid; optimization
Index Keywords: Genetic algorithms; Optimization; Efficiency curves; Electric energies; Electrical interface; Electronic converters; Electronic transformations; Micro grid; Optimization method; Photovoltaic systems; Curve fitting

Authors: Chan C.C., Zhou G.Y., Zhang D.
Title: Intelligent energy ecosystem based on carbon neutrality
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, Hong Kong; National Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chan, C.C., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, Hong Kong; Zhou, G.Y., National Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China; Zhang, D., National Institute of Clean and Low Carbon Energy, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper proposes a new concept of energy ecosystem over traditional energy system by introducing carbon material cycling from carbon neutrality perspective. Based on energy application pattern in modern society from industry, transportation and building, we derived a four steps road map for sustainable energy ecosystem development, which are defined as Digitization of Energy, Network of Energy, Internet of Energy and Intelligence of Energy. Due to the shortage of massive energy storage, sustainability is difficult to be built upon existing multi-energy network that is vulnerable to the large intermittence of renewable. Instead, proposed ecosystem can introduce the possibility to store and distribute energy into the carbon material to build a controllable carbon cycle into energy system. Thanks to the cloud-fog-mist platform development based on the latest IoT technology, a fractal control structure is derived to be able to include distributed intelligence algorithms across energy ecosystem, as found in the self-sustained natural ecosystem. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Carbon Neutrality; Energy Ecosystem; Fractal; Internet of Energy
Index Keywords: Carbon; Fractals; Carbon neutralities; Distributed intelligence; Ecosystem development; Energy applications; Intelligent energies; Massive energy storages; Platform development; Sustainable energy; Ecosystems

Authors: Chen D., Bao Z., Guo X., Zhang Q.
Title: Mitigating uncertain RESs in integrated energy system considering line pack of gas
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Authors with affiliations: Chen, D.; Bao, Z.; Guo, X.; Zhang, Q.
Abstract: With the integrated energy system becoming a focus of research and application, its flexibility and stability has become a major issue, facing the uncertainties due to the increasing penetration of RESs (renewable energy sources). In this paper, for the electrical-hydraulic-thermal-gas integrated energy system, considering the fact that the gas can be stored in large quantities in pipelines, a method to mitigate the RESs uncertainties by utilizing the line pack storage of gas pipeline is developed. The multi-energy flow model of the electrical-hydraulic-thermal-gas integrated energy system is established, in which line pack storage of natural gas is described. A decomposed sequential multi-energy flow calculation approach is employed to calculate the energy flows. A case study of the integrated energy system illustrates the effectiveness of the proposed method for dealing with the RESs uncertainties in short-term operation by adjusting the average pressure within natural gas pipeline. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Integrated energy system; multi-energy flow; natural gas network; pressure; uncertainty
Index Keywords: Electromagnetic wave emission; Natural gas; Natural gas pipelines; Pressure; Renewable energy resources; Energy flow; Focus of researches; Integrated energy systems; Multi energy; Natural gas networks; Renewable energy source; Short-term operation; uncertainty; Gases

Authors: Song L., Yin X., Meng L., Gao F., Han Y., Jiao Y., Fan H., Liu Y.
Title: Analysis of micro-grid integration with PV, energy storage and ground-source heat pump based on DeST simulation
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Abstract: In this paper, DeST (Designer's Simulation Toolkits) was applied to simulate the energy consumption of the solar heat storage micro-grid system in Shijiazhuang. Based on the mechanical loss, the heat loss, the utilization rate of the delay time, the energy consumption of the ground-source heat pump coupled with the PV array in the micro-grid system was reasonably calculated. In this case, the economic benefit will be greatly improved in the micro-grid area. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Dong K., Han S., Dong H., Shen W., Zhao W.
Title: Capacity allocation of hybrid energy storage system based on VMD-GRGC ensemble methods
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Gansu Electric Power Corp, Lanzhou, China; School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China; School of New Energy and Power Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Dong, K., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Gansu Electric Power Corp, Lanzhou, China; Han, S., School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China; Dong, H., School of New Energy and Power Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China; Shen, W., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Gansu Electric Power Corp, Lanzhou, China; Zhao, W., State Grid Gansu Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Gansu Electric Power Corp, Lanzhou, China
Abstract: The hybrid energy storage system (HESS) consists of energy storage and power storage, is an effective solution to smooth the fluctuation of wind power. This paper proposed a means using variational mode decomposition (VMD) and grey relational grades cluster (GRGC) to obtain power and capacity allocation of HESS. First, moving average filtering was used to obtain the grid connected power and the reference power of HESS. The reference power of HESS was decomposed into subsequences by means of VMD, and the GRGC is used to reconstruct the subsequences into low frequency and high frequency components. Then the low frequency and high frequency components are used as power instructions for energy storage and power storage respectively. Considering the state of charge (SOC) and operating life of HESS, establish the annual minimum cost model. The results verified the effectiveness of the proposed method. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Capacity allocation; Grey relational grades cluster; hybrid energy storage system; Variational mode decomposition; Wind power
Index Keywords: Wind power; Capacity allocation; Effective solution; Grey relational grade; High frequency components; Hybrid energy storage systems; Hybrid energy storage systems (HESS); Minimum cost models; Mode decomposition; Energy storage

Authors: Wang S., Sun Q., Guo S., Hu L., Ma D.
Title: Hierarchical control algorithm of energy router based on bus voltage and SOC of battery
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, S., School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Sun, Q., School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Guo, S., School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Hu, L., School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Ma, D., School of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Abstract: To solve the problem of power fluctuation and the instability of direct current (DC) bus voltage carried by the access of multi-device to the power system, a hierarchical control algorithm based on the voltage of the DC bus and the status of charge (SOC) of battery is proposed. The voltage stability of the DC bus and the balance of the dynamic power could be realized through the strategy proposed. Adjusting the working mode and control strategy of each unit based on the voltage of DC bus and SOC of battery, can also lead to the flexible switch of the devices from property of source to load in the side of low voltage. The traditional topology of energy router is improved at the same time by integrating the photovoltaic (PV) generation, storage battery and other devices into the energy router. The stepvariable MPPT algorithm based on the power-voltage (P-U) differential curve can ensure the efficient utilization of PV energy and achieve a richer power distribution. The hierarchical control algorithm of energy router proposed is finally carried out and verified in MATLAB/Simulink. Simulation result shows that the smoothly switch of different modes, the voltage stability of the DC bus and the dynamic balance of the power can be well achieved. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy router; Flexible working mode; Hierarchical control algorithm; Power distribution
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Electric power supplies to apparatus; MATLAB; Control strategies; Differential curve; Energy routers; Flexible working; Hierarchical control; Photovoltaic generation; Power distributions; Power fluctuations; Secondary batteries

Authors: Li R., Sun L., Yang L., Luo F., Jiao Z.
Title: Study of the reactive power and influence on AC grid in startup process of voltage source converter
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Shaanxi Key Laboratory of Smart Grid, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, R., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Sun, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Yang, L., Shaanxi Key Laboratory of Smart Grid, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Luo, F., Shaanxi Key Laboratory of Smart Grid, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Jiao, Z., Shaanxi Key Laboratory of Smart Grid, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Abstract: DC distribution network is the basic supporting component of the future Energy Internet. A variety of power supplies, load, energy storage devices can be integrated to DC distribution network and it will act as energy management unit in Energy Internet. Due to of the large amount of DC capacitors contained in voltage source converters, the consumption of reactive power in the startup process needs to be calculated specifically. This paper introduces two basic charging strategies, and the numerical expressions of reactive power in different charging strategies are deduced. The current-limiting resistance will affect reactive power and completion time of charging significantly. Simulation results show that AC voltage will be affected seriously by the oscillation of reactive power, which leads to amplitude drop and waveform distortion during mode switching. © 2017 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Energy management; Energy resources; Charging strategies; Current limiting; Dc distribution; DC distribution network; Energy internet; Pre-charge; Voltage source converters; Waveform distortions; Reactive power

Authors: Yang Y., Fang Z., Zeng F., Liu P.
Title: Research and prospect of virtual microgrids based on energy internet
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Jiangsu Linyang Energy Co., Ltd, Nantong, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, Y., Jiangsu Linyang Energy Co., Ltd, Nantong, China; Fang, Z., Jiangsu Linyang Energy Co., Ltd, Nantong, China; Zeng, F., Jiangsu Linyang Energy Co., Ltd, Nantong, China; Liu, P., Jiangsu Linyang Energy Co., Ltd, Nantong, China
Abstract: Nowadays, a new round of power system reform and Energy Internet are happening in China. Many techniques such as microgrid, renewable energy, energy storage and multi-energy complementary system become mature. The concept of virtual microgrids which is positive for energy internet is firstly put forward in this paper, based on the advantages and disadvantages of microgrid and virtual power plant. Firstly, the similarities and differences of microgrid/virtual power plant/virtual microgrids are discussed. Then, we summary the definition, structure, operation mechanism and key technology of virtual microgrids. At last, we also discuss the development prospect of virtual microgrids in our country. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Xu L., Chen G., Zhang Y., Fu Z.
Title: A voltage stability control strategy of urban energy internet
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Beijing Urban District Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, L., State Grid Beijing Urban District Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Chen, G., State Grid Beijing Urban District Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., State Grid Beijing Urban District Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Fu, Z., State Grid Beijing Urban District Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China
Abstract: Under fault conditions, power electronic based equipment usually provides little support to the grid. To address this issue, this paper designed a new type of micro-grid stability controller, which aims to help maintain the voltage level of urban energy internet through the coordination of demand side resources including energy storages, electric vehicles and distributed generations. By analyzing the impedance ratio of distribution networks, a new type of voltage support control strategy is proposed. The effectiveness of the proposed method is validated by using simulation analysis and physical experiments. © 2017 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Energy storage; Vehicle-to-grid; Control strategies; Demand side resources; Impedance ratios; Physical experiments; Simulation analysis; Urban energy; Voltage stability controls; Voltage support; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Zhihao N., Can W., Bin Z., Keren Z., Jian Z., Yonghai X., Guandong Z., Bin R.
Title: Research on application of battery energy storage system based on MMC in wind power integration
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; State Key Laboratory for Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Maintenance Branch, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhihao, N., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Can, W., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Bin, Z., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Keren, Z., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Jian, Z., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Yonghai, X., State Key Laboratory for Alternate Electrical Power System With Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Guandong, Z., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Company, Research Institute, Changsha, China; Bin, R., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Maintenance Branch, Beijing, China
Abstract: A battery energy storage system based on MMC (MMC-BESS) is discussed, the system has active and reactive comprehensive compensation capability. The MMC-BESS is applied in wind farm integration, which can smooth the power fluctuations and improve voltage of bus effectively. Bidirectional DC/DC link is used to parallel the batteries with DC side of submodule, the state of charge (SOC) balance control strategy and control strategy of MMC-BESS are proposed. The reactive power compensation capacity is expanded in application of wind power integration, a coordinated control strategy based on transient reactive power capacity is proposed when bus voltage is unusual. The feasibility of topology and proposed control strategy is validated by simulation results. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: balance of state of charge (SOC); battery energy storage system; coordinate control; modular multilevel converter(MMC); wind power integration

Authors: Ren L.
Title: Coordinated control stategy for DC microgrid clusters considering intelligent power allocation
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Rizhao Electric Power Company, Rizhao, China
Authors with affiliations: Ren, L., State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Rizhao Electric Power Company, Rizhao, China
Abstract: This paper proposed a coordinated control strategy with intelligent power function to make the operation of the DC micro power network stable and reliable. According to the bus voltage, the strategy can control different sub micro networks in parallel or independent operation, and then control the power flow between micro grids to coordinate the stable operation of the DC microgrid. At the same time, the fuzzy droop control with voltage feedback compensation is adopted in the energy storage system, which can effectively reduce the bus voltage fluctuation while automatically allocating the load power between the energy storage systems. Finally, the simulation analysis is carried out using Matlab/Simulink, and the simulation results show that the coordinated control can control the stable operation and voltage stability of microgrid. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Xu Y., Li T., Wang K., Zhang C., Li C., Sun K., Feng W.
Title: A coordinated control strategy for suppressing transient power fluctuation of power conversion system and stabilizing AC bus voltage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd, Guangzhou, China; College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; State Key Lab of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, Y., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd, Guangzhou, China; Li, T., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd, Guangzhou, China; Wang, K., Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd, Guangzhou, China; Zhang, C., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; Li, C., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, China; Sun, K., State Key Lab of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Feng, W., State Key Lab of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The PV / Storage microgrid (MG) is one of the main forms of effectively use of Solar energy. Energy storage based power conversion system (PCS) is responsible for maintaining the power balance and voltage / frequency in the islanded MG. However, the power input or output of PCS and the instantaneous stress of the converter current will be increased greatly when the load is suddenly changed, which may result in the PCS over current fault and power imbalance, and the bus voltage and frequency oscillation of MG, will threaten the system stability. In this paper, a coordinated control strategy for PCS and photovoltaic (PV) inverter based islanded hybrid MG is proposed to suppress the transient power fluctuation of PCS and stabilize the AC bus voltage. The differentials of active power output of PCS is calculated and used to compensate the d-axis current of PV inverter. In this way, the PV system is controlled to change the power output with PCS simultaneously, so as to achieve the purpose of suppressing PCS transient power fluctuations and stabilizing the AC bus transient voltage. The hybrid MG is simulated by MATLAB / Simulink, the effectiveness of the coordinated control strategy is verified by simulation results based on different scenarios. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: coordinated control; power conversion system; power fluctuation; PV / Storage microgrid; voltage fluctuation
Index Keywords: Electric inverters; MATLAB; Power control; Power quality; Solar energy; System stability; Co-ordinated control; Micro grid; Power conversion systems; Power fluctuations; Voltage fluctuations; Transients

Authors: Cai C., Liu H., He W., Zheng H., Chen F.
Title: Parameter aggregation of microgrid equivalent characteristic model
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Jiangsu Key Laboratory of Power Transmission and Distribution Equipment Technology, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Company, Hefei, China
Authors with affiliations: Cai, C., Jiangsu Key Laboratory of Power Transmission and Distribution Equipment Technology, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; Liu, H., Jiangsu Key Laboratory of Power Transmission and Distribution Equipment Technology, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; He, W., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Zheng, H., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Company, Hefei, China; Chen, F., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Company, Hefei, China
Abstract: Microgrid consisted of different devices, such as distributed generations, various loads, energy storage system and various controller. With the increasing of number and capacity of microgrid, it will affect the planning and operation of distribution grid. Based on the equivalent characteristic model of microgrid, an equivalent aggregation method for the characteristic model is proposed in this paper. Firstly, the equivalent characteristic model of microgrid is transform to Z domain which is easy to be aggregation. Then, the Z domain pulse transform function is aggregated into high order model. Finally, the aggregated model is simplified to a low order difference equation and the parameters of equivalent model is identified by recursive damped least square algorithm. The proposed method will be proved through the experiments of distribution grid contains multi microgrid system. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Characteristic Model; Microgrid Cluster; Microgrid Equivalent Modeling; Parameter Aggregation
Index Keywords: Energy management; Energy resources; Aggregated modeling; Aggregation methods; Characteristic model; Damped least squares; Energy storage systems; Equivalent model; Micro grid; Parameter aggregations; Difference equations

Authors: Zhou L., Yang J., Wang W., Liu F.
Title: Microgrid optimal dispatch considering random characteristics of solar and wind
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Gansu Provincial Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Corporation of China, Lanzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhou, L., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Yang, J., College of Information and Electrical Engineering, China Agricultural University, Beijing, China; Wang, W., Gansu Provincial Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Corporation of China, Lanzhou, China; Liu, F., Gansu Provincial Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Corporation of China, Lanzhou, China
Abstract: Study on microgrid optimal dispatch has always been one of the most essential issues for microgrid operation and management. The paper fully considers the random characteristics of the photovoltaic power and wind turbine power output, as well as the charging/discharging characteristics of the energy storage unit in the microgrid in order to illuminate the intermittent uncertainty of power generation output, load consumption and the system equipment which will have an influence on the microgrid, and further to achieve optimal power dispatch within the microgrid. Aside from this, various levels of electricity prices of the main power grid, which are divided into crest, peak, level and valley prices according to different time periods when the microgrid is connected to the main power grid, along with the cogeneration of combined heat and electric power from a gas turbine which depends on the heat load condition when the microgrid is off-grid are both carefully taken into consideration at the same time. Furthermore, differential optimal dispatch strategies are drawn up, and a microgrid economical dispatch model with the optimization target of minimizing the operational cost considering uncertainty factors under the condition of system constraints is established. In the last part, a typical microgrid system is given as an example, which then is calculated and analyzed. The calculation results of the example have shown that the aforementioned strategies are very reasonable and much more economical than the strategies without considering these two factors. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cogeneration of combined heat and electric power; microgrid; optimal dispatch; peak-valley electricity prices; random characteristics
Index Keywords: Costs; Electric energy storage; Electric power transmission networks; Photovoltaic cells; Combined heat and electric power; Electricity prices; Micro grid; Optimal dispatch; Random characteristics; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Lin S., Cheng Q., Sun Q., Ma D.
Title: Coordinated operation of energy router with distributed devices
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Lin, S., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Cheng, Q., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Sun, Q., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Ma, D., School of Information, Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Abstract: The energy router is the core equipment of the energy Internet, which undertakes the power conversion and new energy access in the energy system. Therefore, an energy and information integration energy router structure is designed. The core of its power conversion is the solid-state transformer (SST), which can be connected to a variety of distributed devices, including photovoltaic (PV) system, energy storage unit, wind unit, etc. A control strategy of SST and energy storage unit coordinated operation based on dc bus voltage is presented in this paper, in order to realize the system operation of multiple distributed devices in the energy router. The operation mode and energy equation of the energy router is analyzed and the control strategy of multiple subunits in the energy router is studied in detail to ensure the stable operation of each sub-unit and the smooth switching among different modes. Finally, the simulation example of the energy router is carried out on the MATLAB platform, and the simulation results verify the effectiveness and reliability of the proposed coordinated operation strategy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Coordinated operation; Distributed device; Energy Internet; Energy router; Solid state transformer
Index Keywords: Energy storage; MATLAB; Simulation platform; Coordinated operation; Distributed devices; Energy internet; Energy routers; Solid state transformer (SST); DC transformers

Authors: Su Q., Jiang X., Jin Y.
Title: Optimal capacity of energy storage system for wind farms with adapting the scheduling
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Su, Q., Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Jiang, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Jin, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Abstract: In this paper, an optimal capacity model of battery energy storage system (BESS) for wind farm integration with adapting the scheduling plan is proposed. By analyzing the characteristics of wind output, the equivalent cycle life of BESS considering the effects of irregular charge and discharge on cycle life is introduced to the optimal model. From the point of view of the maximum net benefits of the wind storage union system, an optimal capacity model of BESS with considering investment costs, operating benefit, and wind curtailment saving is proposed based on the unit commitment. Thus, a more reasonable model is achieved with considering the influence of BESS providing reserve capacity on wind output uncertainty and the adaptability of BESS charge/discharge process to the scheduling plan. Finally, results based on the above analysis are listed to show the effect of equivalent cycle life and the reserve degree on the optimal BESS capacity. A foundation is laid for allocating BEES capacity of wind farm in matching with the dispatching operation. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; equivalent cycle life loss; scheduling plan; Wind power
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Electric utilities; Energy storage; Scheduling; Wind power; Battery energy storage systems; BESS; Charge and discharge; Charge/discharge; Cycle lives; Investment costs; Reserve capacity; Wind farm integration; Investments

Authors: Zeng S., Wang L., Chen D., Li Y.
Title: The integrated operation of multiple energy carrier used to enhance the reliability of the integrated energy system
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: System Operation Department, Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau, Guangzhou, China; Institute of Refrigeration and Cryogenics Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Zeng, S., System Operation Department, Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau, Guangzhou, China; Wang, L., System Operation Department, Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau, Guangzhou, China; Chen, D., Institute of Refrigeration and Cryogenics Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Li, Y., Institute of Refrigeration and Cryogenics Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The coordination of multiple energy can be realized in an integrated energy system. Thus higher economic performance and energy supply reliability can be obtained by multiple energy optimization. In this paper, an optimization of control strategy considering economic performance and response performance is inducted. Firstly, an integrated energy system including multiple energy conversion devices and response time of cold/heat related devices are introduced. Then the constraints are inducted into form of energy efficiency matrix in which energy efficiency is used to describe the efficiency of energy conversion and storage. After this, two forms of objectives dedicate to the performance of economic performance and response performance are inducted. Combined by the constraints and objectives, a linear programing method is used to coordinate multiple energy in an integrated energy system. The results revealed that the economic optimal optimization and responsive optimal optimization are conflicted. To obtain the comprehensive optimal performance, the first step should be given to response time optimization and then exerting economic optimization. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: comprehensive control strategy; energy hub; multiple energy devices; response time
Index Keywords: Energy conversion; Energy efficiency; Linear programming; Comprehensive controls; Energy conversion and storages; Energy conversion devices; Energy devices; Energy hubs; Integrated energy systems; Integrated Operations; Response time optimization; Response time (computer systems)

Title: Phase change materials(PCM) based multi-stage thermal energy storage(TES) and its application
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Power Transmission Technology, Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, Changping District, Beijing, 102211, China

Abstract: Future energy systems face significant challenges in resolving global energy trilemma of clean supply, affordability and security. This calls for high penetration of renewables and electrification of heat and transportation. This paper concerns thermal energy storage (TES), which is expected to play an important role in addressing the energy trilemma. It summarizes our recent work on this area, covering TES materials, modules and applications. Our work on TES materials has been on composite materials, including materials formulation and properties characterization and fabrication. Our work on TES devices is covered the material formulation, exchanger developing and TES system building. The experimental study indicates that the thermal recovery efficiency is from 87∼91% for each TES exchanger. A multistage system with graded use of the thermal energy can enhance the thermal recovery efficiency up to 92%. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: With the ever-increasing pressure of environmental protection in industrial development, the high utilization methodology of integrated energy in industrial parks has become an emerging researching focus. In Southern China, several near-land islands have been considered as potential area for industrial construction. In this paper, an effect algorithm to optimize the potential energy supply plants of Grid-Connected islands is proposed. With the real time simulation and operation analysis to related example, the effectivity and rationalization is testified. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Hao L., Zedong Z., Qin D., Zheng X.
Title: A novel urban rail transit system based on DC distribution and energy internet architecture
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Development Apartment of Fuzhou Power Supply Bureau of State Grid Corporation of China, Fuzhou, China

Abstract: In this paper, a novel energy internet architecture of urban rail transit is treated based on DC distribution. Renewable sources, cool/heat sources, electrical vehicles, braking energy feedback are added to the system. Flexible electricity trading strategies are included because of storage devices. It builds a DC distribution at the voltage level of 550 V to achieve efficient power transmission referring to the proportion of different loads in actual rail transit system. The efficiency and loss of the traditional AC system and DC system are calculated and compared. It shows that new design decreases the losses of conversion and cables and releases a large number of converters and rectifiers, which can promote energy conservation and environmental protection. The cost of cables and conversions also has a drop. The proposed architecture is supported by analysis, calculation and simulation. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: A new type of DC distribution network and coordinated control strategy
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Power Economic Research Institute of State Grid Fujian, Electric Power Company, Fuzhou, China; School of Mechatronic Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC), Chengdu, China; Research Institute of State Grid, Fujian Electric Power Company, Fuzhou, China

Abstract: Compared with the AC distribution network, the DC distribution network has the advantages of lower line losses, better power quality, higher reliability and being suitable for all kinds distributed generation and DC load access, etc. This paper firstly studies the models of PV and energy storage connected to the DC distribution network. Then, a new type of DC distribution network topology with hybrid DC circuit breaker is proposed. A coordinated control strategy is also proposed, which can control energy storage to improve the stability of the system. Finally, using PSCAD/EMTDC to model and simulate. The simulation results show that the proposed topology of DC distribution network and control strategy can quickly remove the fault, shorten the fault power failure time and ensure the safe and stable operation of the system, which greatly improves the operation efficiency and safety level of the power grid. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: The urban energy internet is one of the most important trends of energy development. This paper puts forward the development direction of the urban energy internet from three aspects of infrastructure construction, value creation, and data platform. In the meantime, related core contents of the urban energy internet construction are discussed, which constitute an integrated system of the urban energy internet. On the basis of the Shanghai Disney Land Area's distribution network project, an application scheme of the urban energy internet is researched. The application scheme includes power supply points, networks, smart power stations, distribution automation, intelligent use of electricity, intelligent furniture, distributed energy storage and enterprise-level information platform, etc. And the customized power supply, virtual power plants, and green suites in hotels are also designed in this project, which is quite beneficial to the future urban energy network development. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wu X., Xu K., Wang Z., Gong Y.
Title: Optimized capacity configuration of an integrated power system of wind, photovoltaic and energy storage device based on improved particle swarm optimizer
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Ningbo Power Supply Company, Ningbo, Zhejiang, China; State Grid Jibei Electric, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China; Lianyungang Power Supply Company, Lianyungang, Jiangsu, China
Authors with affiliations: Wu, X., Ningbo Power Supply Company, Ningbo, Zhejiang, China; Xu, K., State Grid Jibei Electric, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, Z., Lianyungang Power Supply Company, Lianyungang, Jiangsu, China; Gong, Y., Ningbo Power Supply Company, Ningbo, Zhejiang, China
Abstract: To enhance power supply reliability of wind-PV power system and improve utilization of wind power and PV, it is necessary to configure the capacity of wind turbine generators, PV modules and energy storage devices reasonably. Based on the feature of joint-operation of wind-PV generation system with energy storage device and considering dynamic variation of stored energy during the joint operation, taking technical characteristics of energy storage unit and the loss of power supply probability (LPSP) as the constraint, a joint configuration method of wind power capacity, PV and energy storage capacity, in which the original investment of integrated power system of wind, photovoltaic and energy storage device is taken as objective function, is proposed. An improved particle swarm optimizer (IPSO) is proposed. In the algorithm, the value of inertia weight was directed by the distance between the particle and the global optimal particle, crossover and mutation operations were introduced to avoid falling into local optimal solution. Under the conditions of a given case, take the lithium-ion battery into account. And simulation results show that the method has rapid convergence speed and superb global search ability. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity configuration; energy storage device; loss of power supply probability; particle swarm optimizer; Wind-PV power system

Authors: Su Y., Nie W., Zhou Y., Tan M., Qiao H.
Title: An interval based cost-emissions optimization strategy for gas-electricity integrated energy systems under uncertainty and demand response
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Information Engineering, Xiangtan University, Xiangtan, Hunan, 411105, China; Research and Development Department, XEMC New Energy Co, LTD, Xiangtan, Hunan, 411105, China
