Abstract: The natural gas network and the electricity network are tightly integrated in popular Energy Internet frameworks. This paper focuses on an operation strategy to optimize the operating cost and the emissions of gas-electricity integrated energy systems (GEIES). The wind power, pumped storage station and demand response are considered as key influence factors in the strategy. The strategy is based on interval optimization. In the presented strategy, the model of gas network and the electricity network are established, the operating cost models, emissions models and operation constrains, especially. The pumped storage station and the incentive demand response are integrated into the optimization model to optimize operational performances of GEIES. Moreover, the interval mathematics is introduced to address wind power uncertainty. Detailed experiment results demonstrate that the proposed strategy is a feasible way to reduce the operating cost and the emissions of GEIES. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand response; gas and electricity network; interval optimization; pumped storage station; wind power
Index Keywords: Gas emissions; Operating costs; Pumped storage power plants; Wind power; Demand response; Electricity networks; Integrated energy systems; Interval optimization; Operational performance; Optimization modeling; Optimization strategy; Pumped storage station; Electric network parameters

Authors: Zhang W., Han D., Sun W., Li H., Tan Y., Yan Z., Dong X.
Title: Optimal operation of wind-solar-hydrogen storage system based on energy hub
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Hefei Electric Power Supply Company, Hefei, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, W., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Han, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Sun, W., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Li, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Tan, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai, China; Yan, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Dong, X., Hefei Electric Power Supply Company, Hefei, China
Abstract: Along with the exhaustion of fossil fuels and the environmental pollution problem, renewable energy will surely become the mainstream of the future energy sector in the world. The uncertainty of large-scale intermittent energy output brings a great challenge to the safe operation of power grids. In this paper, taking into account the volatility and randomness of wind power and solar energy, we present a multi-energy coupling model with the core of hydrogen energy based on energy hub. To maximize operational profits of multi-energy system, an optimization problem is formulated to achieve coordinated operation using matrix coupling methodology. The matrix coupling mode can represent the input-output relationship of energy carriers. The CPLEX software is used to obtain the optimal solution in the dispatching period. In contrast with the traditional operation mode without the utilization of hydrogen, simulation results indicate that the proposed model achieves the higher penetration of renewable energy and more profits. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy hub; hydrogen energy; multi-energy coupling; optimal operation; renewable energy
Index Keywords: Electric power transmission networks; Energy policy; Fossil fuels; Profitability; Solar energy; Solar power generation; Wind power; Energy hubs; Hydrogen Energy; Multi energy; Optimal operation; Renewable energies; Hydrogen storage

Authors: Lou B., Huang H., Chen P., Lu H., Dai H.
Title: A new method for planning of stand-alone hybrid PV/WT/BESS/diesel microgrids considering DR based on DARTP
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Lou, B., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; Huang, H., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; Chen, P., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; Lu, H., Electric Power Research Institute of State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation, Hangzhou, China; Dai, H., College of Information Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: Stand-alone microgrids play an important role in solving power supply problems in remote areas that are not connected to the grid. Optimal planning, which is the most important issue that need to be resolved in the design stage, directly determines the economic and security benefits of microgrids. To achieve greater economic benefits for stand-alone microgrids that comprise diesel generators, wind turbine generation systems, photovoltaic generation systems and battery energy storage systems, this paper presents an optimal planning method that considers the day-ahead real-time pricing demand response (DARTP-DR). First, an optimization model that includes the DARTP-DR is established based on a price elasticity matrix. Next, a combinatorial solution algorithm that combines the genetic algorithm with pattern search is introduced to solve the model. The proposed optimal planning method is applied to a real case study, and the results show that considering the DARTP-DR in the optimal planning considerably reduces the lifetime cost of stand-alone microgrids. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: optimal allocation; price elasticity matrix; real-time pricing; stand-alone microgrid
Index Keywords: Costs; Economic and social effects; Economics; Elasticity; Genetic algorithms; Planning; Battery energy storage systems; Day-ahead real-time pricing; Micro grid; Optimal allocation; Photovoltaic generation system; Price elasticity matrixes; Real time pricing; Wind-turbine generation; Real time systems

Authors: Wang H., Chang Y., Tong X.
Title: Coordinated optimal dispatch of microgrid based on demand side response and energy estimation of energy storage device
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Automation and Information Engineering, Xi'an University of Technology, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., School of Automation and Information Engineering, Xi'an University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Chang, Y., School of Automation and Information Engineering, Xi'an University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Tong, X., School of Automation and Information Engineering, Xi'an University of Technology, Xi'an, China
Abstract: When microgrid operates in isolated mode, if the capacity of micro sources and energy storage devices are insufficient, it is impossible to ensure the power supply for all loads in microgrid. In order to improve power supply reliability of microgrid, and to generate electricity by using renewable energy as far as possible, a dispatch strategy of microgrid operation based on demand side response and energy evaluation of energy storage device is proposed in this paper. In this strategy, aiming at microgrid operating in isolated mode, firstly, the power and surplus energy of energy storage are estimated according to the supper short-term power prediction of micro sources and loads, and secondly, the different scheduling strategies for all kinds of loads are implemented on the basis of the estimated result and demand side information. Through the optimization of shiftable loads and the shedding of interruptible loads with different grades, the goal for continuous power supply of the important loads and the shortest power-off time of rest loads is achieved. The simulation cases verify the correctness and effectiveness of the strategy proposed in this paper. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand side response; load shedding; load shifting; Microgrid; surplus energy
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric load shedding; Demand side response; Load shifting; Load-shedding; Micro grid; Surplus energy; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Nan Z., Yi-Nan Z., Li L., Jin-Mei Z.
Title: Research and application of "generation-grid-load-energy storage" coordinated control system
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Jibei Electronic, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Nan, Z., State Grid Jibei Electronic, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China; Yi-Nan, Z., State Grid Jibei Electronic, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, L., State Grid Jibei Electronic, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China; Jin-Mei, Z., State Grid Jibei Electronic, Economic Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: Control mode of distribution power grid dispatching was studied and frame of 'Generation-Grid-Load-Energy storage' (GGLE) coordinating control system was built. This system took controlling resources into regulative scope such as distributed energy source, energy storage system and flexible load. On this basis, coordinated optimizing control strategy such as multi-source information fusion, feeder level load forecasting and operation control of distribution network was designed, thus enhancing the safe and reliable operation of active distribution network and diversifying the ability of load to participate in peak load regulation of power grid, which contributed to the reasonable allocation and consumption of distributed power supply. The GGLE coordinated control system has been successfully constructed in a 10kV switching station on Ninghai Avenue in Qinhuangdao, realizing a reasonable control of energy and load, and improving of the energy efficiency and power distribution reliability. The pilot project could be a basic guidance for large-scale construction of active distribution grid. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Liu J., Zhong H., Zeng K., Fan H., Chen Q.
Title: Optimal scheduling of multiple energy system considering power to gas unit
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power Dispatching Center of Guangdong Province, Guangzhou, 510000, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, J., Electric Power Dispatching Center of Guangdong Province, Guangzhou, 510000, China; Zhong, H., Electric Power Dispatching Center of Guangdong Province, Guangzhou, 510000, China; Zeng, K., Electric Power Dispatching Center of Guangdong Province, Guangzhou, 510000, China; Fan, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Chen, Q., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Abstract: With the development of energy society, energy shortage and environmental pollution are urgent problems we need to tackle. Electricity, natural gas, cooling, heating and other different energy carriers in multiple energy system can be transformed between each other. The operational cost of whole energy system can be reduced and energy utilization efficiency can be improved with coupling relationship among different multiple energy carriers. In integrated energy system, power to gas (P2G) unit has received considerable attention worldwide recently because it can transform power into natural gas or hydrogen, which can better utilize electricity such as extra wind power during off-peak load period and decrease the operational cost for natural gas and peak-period load. Therefore, this paper pays attention to optimal scheduling of multiple energy system considering power to gas unit. It first briefly introduces the general concept of multiple energy system, which can be divided into energy hub and combined power and gas network. Then it elaborates the characteristics and modelling of energy hub considering power to gas unit including typical energy conversion and energy storage units. Based on that, an optimal scheduling problem for multiple energy system with power to gas unit is proposed. Finally, numerical analysis is conducted to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed model. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Multiple energy system; optimal scheduling; power to gas unit
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Energy conversion; Energy utilization; Gases; Natural gas; Natural gasoline plants; Scheduling; Wind power; Coupling relationships; Energy storage unit; Energy systems; Energy utilization efficiency; Environmental pollutions; Integrated energy systems; Optimal scheduling; power to gas unit; Energy efficiency

Authors: Fang C., Bai J.-J., Zhang Y., Liu Y., Peng Z.-R.
Title: Design and application of energy management system for sodium sulfur battery
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; R and D Department, Shanghai Rui Zhou Information Technology Co., Ltd, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Institute of Ceramics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Fang, C., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Bai, J.-J., R and D Department, Shanghai Rui Zhou Information Technology Co., Ltd, Shanghai, China; Zhang, Y., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Liu, Y., Shanghai Institute of Ceramics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai, China; Peng, Z.-R., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: As the control center of the energy storage system, the energy management system is responsible for data collection, operation analysis and control of energy storage inverter, energy storage batteries, meters and other equipment which achieves energy management and optimization. Based on the design of sodium-sulfur battery energy management system, the three-layer network structure of energy management system is discussed. The advanced analysis, control, evaluation and basic support function is demonstrated from four aspects: the operation control and evaluation, communication management, real-time data processing, historical data processing. Furthermore, the software design process and implementation are analyzed by combining with the typical functional modules. Sodium sulfur battery energy management system has been used in Shanghai smart grid integrated demonstration project. Taking the 200kW sodium-sulfur battery energy management system as an example, the practice and application which concern the real-time data acquisition, historical data analysis and optimization operation control are analyzed in the engineering project. © 2017 IEEE.

LTD. of China, Power Engineering Consulting Group, Changchun, 130000, China; Yuan, K., State Power Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Xue, Z., State Power Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Li, J., State Power Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Wu, Z., State Power Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Yang, X., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company Research Institute, Nanjing, 211103, China
Abstract: The distributed photovoltaics' large scale access in distribution network will bring many unfavourable factors due to its fluctuating output power. In this paper, an adaptive control strategy will be proposed based on the hybrid energy storage, by coordinating the power distribution between the battery and the super capacitor, to reach a fully use of fast responding characteristic of super capacitor. In addition, the state of charge (SOC) feedback function in proposed strategy will have a strong adaptive ability for taking into account the SOC changing, to realize the optimization of energy utilization. Finally, the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed strategy are verified using the simulation results. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Ye R., Lin Z., Wen B., Wang H.
Title: Wind-storage combined system optimization model considering correlation of wind speed
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Economic Technology Research Institute, State Grid Fujian Electric Company, Fuzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, China

Abstract: In this paper, the output distribution of each wind farm is combined by the Gumbel Copula function, and the output characteristics of the wind farm group are modeled in order to obtain the output distribution of it in each period. Then, the sequential power curve of the clustered wind farm obtained by Latin hypercube sampling is converted into the sustained output curve of the wind farm. On this basis, a joint optimization model of power transmission capacity and storage power allocation which can reflect comprehensive income of transmission project is constructed by considering the transmission revenue, construction cost of transmission project, storage cost and loss of abandoned wind caused by transmission congestion. The results of case verify that the optimization model proposed in this paper not only reduces the investment cost of transmission engineering, but also improves the comprehensive income of transmission project. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Liu D., Shang C., Cheng H.
Title: A two-stage robust optimization for coordinated planning of generation and energy storage systems
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shang, C., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Cheng, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This study presents the coordinated planning of generation and energy storage systems to fill in the literature gap, and formulates the planning as a robust optimization that has proved its capability in handling uncertainty associated with the optimization model. The robust planning framework builds the planning task upon the security-constrained economic dispatch, and naturally adopts the min-max-min fashion that is then approached with the column and constraint generation decomposition method. Such a robust coordinated planning framework is demonstrated on an IEEE 30-bus network to justify its efficiency. The numeric study illustrates the advantage of the coordinated generation and storage planning in its comparison with the sole generation planning, while the robustness of the plan is evaluated through a post-planning simulation of different uncertainty scenarios. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Decomposition; Dispatch; Generation; Planning; Robust; Storage
Index Keywords: Decomposition; Energy storage; Optimization; Planning; Scheduling; Constraint generation; Decomposition methods; Dispatch; Energy storage systems; Generation; Optimization modeling; Robust; Security-constrained economic dispatch; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Ma R., Deng J., Li H., Qin J.
Title: Improved particle swarm optimization algorithm to multi-objective optimization energy hub model with P2G and energy storage
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha University of Science and Technology, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, R., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha University of Science and Technology, Changsha, China; Deng, J., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha University of Science and Technology, Changsha, China; Li, H., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha University of Science and Technology, Changsha, China; Qin, J., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Changsha University of Science and Technology, Changsha, China
Abstract: In this paper, an Energy hub mathematical model with power-to-gas(P2G), energy storage, CCHP and electric energy feedback is constructed. Considering the factors such as the rate structure and uncertainty of wind power output, the energy hub model takes the minimum fuel cost of energy hub operation and the minimum interactive energy costs with power grid as the optimization objective to optimize. In order to solve the high dimension complex problem, an improved multi-objective particle swarm optimization algorithm is proposed to solve the optimization problem, with the consideration of the bad experience during the speed update, the repeated search to the worst position is avoided., the search efficiency of the algorithm is improved and the proof is carried out; By adopting the global optimal solution selection strategy based on the interval and the optimal selection strategy, it can obtain the approximate Pareto front end which is better than the convergence and diversity of the basic MOPSO algorithm. The feasibility of the model and the effectiveness of the improved algorithm are verified by an example. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: combined cooling; energy hub; heating and power; P2G; wind power uncertainty

Authors: Yan X., Congcong B., Yuan F.
Title: Virtual inertia control strategy at energy-storage terminal in DC microgrid
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei Province, 071003, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, X., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei Province, 071003, China; Congcong, B., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei Province, 071003, China; Yuan, F., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei Province, 071003, China
Abstract: Due to the low inertia of DC microgrid system, the DC bus voltage oscillation is easily resulted by the large power gap of the system. Therefore, the virtual inertia control strategy at the energy-storage terminal in DC microgrid is proposed. The strategy sets the droop coefficient at the battery terminal as a function, which takes the voltage variation rate as the variable; When the DC microgrid system is disturbed, the battery provides additional inertia power, equivalents to increasing the capacitance on the DC side. In addition, to meet the requirement for response speed of the DC microgrid system under different voltage variation rates, this paper proposed a virtual inertia control strategy with droop coefficient a piecewise function. Finally, to verify validity of the proposed strategy, simulations based on Matlab/simulink are conducted and the results verify the effectiveness of the strategy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC microgrid; energy storage system; piecewise droop coefficient; virtual inertia
Index Keywords: Capacitance; Electric batteries; MATLAB; Control strategies; Dc micro-grid; Different voltages; Energy storage systems; Piece-wise; Piecewise functions; virtual inertia; Voltage variation; Energy storage

Title: An operation planning of an AC/DC hybrid integrated energy system

Abstract: Under acquaintance with advantages of new energy resources, distributed generations are widely utilised. This paper establishes an AC/DC hybrid integrated energy system model, which promotes AC/DC flexible transformation in power system and improves comprehensive utilization of new energy resources. First of all, the paper gives an elementary analysis of the power supply characteristics according to different kind of resources, combined with characteristics of energy storage. Furthermore, based on constraints of power balance and operation, simulation of optimal operation on the model shows the beneficial in decreasing operating costs, reducing harmful gas emissions and cuting down coal consumption. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wei K., Dai X., Liu P.
Title: Model and balance of flywheel energy storage system with composite flywheel and rolling bearings
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Engineering Physics, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, K., Department of Engineering Physics, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Dai, X., Department of Engineering Physics, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Liu, P., Department of Engineering Physics, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Flywheel energy storage (FES) technology has been applied to meet demands for energy quality and stability in partial application scenarios. And composite flywheel has become a hotspot for better performance in recent years. This paper introduces a 3.6MJ FES with composite flywheel and establishes shaft-support model and shaft-shell-support model. Dynamic characteristics of the two models are calculated by both transfer matrix method (TMM) and finite element method (FEM). The analysis shows little difference between two models except for the natural frequency of shell. Dynamic balance test is adopted to help the FES pass through the first three critical speeds smoothly under atmospheric condition. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Ziyu W., Weiya Z., Keke Z., Song T.
Title: Dynamics investigation of flywheel energy storage system in discharge mode for future energy internet
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Xuzhou Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Xuzhou, 221000, China; Nanjing Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Nanjing, 210019, China
Authors with affiliations: Ziyu, W., Xuzhou Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Xuzhou, 221000, China; Weiya, Z., Nanjing Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Nanjing, 210019, China; Keke, Z., Xuzhou Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Xuzhou, 221000, China; Song, T., Xuzhou Electrical Power Company, Jiangsu Xuzhou, 221000, China
Abstract: An investigation on bursting dynamics in a voltage-current dual-loop controlled Flywheel Energy Storage System (FESS) operating in discharge mode is presented in this paper, providing novel insights into the effect of two-timescale characteristics on the safety and stability of energy conversion and transmission of FESS. Based on singular perturbation theory, a two-timescale approach is proposed to separate the FESS into the fast and slow subsystems. Stability analysis of the transient fixed points indicates that the FESS shifts from the spiking state to the quiescent state when the slow variables cross the bifurcation point of the fast subsystem. Mechanism analysis reveals that the root cause of the bursting dynamics is the voltage instability of the FESS. Moreover, the stability boundaries of key parameters are derived, and application requirements of the proposed approach are also discussed, guiding the extension of the approach to engineering applications and dynamics analysis. Constant voltage discharge experiment is performed based on the FESS test bench built in Key Laboratory of Smart Grid of Ministry of Education, Tianjin University, which validates the theoretical results. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bursting; Flywheel energy storage system (FESS); Homotopy method; Hopf bifurcation; singular perturbation; two-timescale
Index Keywords: Dynamics; Energy conversion; Energy storage; Flywheel propulsion; Flywheels; Perturbation techniques; Stability; Wheels; bursting; Flywheel energy storage system; Homotopy method; Singular perturbations; Time-scales; Hopf bifurcation

Authors: Wang Z., Lv G., Wei L., Qin H.
Title: Study on optimization of hybrid energy storage configuration
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: JiangSu Power Design Institute Co. Ltd, Nanjing, China; Beijing Smart China Energy Technology Development Co. Ltd, Beijing, China; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China

Ltd, Beijing, China; Wei, L., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Qin, H., JiangSu Power Design Institute Co. Ltd, Nanjing, China
Abstract: The randomness and volatility of the renewable energy bring instability to the operation of distribution network. A higher standard of planning and scheduling of the distribution network is called for along with the increasing load of the distribution network and the increasing spread of the peak and valley. In the distribution network, equipped with energy storage can reduce the impact of uncertainty, improve the flexibility of distribution network operation. The use of hybrid energy storage is more suitable for frequent occurrence of power load fluctuations in the distribution network. This paper focuses on the configuration of hybrid energy storage, and proposes a hybrid energy storage optimization method for calculating the parameter of power storage and energy storage in the distribution network. It can reduce the capacity of the transformers in the distribution network. At the same time, this paper also proposes a Wave shaping coefficient of the indicators used to optimize the cost of hybrid energy storage configuration and improve the economic benefit reasonably. The proposed allocation method is validated with numerical simulation results. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity reduction; distribution network planning; hybrid energy storage; optimal allocation; Wave shaping coefficient
Index Keywords: Numerical methods; Capacity reduction; Distribution network planning; Hybrid energy storage; Optimal allocation; Waveshaping; Energy storage

Authors: He J., Liu D., Yan G., Yong J.
Title: Hierarchical optimization control strategy for electric vehicle in active distribution network
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Control of Power Transmission and Conversion, Ministry of Education, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; State Grid Mianyang Power Supply Company, Mianyang, Sichuan, 621000, China
Authors with affiliations: He, J., Key Laboratory of Control of Power Transmission and Conversion, Ministry of Education, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Liu, D., Key Laboratory of Control of Power Transmission and Conversion, Ministry of Education, Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, 200240, China; Yan, G., State Grid Mianyang Power Supply Company, Mianyang, Sichuan, 621000, China; Yong, J., State Grid Mianyang Power Supply Company, Mianyang, Sichuan, 621000, China
Abstract: Coordination managing and controlling the various intermittent energy, energy storage, and controllable load, active distribution network can increase the ability of renewable energy interconnection to distribution network. In this paper, considering the randomness of charging time and the fluctuation of intermittent energy output and load, an electric vehicle charging control strategy based on hierarchical optimization of active distribution network is proposed. On the decision layer, within long-time scale, optimization plan of electric vehicle charging is calculated based on the car charging information, the prediction of load and the intermittent energy on the feeder line. The optimization goal of the charging plan is to reduce the feeder exchange power fluctuation. On the terminal layer, within short-time scale, the charging pile adjusts the charging power in real time according to the feeder control error, so the feeder exchange power will keep stable near the optimal value. Eventually, a case study shows the effectiveness of control strategies. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Active Distribution Network; Electric Vehicle; Feeder Control Error; Hierarchical Optimization

Authors: Zheng H., Zhou Y., Yang W., Liu X., Hao X., Qin W.
Title: A control strategy of hybrid energy storage system in bipolar-type DC micro-grid
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; College of Electrical and Power Engineering, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Zheng, H., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Zhou, Y., College of Electrical and Power Engineering, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Yang, W., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Liu, X., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Hao, X., State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Research Institute, Taiyuan, China; Qin, W., College of Electrical and Power Engineering, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: This paper proposes a coordinated control strategy for the hybrid energy storage system (HESS) to stabilize the DC bus voltages in bipolar-type DC micro-grid. The hybrid energy storage system consists of the lithium battery and the super capacitor for their complementary performances of high energy density and high power density. And voltage balancer is also used to coordinate with hybrid energy storage to balance the power on two DC buses. In order to smooth the working current of the lithium battery and avoid the high-frequency harmonic interaction between two DC buses from voltage balancer, the super capacitor is adopted as an energy buffer to compensate the ripple power. The output power of the lithium battery and working state of voltage balancer are controlled separately by measuring the relationship between two sets of super capacitors. Meanwhile, the response of the lithium battery and voltage balancer to the super capacitor is correctly implemented by adjusting voltage reference values of DC buses. In the end, simulation results verify the feasibility of the proposed control strategy. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper addresses a kind of multiport energy hub that can be used to manage the battery storage system and the PV panel. And the dc loads and the ac loads can link with this energy hub directly. Furthermore, we introduced the control strategies for both grid-tied mode and islanded mode, considering the economic efficiency. Finally, the simulations are used to demonstrate the proposed system. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Research on energy storage cells equalizer based on direct equilibrium topology
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, S., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China; Wang, P., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China; Xu, Y., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China; Duan, Y., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China; Dang, W., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China; Cao, Y., State Grid Inner Mongolia Economic Technology, Research Institute, Hohhot, China
Abstract: When the power lithium-ion battery devices is used in the fields of electrical power system as energy storage device, in order to meet the requirement of voltage levels, they are usually used in series to achieve the appropriate voltage level. Because of inconsistency of the parameters of each cell, the voltage among the monomers becomes unbalanced which decreases the effective capacity and the cycle life of the battery pack. Based on the analysis of the existing topologies, a equilibrium topology based on multi-winding transformer is proposed, this equilibrium topology can realize energy transfer directly among any monomers in no more than two steps. A equalizer of six monomers is built for power lithium-ion batteries, and the equalization effect of three switching modes and the overall equalizer is tested and analyzed in different inequalization conditions. Experimental results show that six-cell equalizer can equalize power lithium-ion battery pack accurately and reliably, and realize energy transfer among any monomer. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: Distributed PV and their impact on regional grid have become an important research field over the last decade years. Aiming at this problem, a new smoothing method based on self-adaptive wavelet packet decomposition in hybrid energy storage system is proposed. It can adjust the wavelet decomposition level according to the change range of PV output power, so that the low frequency component of PV power can be extract accurately. The mechanism of voltage fluctuation caused by PV power changes is analyzed, and the wavelet packet decomposition level is determined by the voltage fluctuation degree, which eliminates the delay effect of real time wavelet packet decomposition. The simulation results show that the effect of using the self-adaptive wavelet packet decomposition is better than the traditional wavelet packet decomposition. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Energy and ancillary service joint dispatch of power system integrated with dynamic heating system

Abstract: Integrated dispatch of electric power system and central heating system will bring significant economic benefit in reducing operation cost and enhancing wind power utilization. This paper investigates the energy and ancillary service joint dispatch of integrated electric power system and central heating system. A system identification model describing the heat storage property of central heating systems is built. The heating supply is qualified through the supply water temperatures at heat exchange stations. An alternate decentralized solution is proposed so that the electric power system and the central heating system can be independently dispatched. Case studies on a test system proves the feasibility of the proposed method. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: In view of the renewable energy sources such as wind power, high permeability of wide time scale power fluctuations inhibition of the hot issues, this paper presents a super capacitor charge and discharge power regulation of voltage state feedback control strategy for wind power active power fluctuation in two-way quickly and accurately adjust, effectively control the output power fluctuations in short time scales; Is analyzed. Studying control combined with super capacitor voltage state, by reducing load control to set aside more than power, when the super capacitor voltage is too low or too high for auxiliary power regulation, optimization of super capacitor energy management, and realize the wide time scale inhibition of power fluctuations. Articles in by establishing consists of DFIG, dc double l/buck converter, the super capacitor energy storage unit model, on the basis of by a three doubly-fed wind power generator (DFIG) wind farm. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Jin C., Jiang X., Zhong G., Li X.
Title: Research on coordinated control strategy of flywheel energy storage array for island microgrid
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings

Abstract: The development of micro-grids and renewable energy requires energy storage systems with larger capacity and higher power rating. The flywheel energy storage array has the advantages of simplicity, reasonable cost and good scalability, which is suitable for the micro-grid with large-scale wind farm. In this paper, on one hand, the coordinated control strategies of the flywheel in parallel with the AC bus and the DC bus is conducted proposed, and the function between the change rate of state of charge (SOC) by time and its value is derived. On the other hand, the flywheel energy storage array needs to avoid over-charge and over-discharge, thus it's necessary to keep the SOC value within an allowable range. A safety control strategy is proposed to avoid over-charge and over-discharge of the flywheels and ensure the stable operation of the system. The model of the micro-grid with the wind farm is established, and the control strategy is verified on this model. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: He G., Yan H., Liu K., Yu B., Cui G., Zheng J., Pan Y.
Title: An optimization method of multiple energy flows for CCHP based on fuzzy theory and PSO
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory for Security and Energy Saving, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China

Abstract: In order to overcome the limitation of traditional single-objective optimal operation method for the multiple energy flows system combined cooling, heat and power (CCHP), this paper presents a multi-objective comprehensive optimization model for CCHP with renewable energy resources and energy storage devices based on the fuzzy theory and PSO. The model utilizes the membership function to fuzzify each objective function. Then linearly weighted sums the objective functions with coefficient of variation method and solve the model by PSO algorithm. The simulation results based on the case of a real district show that compared with traditional optimization method, the comprehensive optimization model established in this paper can take each important performance index into account and effectively optimize the dispatch of energy resources of the CCHP system with renewable energy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: combined cooling; fuzzy theory; heat and power; multi-objective optimization; multiple energy flow; PSO

Authors: Ding Y., Liu J.
Title: Real-time false data injection attack detection in energy internet using online robust principal component analysis
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Shibei Electricity Supply Company, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Ding, Y., Shibei Electricity Supply Company, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Liu, J., Shibei Electricity Supply Company, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: In energy internet, electric power infrastructure is integrated with cyber infrastructure, which makes power grid vulnerable to cyberattack. Specially, when intruders know the configuration of the target power system, false data injection attacks can be successfully launched to bypass the traditional residual-based bad data detection system. In the presence of this dilemma, this paper aims to design a more robust and useful real-time false data injection attack detection mechanism applied in the supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system in smart grid. Noticing the low dimensionality of temporal measurements of power grid states as well as the sparse nature of malicious attacks, robust principal component analysis (RPCA) is applied to false data injection attack detection in power grid and low-rank matrix fitting (LMaFit) is chosen as the solving algorithm. However, conventional RPCA is an offline method which confines its application, to meet the real-time requirement of power grid attack detection, by use of low-rank projection matrix, an online RPCA based detection mechanism is proposed, which returns detection results immediately as soon as new power grid measurements arrive and needs less computing time and storage space. Experiments on the SCADA test bed show that the proposed online RPCA based detection method works well and its performance on detecting and computing is better than the previous online PCA based method. Specially, the detection sensitivity of the proposed algorithm is 4 orders of magnitude higher than online PCA, and the calculation speed is improved by 2 to 3 orders of magnitude compared to offline RPCA. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: false data injection attack; online robust principal component analysis; power grid information security; SCADA system
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Matrix algebra; Network security; Robust control; SCADA systems; Cyber infrastructures; Detection sensitivity; Electric power infrastructure; False data injection attacks; Power grids; Real time requirement; Robust principal component analysis; Supervisory control and dataacquisition systems (SCADA); Principal component analysis

Authors: Zhu E., Liu X., Zou H., Wu Z., Zhang Y.
Title: Key technology and application of energy measurement data security
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, E., Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Liu, X., Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zou, H., Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, Z., Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., Metrology Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: Energy measurement data are the basic data sources of perceiving smart city and realizing energy conservation and emission reduction. The promotion and application of big data, cloud computing, Internet of things (IoT) and mobile Internet technology drive the rapid development of energy measurement, and it also brings serious challenges for the security of measurement data. The paper introduces the structure of the energy measurement data system and analyzes the current situation and application demands for the system at home and abroad. It focuses on the basic and forward-looking technologies necessary for future energy measurement development, such as the new-generation cryptographic technology, private information protection in energy information network environments, the distribution and application mode of quantum key, secure communication protocol, big data access control, information sharing and fusion, and mass data processing, analyzing and application. The application of all these key technologies in China can provide the basic scientific basis for developing the top-level design and deepening applications of the energy measurement system. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Wang P., Xie L., Lu Y., Ding Z.
Title: Day-ahead emission-aware resource planning for data center considering energy storage and batch workloads
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, P., North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Xie, L., North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Lu, Y., North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Ding, Z., North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: With the rapid development of data centers around the world, energy consumption of data centers has become a non-ignorable constituent of total energy consumption. Considering its unique characteristics, the optimal energy management of data center has become the principal concern of most data centers, especially for those processing batch workloads. In this paper, a grid-connected microgrid composed of conventional generators, renewable resources and energy storage system(ESS) is considered to provide power for a data center. A day-ahead resource planning problem considering conventional generator fuel cost and carbon emission cost is proposed and a MILP model is formulated to solve it. The numerical analysis is also provided and corresponding results illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao Z., Wang K., Li G., Jiang X., Zhang Y.
Title: Affinely adjustable robust optimal dispatch for island microgrids with wind power, energy storage and diesel generators
Source title: 2017 IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Electric Power Technical Research Institute of State Grid, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Wang, K., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Li, G., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Jiang, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Zhang, Y., Shanghai Electric Power Technical Research Institute of State Grid, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This paper proposes an affinely adjustable robust optimization (AARO) approach to account for the uncertainty of wind power in microgrid optimal dispatch. It proposes an affinely adjustable robust optimal dispatch formulation where the base-point generation of energy storage system (ESS) and diesel generators is calculated to serve the forecasting load which is not balanced by wind power in island microgrid. The affinely adjustable robust dispatch framework is solved using the second-order cone programming, and the optimal base-point output and participation factors of energy storage and diesel generator in each dispatch interval are obtained on the wind fluctuation according to an uncertainty set. Numerical results show that the optimal operating cost increases slightly with the increase of wind power output uncertainty with higher operating costs using AARO method, but the more robust dispatch scheme, compared to deterministic cases. AARO can effectively cope with wind power prediction errors with a high success rate in day-ahead dispatch, especially when it lacks short-term renewable energy forecast data. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: affinely adjustable robust optimization; microgrid; second-order cone programming; uncertainty of wind power

Abstract: The direct torque control system allows to obtain high values of control quality indexes of the induction motor without using coordinate transformations, compensation of crosslinks, determining the parameters of regulators and their adaptation in the conditions of changing the parameters of the equivalent scheme. The matrix converter is attractive for using in a wide range of electromechanical systems, since it does not contain bulky energy storage devices. The paper presents the development of a system for direct torque control of an induction motor powered by a matrix converter. An analysis of the system with a multi-level relay torque controller of induction motor has been carried out. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: The possibility of identifying nonlinear parameters of the induction motor equivalent circuit using energy storage devices is considered. A method for identification of electromagnetic parameters of induction motor powered by the energy storage devices. The article proposes an approach to determining motor's parameters taking into account the effect of current displacement in the rotor in the form of the dependence of the rotor's resistance on the current. The article suggests a variant of obtaining the necessary harmonic composition of the voltage and current signals when the induction motor is powered by energy storage devices. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: The paper presents the electric traction system of main line of two-unit freight diesel locomotives. There was offered the modernization of a combined system of diesel engine start-up and a power supply for consumers of an onboard network using a synchronous machine in the starter/generator mode, which allows to increase efficiency of a locomotive electrical equipment usage. There were pointed out the ways of improvement of a regular axle control in order to increase traction and power characteristics of diesel locomotives. Suggested solutions improve the traction and antislip locomotive characteristics by modernizing the traction transmission system and an electrical equipment microprocessor control algorithms. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: The energy storage property of the air conditioning system are studied firstly, based on which, the energy storage model for air-conditioning system is put forward. Then, the air conditioning load aggregation model and the charging/discharging control model of energy storage element in secondary frequency regulation of power system are mainly studied. In load aggregation model, the cluster load of air conditioning will be integrated into a virtual AGC generator unit, with the representation of its regulation capacity, regulation speed and regulation precision. The AGC instructions will be inversed into open or stop control signal of air-conditioning equipment through the charging/discharging control model. Finally, the characteristic of virtual AGC unit is analyzed, and the effectiveness of the air conditioning participating in secondary frequency regulation is verified in the case study. © 2017 IEEE.

Ltd, Beijing, China; Tian, W., China Electric Power Research, Institute Co. Ltd, Beijing, China
Abstract: Energy storage is an important means to suppress the fluctuation of renewable energy. Electrolytic water can achieve large-scale energy storage purposes. This paper first introduces the type of energy storage device that can be commercially applied. And then introduces the key factors that affect the investment and operating costs of the electrolyzer. Based on the above, the optimal capacity planning model of the electrolyzer device is established on the condition of meeting the requirements of wind power integratio. The objective function is to maximize the operating profit of the device by considering the cost of investment. The optimal installation capacity can be determined on the simulation curve calculated by a test which may find widespread use in the future. Finally the further research directions of power-to-hydrogen and power-to-methane are pointed out. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: Virtual power plant makes the output variable due to the complementary nature of various distributed resources, so it is suitable for power system frequency regulation auxiliary service. In this paper, the modeling and analysis of the components of the virtual power plant are carried out, and a frequency regulation strategy based on frequency analysis is developed. The frequency regulation signal is decomposed and sent to each component unit. Through simulation and quantitative analysis of the process of a virtual power plant includes wind turbine, controllable central air conditioning and energy storage system participating in frequency regulation, and the model test of each unit verifies corresponding capability, providing a theoretical basis for the virtual power plant participating in the power system frequency regulation ancillary services. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Chai W., Cai X., Li Z.
Title: A multi-objective optimal control scheme of the hybrid energy storage system for accurate response in the demand side
Source title: 2017 4th International Conference on Systems and Informatics, ICSAI 2017
Affiliations: School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; School of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Chai, W., School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Cai, X., School of Electronic Information and Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Li, Z., School of Information Science and Technology, Donghua University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The idea of applying energy storage system (ESS) into the demand side for accurate response has attracted lots of attention. Hybrid energy storage system (HESS) is the combination of various ESS types, which can exploit the strength of each ESS type and enjoy good comprehensive performance. In order to: 1) increase the accuracy of the demand side response, 2) extend the HESS lifetime, 3) reduce the energy loss of HESS and 4) lower the maintenance cost, a HESS synthetical model is developed including the lifetime model, the energy efficiency model, the economic cost model, the demand side response accuracy and the constraints. Comparison of different single types of ESS for demand side response is studied, and a multi-objective optimal control scheme of the HESS is proposed based on the particle swarm optimization (PSO). Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy is verified by actual data from a regional power grid in eastern China. © 2017 IEEE.

Source title: 2017 4th International Conference on Systems and Informatics, ICSAI 2017

Abstract: Electric vehicles can be used to provide ancillary services to the grid as a flexible adjustable energy storage load. Cluster electric vehicles can be used as a virtual power plant in the aggregation mode to participate in the ancillary service market. In this paper, the bidding strategy of electric vehicle aggregators and their internal resource optimization are modeled. The aggregator considers the possible bidding of other aggregators and the constraints of internal resources, and determine their bidding coefficients with the aim of maximizing their own benefits. The aggregator makes the corresponding adjustment of control strategies according to the actual clearing price and quantities. The aggregate bidding strategy proposed by this paper reduces the burden on the dispatch center and provides the opportunity for electric vehicle owners to participate in ancillary service market bidding directly. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Mathematical model study of solar electrodialysis desalination
Source title: 2017 International Conference on Electrical and Computing Technologies and Applications, ICECTA 2017
Affiliations: University of Gabes, Research U Nit of Photovoltaic Wind and Geothermal Systems, National Engineering School of Gabes, Street of Mednine 6029, Gabes, Tunisia; Department of Electrical Electronics and Communications Engineering, American University of Ras Al Khaimah, Sheikh Saqr Bin Khalid Rd-Ras al Khaimah, Émirats Arabes Unis, United Arab Emirates
Authors with affiliations: Nafaa, H., University of Gabes, Research U Nit of Photovoltaic Wind and Geothermal Systems, National Engineering School of Gabes, Street of Mednine 6029, Gabes, Tunisia; Farhat, M., Department of Electrical Electronics and Communications Engineering, American University of Ras Al Khaimah, Sheikh Saqr Bin Khalid Rd-Ras al Khaimah, Émirats Arabes Unis, United Arab Emirates; Lassaad, S., University of Gabes, Research U Nit of Photovoltaic Wind and Geothermal Systems, National Engineering School of Gabes, Street of Mednine 6029, Gabes, Tunisia
Abstract: The most important consumers of water are the industry, the domestic and the agricultural fields. So that water shortage is one of the most important limitations of the human being, the agriculture and the industries. The major part of the earth's surface is covered with water. However, in the form of water and the oceans and the seas have a salt content very high and not directly suitable and thus in need special technics desalination processes. Today's challenge is of most importance and deserves our complete attention to desalination methods suited for the sea water treatment may be effective for water supply. Electrodialysis (ED) is suitable desalinating methods for water treatment of seawater, which has been used for many years. Electrodialysis is based on ion transport through cell membranes under the influence of an electric field. In this paper an electrodialysis system supplied by photovoltaic modules which is simple, reliable and cheap because it does not include storage battery and regulator of battery sets. A mathematical model for the desalination of the brackish water by photovoltaic electrodialysis was developed under MATLAB/SIMULINK environment. This model was simulated with satisfactory results for the desalination of a solution of NaCl in various environmental conditions. The developed model could be applied to commercial electrodialysis a facility which is the usual mode of functioning of this equipment when the requirements for the water treated are moderated in the sunny zone. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Pidaparthi A., Hoffmann J.
Title: Effect of heliostat size on the levelized cost of electricity for power towers
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Solar Thermal Energy Research Group, Stellenbosch University, Private Bag X1, Matieland, Stellenbosch, 7602, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Pidaparthi, A., Solar Thermal Energy Research Group, Stellenbosch University, Private Bag X1, Matieland, Stellenbosch, 7602, South Africa; Hoffmann, J., Solar Thermal Energy Research Group, Stellenbosch University, Private Bag X1, Matieland, Stellenbosch, 7602, South Africa
Abstract: The objective of this study is to investigate the effects of heliostat size on the levelized cost of electricity (LCOE) for power tower plants. These effects are analyzed in a power tower with a net capacity of 100 MWe, 8 hours of thermal energy storage and a solar multiple of 1.8 in Upington, South Africa. A large, medium and a small size heliostat with a total area of 115.56 m2, 43.3 m2 and 15.67 m2 respectively are considered for comparison. A radial-staggered pattern and an external cylindrical receiver are considered for the heliostat field layouts. The optical performance of the optimized heliostat field layouts has been evaluated by the Hermite (analytical) method using SolarPILOT, a tool used for the generation and optimization of the heliostat field layout. The heliostat cost per unit is calculated separately for the three different heliostat sizes and the effects due to size scaling, learning curve benefits and the price index is included. The annual operation and maintenance (O&M) costs are estimated separately for the three heliostat fields, where the number of personnel required in the field is determined by the number of heliostats in the field. The LCOE values are used as a figure of merit to compare the different heliostat sizes. The results, which include the economic and the optical performance along with the annual O&M costs, indicate that lowest LCOE values are achieved by the medium size heliostat with an area of 43.3 m2 for this configuration. This study will help power tower developers determine the optimal heliostat size for power tower plants currently in the development stage. © 2017 Author(s).

Authors: Geng Y., Yang Z., Lin F., Wang Y.
Title: Maximum power and efficiency transmission using parallel energy storage load for wireless power transfer systems
Source title: 2017 IEEE PELS Workshop on Emerging Technologies: Wireless Power Transfer, WoW 2017

Abstract: For the battery/super-capacitor hybrid system as the wireless power transfer system load, it is rarely discussed. In this paper, the characteristics of such a system are considered, a charging topology is proposed. And a control strategy is proposed to not only meet the requirements of the system energy output, but also maintain the high efficiency of the system based on rational design of power allocation strategy. Firstly, the characteristics of WPT system with LCC topology are analyzed. The system has the constant secondary side voltage output, if the output power is adjusted properly that means the equivalent load can be controlled to the optimal value. And the hybrid system power can be controlled to optimal power to track the optimal efficiency under the constant voltage. Finally, the feasibility of the control method is verified by experiments. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Ben Makhloufi A., Hatti M., Taleb R.
Title: Comparative study of photovoltaic system for hydrogen electrolyzer system
Source title: 2017 6th International Conference on Systems and Control, ICSC 2017
Affiliations: Hassiba Benbouali University, LGEER Laboratory, Chlef, Algeria; Unite de Developpement des Equipements Solaires, EPST-CDER, Bou Ismail, Tipaza, Algeria
Authors with affiliations: Ben Makhloufi, A., Hassiba Benbouali University, LGEER Laboratory, Chlef, Algeria; Hatti, M., Unite de Developpement des Equipements Solaires, EPST-CDER, Bou Ismail, Tipaza, Algeria; Taleb, R., Hassiba Benbouali University, LGEER Laboratory, Chlef, Algeria
Abstract: Energy storage remains a strategic challenge in energy control. The world is turning to decentralized generators, including fuel cell systems, which use hydrogen as fuel. This gives a special interest to the system of storage of the hydrogen produced mainly by the solar energy. The electrolyzer becomes the most prominent device, but its disadvantage is that it requires a lot of electrical energy. This present paper deals with controlling the power emanating from the photovoltaic system and consumed by the electrolyzer, through the use of neural networks to optimize the power generated by the photovoltaic system. In this work, we will compare between two types of converters Cuk and SEPIC because they are the most widely used and are two of the developed family of the converter. This paper presents under MATLAB/Simulink the use of Cuk converter with maximum power point tracking (MPPT) technology, to increase its efficiency by an algorithm Perturb and Observe (P&O) and incremental conductance method, then we will apply artificial neural network (ANN) to avoid the disadvantages of MPPT Classical. The MPPT developed with the artificial neural networks presents a better behavior than the classic system Perturb & Observe. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Abderrahim T., Said B.

Source title: 2017 6th International Conference on Systems and Control, ICSC 2017

Authors with affiliations: Abderrahim, T., Laboratoire de Génie Électrique, Faculté de Technologie, Université de m'Sila, M'sila, 28000, Algeria; Said, B., Laboratoire de Génie Électrique, Faculté de Technologie, Université de m'Sila, M'sila, 28000, Algeria
Abstract: In this paper, control and energy management of a grid-connected PV-Battery hybrid power system are investigated. In this configuration power transfer from the photovoltaic system as a primary energy source and battery storage to the distribution grid is accomplished using double-stage conversion made up of a pair of DC-DC converters and a three-phase three-level diode clamped inverter (DCI). An appropriate power management strategy is adopted to manage the power flow between the converters and the load in order to maintain the power balance in the system. The resulting power system is not only able to extract the maximum power from PV generator, but also to achieve sinusoidal grid currents, and to guarantee reactive power compensation. At the end, some simulation results are given to test the viability of the proposed system at various operating conditions. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hybrid power system; Multilevel diode clamped inverter; Power management; PV system; Storage system

Authors: Benbaha N., Zidani F., Said M.S.N., Boukebbous S.E., Ammar H.
Title: Optimal energy control of induction motor standalone photovoltaic-battery pumping system
Source title: 2017 6th International Conference on Systems and Control, ICSC 2017
Affiliations: Unité de Recherche Appliquée en Energie Renouvelable, URAER, Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Ghardaïa, 47133, Algeria; Laboratory of Induction and Propulsion Systems, Electrical Engineering Department, University of Batna 2, Batna, 05000, Algeria
Authors with affiliations: Benbaha, N., Unité de Recherche Appliquée en Energie Renouvelable, URAER, Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Ghardaïa, 47133, Algeria, Laboratory of Induction and Propulsion Systems, Electrical Engineering Department, University of Batna 2, Batna, 05000, Algeria; Zidani, F., Laboratory of Induction and Propulsion Systems, Electrical Engineering Department, University of Batna 2, Batna, 05000, Algeria; Said, M.S.N., Laboratory of Induction and Propulsion Systems, Electrical Engineering Department, University of Batna 2, Batna, 05000, Algeria; Boukebbous, S.E., Unité de Recherche Appliquée en Energie Renouvelable, URAER, Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Ghardaïa, 47133, Algeria; Ammar, H., Unité de Recherche Appliquée en Energie Renouvelable, URAER, Centre de Développement des Energies Renouvelables, CDER, Ghardaïa, 47133, Algeria
Abstract: This paper focuses on a robust backstepping control of induction motor vector. The motor is coupled to a centrifugal pump as mechanical load, fed by a standalone photovoltaic generator, equipped by the lead acid battery storage system. Throughout this attempt, two main objectives have been achieved; firstly, assuring the continuity of electrical energy production. Secondly, operating the photovoltaic panels at maximum power point. The surplus power is stored in the battery bank in the goal to be exploited later, whenever, the solar power is insufficient. For a maximum exploitation photovoltaic power, a variable step-size of Perturb and Observe maximum power point tracking has been adopted. The proposed power management system aims to meet the required power, under variable weather conditions. The performance of the developed system has been analyzed through simulation by Matlab/Simulink and SimPowerSystems Blockset. The results obtained through the used approach averred a good improvement. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Saber B., Abdelkader B., Said B., Mansour B.
Title: DC-link capacitor voltage balancing strategy for three-level four-leg DSTATCOM-SMES system
Source title: 2017 6th International Conference on Systems and Control, ICSC 2017
Affiliations: Intelligent Control and Electrical Power Systems Laboratory (ICEPS), Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Génie Electrique, Université Djillali Liabes de Sidi Bel Abbes22000, Algeria; Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Technologies, Université de m'Sila28000, Algeria; Département de LElectronique et des Communications, Faculté des Nouvelles Technologies DInformation et Communication, Université Kasdi Merbah, Ouargla, 30000, Algeria
Authors with affiliations: Saber, B., Intelligent Control and Electrical Power Systems Laboratory (ICEPS), Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Génie Electrique, Université Djillali Liabes de Sidi Bel Abbes22000, Algeria; Abdelkader, B., Intelligent Control and Electrical Power Systems Laboratory (ICEPS), Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Génie Electrique, Université Djillali Liabes de Sidi Bel Abbes22000, Algeria; Said, B., Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Technologies, Université de m'Sila28000, Algeria; Mansour, B., Intelligent Control and Electrical Power Systems Laboratory (ICEPS), Département d'Electrotechnique, Faculté de Génie Electrique, Université Djillali Liabes de Sidi Bel Abbes22000, Algeria, Département de LElectronique et des Communications, Faculté des Nouvelles Technologies DInformation et Communication, Université Kasdi Merbah, Ouargla, 30000, Algeria
Abstract: One of the most challenges of using diode clamped multilevel inverters is the DC-link capacitor voltages unbalance problem. This paper present a new approach for balancing the intermediate DC-link capacitor voltage of three-level four-leg DSTATCOM-SMES system. The DSTATCOM-SMES is connected to a four-wire distribution system feeding a non-unity power factor unbalanced load. The control system is designed in synchronous reference frame based on symmetrical components theory to guarantee a full compensation of positive-negative-and zero-sequence of currents components in case of unbalancing conditions. The proposed balancing strategy is carried out using an appropriate balancing control loop combined with the main control system of bidirectional chopper and without a need to an additional circuit. The DSTATCOM-SMES can operate either for unity power-factor correction mode or for voltage regulation mode. The validity and effectiveness of the proposed control system for both operation modes is highlighted by computer simulations under balanced and unbalanced conditions. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: In order to design a profitable wind farm, the local wind conditions are measured to perform a detailed wind site assessment. The choice of appropriate measurement equipment and its correct installation are crucial. Measuring equipment must perform as precisely as possible to ensure the quality of data essential for producing accurate wind site assessments. In this paper a comparison is performed between wind data measurements of SODAR system and meteorological mast at different height levels and using different SODAR settings. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper presents a converter for charging and equalizing voltages across energy storage elements (ESE) - superconductors or rechargeable batteries, which are connected in series. The converter operates in soft switching mode: ZVS conditions are provided. The charged elements are galvanically separated from the main by high frequency transformers. Transformers and rectifiers can be made constructively as separate modules for each charged element. The number of modules depends on the number of items loaded. The paper presents also basic relations for dimensioning the magnetic components of the scheme and calculated and compared example designs. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: A small wind generator system with a claw-pole permanent magnet synchronous generator and a non-inverting buck-boost converter has been modelled in this study. The system uses a battery as a storage device and for stabilization of the output voltage. The system was simulated with four different battery voltages and changing wind speed. The results from the study provide a basis for optimal choice of electrical generator, battery voltage and capacity and give possibility for further development. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Critical Meteorological Conditions and the Electrical Power Balance in Bulgaria
Source title: 2017 15th International Conference on Electrical Machines, Drives and Power Systems, ELMA 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Technical University - Sofia, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Sofia, Bulgaria
Authors with affiliations: Harizanova, N., Technical University - Sofia, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Sofia, Bulgaria
Abstract: In accordance with European directives, the liberalization of Bulgarian electricity market began in 2004. Since July 1st 2007 the electricity market was partially liberalized. The open market implies producers, consumers and electricity traders entering into transactions at freely negotiated prices. Currently in Bulgaria there are two segments of the electricity market operating in parallel - a regulated and a liberalized one. The balance of the power generation in the Electrical Power System (EPS) is affected by the respective power generation technologies vulnerable to the meteorological conditions [1, 2, 3, 4]. The underestimation of the critical meteorological conditions can impose problems in the power balance with all resulting technical and financial effects [11]. Studies have been made to take into account the different aspects of power generation technology and data analysis [5, 6, 7]. A generalized approach can help to combine the different sources of information and indices to form prognosis of the power balance in the EPS [8, 9, 10]. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: The article elaborates the design and construction of automatic light control system. The developed electronic system eliminates the disadvantages of the existing systems by taking date and time from the GPS, as it also gives information about the position of the system. Based on the results the microcontroller calculates and automatically detects geographical area and retrieve relevant data for sunrise and sunset in the area, respectively ensures very precise ON/OFF mode of the lighting system. It doesn't need operator maintenance and initial installation setup. The developed electronic device increases bulb life in result of the dimming effect. On the other hand this decrease of the illumination leads to reduce in the energy consumption. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: IP-based smart sensors for energy metering and efficient HVAC infrastructure in buildings
Source title: 2017 15th International Conference on Electrical Machines, Drives and Power Systems, ELMA 2017 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electronics, Vocational School of Technical Sciences, Uludaǧ University, Bursa, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Kul, B., Department of Electronics, Vocational School of Technical Sciences, Uludaǧ University, Bursa, Turkey
Abstract: Today, HVAC systems are responsible for 15 to 60% of the total energy consumption of a building, depending on its intended use. Effective and efficient utilization of energy and the reduction of energy losses are of particular importance in this regard. In recent years, studies examining the HVAC system parameters for reducing energy consumption have revealed the need for higher performance regarding the temperature, capacity and control strategies in the resulting systems. In this study, a system was developed with IP-based smart sensors for improving the energy efficiency of the HVAC systems used in a building by determining the characteristics of the building and measuring its thermal losses. With this system, the detection of heat loss besides that of user-induced faults, as well as the reduction of these losses can be achieved. It is to this aim that the designed IP electronic system provides for access to offices via the Internet, while output data are provided through the features operating to reduce energy loss. © 2017 IEEE.
