Authors: Wen H., Zhu W.
Title: Control and Protection of DC Microgird with Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Power Electronics, Drives and Energy Systems, PEDES 2016
Affiliations: Department of electrical and electronic engineering, Xi’an Jiaotong-Liverpool University, Suzhou, China; State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment & System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, China
Authors with affiliations: Wen, H., Department of electrical and electronic engineering, Xi’an Jiaotong-Liverpool University, Suzhou, China, State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment & System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, China; Zhu, W., Department of electrical and electronic engineering, Xi’an Jiaotong-Liverpool University, Suzhou, China
Abstract: Nowadays, renewable energy technologies, such as solar power and wind power, are trend to replace conventional energy resources. In the meantime, DC Microgrid is becoming popular in distribution systems due to the better compatibility and simpler system control strategy. This paper presents a hierarchical coordinated control strategy for DC Microgrid with wind turbine and photovoltaic array under various operating conditions to ensure reliable operation and provide voltage regulation via simulating equivalent model of DC Microgrid in PSCAD. The contents of this paper can be separated into two parts, the configuration of DC Microgrid and the control strategy. The configuration consists four components, AC grid, power generation unit, power consumption unit and battery energy storage system. The basic principle of those components will be introduced in detail in this paper. The proposal control strategy contains three control level for different objectives. The DC Microgrid model is demonstrated by using PSCAD/ETMDC and the simulation results are also presented to show the effectiveness of the control strategy. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Qin H., Jin H.
Title: Warstack: Improving LLC Replacement for NVM with a Writeback-Aware Reuse Stack
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 25th Euromicro International Conference on Parallel, Distributed and Network-Based Processing, PDP 2017
Affiliations: Services Computing Technology and System Lab, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Authors with affiliations: Qin, H., Services Computing Technology and System Lab, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; Jin, H., Services Computing Technology and System Lab, School of Computer Science and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Abstract: Emerging non-volatile memory (NVM) technologies are promising alternatives to DRAM. However, the write inefficiency associated with NVM brings significant challenges to the last-level cache (LLC) replacement design. LLC replacement policies in the context of DRAM hardly focus on writeback optimization. Based on the observation that writeback to NVM diminishes the performance gained from replacement optimization, we exploit to improve LLC replacement policy with a writeback-Aware reuse stack (Warstack). Warstack enhances the default reuse priority in terms of writeback intensity. Incooperating with an accurate writeback intensity predictor (WBIP), Warstack dynamically ranks the reuse priority and retains high write-intensive blocks to mitigate the write traffic. Evaluations with memory-intensive multi-programmed programs from SPEC CPU2006 show that Warstack improves performance and energy efficiency by about 12% and 15% on average. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cache Replacement; Non-Volatile Memory

Title: A novel flicker-free AC-DC LED driver without electrolytic capacitor
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology

Authors with affiliations: Wang, L., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China, Department of Physics and Electronic Engineering, Hanshan Normal University, Chaozhou, Guangdong, 521041, China; Zhang, B., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Qiu, D., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, 510640, China
Abstract: In this paper, a novel flicker-free ac/dc LED driver without electrolytic capacitor is presented. The driver comprises a single-stage boost-forward converter and a bidirectional buck-boost converter, which serves to bypass the low frequency ripple. Therefore, electrolytic capacitor is no longer needed. Compared with other electrolytic capacitor-less topologies, the proposed driver has the advantages of almost unity input power factor, less energy storage, less capacitance needed, and constant output current. The operation principle, design process, and control strategy are presented. And the feasibility of the proposed converter is verified by a prototype with 30-V, 1.0-A output. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Capacitors; DC motors; DC-DC converters; Power converters; Rectifying circuits; Bidirectional buck-boost converter; Control strategies; Design process; Electrolytic capacitor-less; Forward converters; Input power factor; Low-frequency; Output current; Electrolytic capacitors

Authors: Kollimalla S.K., Ukil A., Gooi H.B., Naidu N.K.S., Manandhar U., Chaudhari K.
Title: Application of two stage rate limit control for different operating modes of battery
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology
Authors with affiliations: Kollimalla, S.K.; Ukil, A.; Gooi, H.B.; Naidu, N.K.S.; Manandhar, U.; Chaudhari, K.
Abstract: The present work deals with the application of two stage rate limit control for battery energy storage system under different operating modes. Energy storage systems are playing very important role in renewable power systems and microgrids. Depending on the nature of power requirement, utilization of multiple energy storage units with distinguised characteristics in terms of power and energy density is quite common in microgrids. Batteries are one of the most commonly used energy storage systems in microgrids, to support slow transients or steady state load demands. The power charge/discharge rates affects the stress levels in the battery, which in turn affects the battery life span; and its power pattern affects stored/discharge energy from the battery, which in turn affects the state of charge (SOC) of the battery. Therefore, to optimize the charge/discharge rates a two stage rate limit control scheme is proposed, and its application for different operating modes is discussed in this paper. This control scheme is verified in OPAL-RT by creating real-time control hardware in loop (CHIL) with dSPACE. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery; Energy storage system; Hybrid energy storage system; Rate-limit control; State of charge; Supercapacitor
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Electric batteries; Energy storage; Real time control; Secondary batteries; Supercapacitor; Battery; Energy storage systems; Hybrid energy storage systems; Rate limit; State of charge; Battery management systems

Authors: Wang J., Hashemi S., You S., Troholt C.
Title: Active and reactive power support of MV distribution systems using battery energy storage
Source title: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology
Affiliations: Center for Electric Power and Energy, Department of Electrical Engineering, Technical University of Denmark, Copenhagen, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., Center for Electric Power and Energy, Department of Electrical Engineering, Technical University of Denmark, Copenhagen, Denmark; Hashemi, S., Center for Electric Power and Energy, Department of Electrical Engineering, Technical University of Denmark, Copenhagen, Denmark; You, S., Center for Electric Power and Energy, Department of Electrical Engineering, Technical University of Denmark, Copenhagen, Denmark; Troholt, C., Center for Electric Power and Energy, Department of Electrical Engineering, Technical University of Denmark, Copenhagen, Denmark
Abstract: Adoption of Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESSs) for provision of grid services is increasing. This paper investigates the applications of BESS for the grid upgrade deferral and voltage support of Medium Voltage (MV) distribution systems. A BESS is modelled in Matlab/Simulink to perform peak load shaving and voltage support service from the perspective of Distribution System Operators (DSOs). An active power support algorithm is implemented and the effects of various load profiles as well as different Photovoltaic (PV) penetration scenarios on the operation of BESS and the optimal BESS converter size for peak load shaving are investigated. The BESS annual lifetime degradation is also estimated using a rainflow counting algorithm. A reactive power support algorithm embedded with Q-U droop control is proposed in order to reduce the voltage drop in a part of 10 kV distribution network of Nordhavn in Copenhagen, and the effects of active and reactive power support by BESS on the grid voltage are investigated. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage system (BESS); Peak load shaving; Voltage support
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Energy storage; Photovoltaic effects; Reactive power; Active and Reactive Power; Battery energy storage; Battery energy storage systems; Lifetime degradation; MV distribution systems; Peak load; Reactive power support; Voltage support; Electric power system control

Authors: Arif S., Aziz T.
Title: Impact of battery energy storage system on post-fault frequency fluctuation in renewable integrated microgrid
Source title: ECCE 2017 - International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Communication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Arif, S., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh; Aziz, T., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Abstract: In order to meet the ever increasing electricity demand along with reduced environmental pollution, renewable energy resources are in extensive use. However intermittent behavior of renewable energy can result in a number of operational challenges including frequency fluctuation in microgrid. Energy storage devices have been found useful to reduce this frequency fluctuation. This paper investigates the effect of battery energy storage system (BESS) on post-fault frequency condition of islanded system. The studies compare the placements of BESS at different locations of the grid including point of common coupling, the bus with maximum load and the bus with minimum load. Results show that BESS reduces the post fault frequency fluctuations in the quickest and most effective manner at the point of common coupling.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage system; Frequency fluctuation; Microgrid
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Energy resources; Energy storage; Renewable energy resources; Battery energy storage systems; Electricity demands; Environmental pollutions; Frequency fluctuation; Intermittent behaviors; Micro grid; Operational challenges; Point of common coupling; Electric energy storage

Authors: Durak H.
Title: Bio-oil production via subcritical hydrothermal liquefaction of biomass
Source title: AIP Conference Proceedings
Affiliations: Yuzuncu Yll University, Vocational School of Health Services, Van, 65080, Turkey
Authors with affiliations: Durak, H., Yuzuncu Yll University, Vocational School of Health Services, Van, 65080, Turkey
Abstract: Biomass based raw materials can be converted into the more valued energy forms using biochemical methods such as ethanol fermentation, methane fermentation and the thermochemical methods such as direct combustion, pyrolysis, gasification, liquefaction. The bio-oil obtained from the biomass has many advantages than traditional use. Firstly, it has features such as high energy density, easy storage and easy transportation. Bio-oil can be used as a fuel in engines, turbines and burning units directly. Besides, it can be converted into products in higher quality and volume via catalytic cracking, hydrodexygenation, emulsification, and steam reforming [1,2]. Many organic solvents such as acetone, ethanol, methanol, isopropanol are used in the supercritical liquefaction processes. When we think about the cost and effects of the organic solvent on nature, it will be understood better that it is necessary to find solvent that are more sensitive against nature. Here, water must have an important place because of its features. Most important solvent of the world water is named as "universal solvent" because none of the liquids can dissolve the materials as much as done by water. Water is found much at the nature and cost of it is very few when compared with the other solvent. Hydrothermal liquefaction, a thermochemical conversion process is an effective method used for converting biomass into the liquid products. General reaction conditions for hydrothermal liquefaction process are the 250-374°C temperature range and 4 - 22 Mpa pressure values range, besides, the temperature values can be higher according to the product that is expected to be obtained [3,4]. In this study, xanthium strumarium plant stems have been used as biomass source. The experiments have been carried out using a cylindrical reactor (75mL) at the temperatures of 300°C. The produced liquids at characterized by elemental analysis, GC-MS and FT-IR. According to the analysis, different types of compounds were identified by GC-MS. © 2017 Author(s).

Authors: Hammami H., Brahmi H., Brahmi I., Ben Yahia S.
Title: Security Issues in Cloud Computing and Associated Alleviation Approaches
Source title: Proceedings - 12th International Conference on Signal Image Technology and Internet-Based Systems, SITIS 2016
Affiliations: Higher School of Computer Sciences and Management, Kairouan, Tunisia; Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia
Authors with affiliations: Hammami, H., Higher School of Computer Sciences and Management, Kairouan, Tunisia; Brahmi, H., Higher School of Computer Sciences and Management, Kairouan, Tunisia; Brahmi, I., Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia; Ben Yahia, S., Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, Tunis, Tunisia
Abstract: Cloud computing is the fruit of recent developments in information technology, it provides access to many online services as well as remote computing resources as needed. To be more specific, cloud computing stands today as a satisfactory answer to the problem of storage and computing of data encountered by companies. It provides treatment and accommodation of their digital information via a fully outsourced infrastructure. The latter enables users to benefit from many online services without worrying about the technical aspects of their use. In the meanwhile, it limits costs generated by the management of these data. However, this advanced technology has immediately highlighted many serious security troubles. The major issue that prevents many companies to migrate to the cloud is the security of sensitive data hosted in the provider. Actually, the security problem related to this technology has slowed their expansion and restricted in a severe way their scope. The work in this paper deals to present a literature review of data security approaches for cloud computing, and evaluates them in terms of how well they support critical security services and what level of adaptation they achieve. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cloud Computing; Computing Data; Costs; Online Services; Remote Computing; Security; Sensitive Data; Storage
Index Keywords: Cloud computing; Costs; Energy storage; Telecommuting; Computing Data; On-line service; Remote computing; Security; Sensitive datas; Digital storage

Authors: Ceaki O., Seritan G., Vatu R., Mancasi M.
Title: Analysis of power quality improvement in smart grids
Source title: 2017 10th International Symposium on Advanced Topics in Electrical Engineering, ATEE 2017
Affiliations: Power Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Electrical Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Ceaki, O., Power Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Seritan, G., Electrical Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Vatu, R., Power Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania; Mancasi, M., Power Engineering Faculty, University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania
Abstract: Electrical distribution system is designed to operate in sinusoidal mode, but the voltage and current waveforms shows distortion compared to the sinusoidal mode. Current technology development, which results in an increasing adoption of the local generation and storage capacities, is pushing towards the adoption of smart grid paradigm. An effective technical solution for enforce limitation of various types of power quality (PQ) disturbance is based on power electronics in order to increase energy transmission capacity, improve voltage stability and dynamic behavior, control power flow and ensure a better power quality at distribution inside accepted boundaries. The objectives of this paper is to assess the harmonic disturbances present into a real smart grid, and to suggest a solution to maintain the operation of the distribution system with photovoltaic (PV) plant and electrical cars within PQ limits imposed by standards. A general analysis was addressed, in order to identify the current state-of-the art of smart grid and harmonic filters and their influence on power quality. An example was designed using ETAP software, starting from a real electric distribution system in order to build a general image of corresponding PQ issues. The solutions found for this technical issues are presented with their influence on electrical current and voltage and harmonic specter. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distribution systems; power quality; smart grid
Index Keywords: Electric load flow; Electric power transmission; Electric power transmission networks; Harmonic analysis; Power quality; Powertrains; Quality control; Distribution systems; Electric distribution systems; Electrical distribution system; Energy transmission; Harmonic disturbances; Power quality improvement; Smart grid; Voltage and current waveforms; Smart power grids

Authors: Sima C.A., Lazaroiu G.C., Dumbrava V.
Title: Transmission expansion planning optimization for improving RES integration on electricity market
Source title: 2017 10th International Symposium on Advanced Topics in Electrical Engineering, ATEE 2017
Affiliations: University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Splaiul Independentei 313, Bucharest, 060042, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Sima, C.A., University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Splaiul Independentei 313, Bucharest, 060042, Romania; Lazaroiu, G.C., University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Splaiul Independentei 313, Bucharest, 060042, Romania; Dumbrava, V., University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Splaiul Independentei 313, Bucharest, 060042, Romania
Abstract: To accommodate the intermittent renewable energy sources in existing power systems, the expansion of networks, storage integration, back-up capacities and efforts for a flexible consumption are required, otherwise grid can be overloaded. The transmission expansion planning (TEP) has the purpose to ensure two important objectives: economic trade and engineering reliability. TEP can increase the competitiveness of the market participants, providing the reliability and safety of the power grid. In this paper, TEP problem is formulated for establishing the optimal decisions in a large real network with classical generators and high share of RES to minimize load-shedding costs and to facilitate energy exchange between consumers and producers. The analysis results were obtained considering the variation of investment budget for a certain number of new transmission lines. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: decision support; electricity market; optimization; renewable energy sources; transmission expansion planning

Authors: Wicaksana H., Muslim M.M., Hutapea S.F., Purwadi A., Haroen Y.
Title: Design, implementation and techno-economic analysis of hybrid PV-Diesel for Off-grid system in Sebira Island
Source title: 3rd IEEE Conference on Power Engineering and Renewable Energy, ICPERE 2016
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Tehnologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 1040132, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wicaksana, H., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Tehnologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 1040132, Indonesia; Hutapea, S.F., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Tehnologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 1040132, Indonesia; Purwadi, A., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Tehnologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 1040132, Indonesia; Haroen, Y., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Tehnologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 1040132, Indonesia
Abstract: Low level of electrification ratio in some areas in Indonesia can be improved and developed with alternative electric energy generation. Sebira Island is one of the islands on Kepulauan Seribu in Jakarta province which is off-grid connected from electrical power systems that comes from Java main Island so that the electricity is quite limited and it depends on diesel generators. In accordance with the development of renewable energy sources technology, the use of PV System can be considered to support the existing diesel generator. This paper presents a study of a hybrid system implementation planning as the results of optimal sizing and operational strategy of hybrid PV-Diesel-battery storage system at Sebira Island, Kepulauan Seribu for the electrical system at Sebira Island. The initial design was simulated with HOMER Pro software which is then analyzed technically in PVSyst software. The most optimal design that was chosen considers levelized cost of energy (LCOE) value of the simulation results. The results of study will be compared with the existing electrical system at Sebira Island. Afterwards, the results of this comparison can be used as consideration in the development of Sebira hybrid power generation system in the next few years. The study showed that the optimum system is the system with the Renewable Fraction (PV Fraction) about 70%. The study also showed that implementing hybrid PV-Diesel with 70% PV at Sebira Island will earn us quite much avoided cost, with lower LCOE, and also lower NPC. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Suciu G., Pasat A.
Title: Challenges and opportunities for batteries of electric vehicles
Source title: 2017 10th International Symposium on Advanced Topics in Electrical Engineering, ATEE 2017
Affiliations: University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Romania; BEIA Consult International, Romania
Authors with affiliations: Suciu, G., University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Romania; Pasat, A., BEIA Consult International, Romania
Abstract: Following the path of energy efficiency and reduced emissions, electric vehicles have been the focus of research over the last decade. However, limitations as lengthy charging time, modest range and relatively lazy performance of batteries limited the commercialization of electric vehicles. So, numerous R&D projects aimed to advance the area of hybrid propulsion, thus striving to overcome most of these shortcomings, with improved energy efficiency and reduced emissions compared to conventional internal combustion engine vehicles (ICEVs). In this paper we analyze challenges and opportunities for batteries of electric vehicles, proposing a novel system designed as a hybrid concept between Vanadium Redox Flow Battery and Hydrogen Fuel Cell, for energy management in an electric vehicle, with zero emission. Thus, the main purpose of this paper is to present the components of the system as a reliable alternative to the technical limitations of standard electric storage systems based on lead-acid batteries. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Analysis of power quality issues raised by PV generation and e-parking storage capacities in UPB smart grid environment
Source title: 2017 10th International Symposium on Advanced Topics in Electrical Engineering, ATEE 2017
Affiliations: UPB, Faculty Energetica, Department of Electrical Power Systems, Romania; ENERGOBIT, Romania; UPB, Faculty Energetica, Department of Power Systems, Romania; UPB, Faculty Energetica, Romania

Abstract: This paper concentrated on identifying the main issues raised by the adoption of new PV generation and e-cars storage technologies, and their influence on power quality parameters. The main difficulty of this paper was to create a simulation tool which replicates the actual consumption behavior of UPB electric network, and to project scenarios for PV generation and e-cars capacities. A main point in the analysis performed in this work is the characterization of the electric loads present in the upcoming smart grid. An intimate view of a PV system implemented into UPB electric distribution system was delivered, along with its operation mode and its influence on power quality. The full picture was achieved by proposing a reactive energy compensator, which proved to have significant influence in increasing the harmonic distortion indexes and increasing the possible damage hazard for the sensible electronic devices. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Vatu R., Seritan G., Ceaki O., Mancasi M.
Title: Microgrids operation improvement using storage technologies
Source title: 2017 10th International Symposium on Advanced Topics in Electrical Engineering, ATEE 2017
Affiliations: Power Engineering Faculty, University POLITEHNICA of Bucharest, Romania; Electrical Engineering Faculty, University POLYTEHNICA of Bucharest, Romania

Abstract: The advancements in technology and services are fundamentally transforming the traditional electrical power system operation. It is undergoing a full changeover into a collection of microgrids, which contains consumers that become prosumers. Energy storage is a vital component of the microgrids competitive operation. In this framework, current paper is addressing the issues of batteries capacity, prices and reliability. In the first section, a general analysis was performed, aimed at accurately identifying the current state-of-the art of storage systems. An example was designed, starting from a real electric distribution system, in order to identify the optimal solution from an array of possible technical issues and solutions which will be further discussed. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Prototype development of a low cost data logger and monitoring system for PV application
Source title: 3rd IEEE Conference on Power Engineering and Renewable Energy, ICPERE 2016
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 10, Indonesia

Ganesha 10, Indonesia; Purwadi, A., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 10, Indonesia; Rizqiawan, A., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 10, Indonesia; Heryana, N., School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics, Institut Teknologi Bandung, Jl. Ganesha 10, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper presents implementation prototype data logger of PV monitoring system based on low cost online monitoring for existing 1.6 kWp single-phase grid-connected photovoltaic (PV) system in Electrical Energy Conversion Research Laboratory (EECRL) of School of Electrical Engineering and Informatics (SEEI), Institute of Technology Bandung (ITB). For cost reduction, the data logger developed by microcontroller Arduino Uno, real time clock, internal memory for data storage, telemetry 3DR radio and computer interface for online monitoring, a smart application is used to show the aggregated data graphically make the users can easily access the monitored data from the data logger and data retrieval can be taken both online and offline from existing 1.6 kWp single-phase grid connected PV systems. In field test, the data logger applied in real time for the monitoring of existing 1.6 kWp PV systems with calibration on class 0.2 standard laboratory instrumentation. The data logger used to store data during the measurement and shows the trending data of voltage, current, and power for one week measurement, and the result shows the maximum power efficiency from DC-AC converter of 1.6 kWp grid-connected is 81% until 99%. © 2016 IEEE.

Abstract: The design stage optimization of passive magnetic bearing (PMB) for a flywheel energy storage system (FESS) is the result of computationally intensive task. Magnetic bearing are increasingly being used for large variety of applications. The paper presents the verification process of force vs. displacement for a PMB conducted with analytical computation and compared with a finite element analysis (FEA) which was made with Comsol Multiphysics 3.5a simulation software for various physics and engineering applications. Also there is shown the 3D CAD design of the PMB and the relative error between analytical and numerical results. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Toumi H., Brahmi Z., Benarfa Z., Gammoudi M.M.
Title: Server load prediction using stream mining
Source title: International Conference on Information Networking
Affiliations: Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, ElManar, Tunisia; Higher Institute of Computer and Communication Techniques, Hamam Sousse, Tunis, Tunisia; Higher Institute of the Arts Multimedia, Manouba Tunis, Tunisia
Authors with affiliations: Toumi, H., Faculty of Sciences of Tunis, ElManar, Tunisia; Brahmi, Z., Higher Institute of Computer and Communication Techniques, Hamam Sousse, Tunis, Tunisia; Benarfa, Z., Higher Institute of Computer and Communication Techniques, Hamam Sousse, Tunis, Tunisia; Gammoudi, M.M., Higher Institute of the Arts Multimedia, Manouba Tunis, Tunisia
Abstract: Undoubtedly, Cloud computing is the ongoing trend that robbed the widespread concern. In fact, it succeeded in discharging users from computational and storage burden to offer them as services following pay-As-you-go principle. The substantial feature of Cloud is the ability to scale up with the rise of users' demands. However, Cloud performance falls into the duty of scaling up to fulfill the user requirements and the dramatically increase in energy consumption dilemma. In order to establish a certain trade-off, server consolidation tries to tackle this challenge by maximizing resources utilization per server in order to minimize the number of active servers. In fact, with the ever-growing demands on cloud services, cloud providers must be able to manage highly fluctuating workloads and avoids SLA violation. In this paper we are concerned by two main levels: Front-end and back-end. The former exhibits the set of users that utilize cloud services and the later is materialized by data centers where the factual load is carry out. It's significant to say that the front-end users are the leading responsible of the workload shape within data centers. We point out this fact in an attempt to further investigate the server workload within real time angle. The main goal of this paper is to formalize the server load according to users' behavior in term of submitted tasks and submission rate and to apply stream mining techniques as an introductory step to build a real time prediction system. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: real time; server load prediction; Stream Mining; task; user
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Distributed database systems; Economic and social effects; Energy utilization; Forecasting; Web services; Real time; Server loads; Stream mining; task; user; Green computing

Abstract: The proceedings contain 45 papers. The topics discussed include: a field study of the residential clothes drying process; influential factors for accurate load prediction in a demand response context; solar energy overview and maximizing power output of a solar array using sun trackers; mining building metadata by data stream comparison; a standby strategy model for an energy efficient soldering oven machine; application of auto-catalytic metallization as a sustainable technique for planar inductor fabrication; design and analysis of solar devices in public places to help meet energy demand; heat transfer fluids for parabolic trough solar collectors - a comparative study; control strategy for inverter in a micro-grid under unbalanced grid condition; sizing and location identification for an electrical energy storage system in a renewable microgrid; exploring security metrics for electric grid infrastructures leveraging attack graphs; improved protection scheme for data attack on strategic buses in the smart grid; a general model for energy efficiency calculation; performance analysis of continuously varying transmission system for electric vehicles; dispatch control with PEV charging and renewables for multiplayer game application; and key variable analysis and identification on energy consumption of automotive manufacturing plant.

Authors: Hiksas M.M., Aninditio M.L.
Title: Redox Flow Batteries for small scale energy storage
Source title: 2016 IEEE Conference on Technologies for Sustainability, SusTech 2016
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Univeristas Indonesia, Depok, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hiksas, M.M., Department of Electrical Engineering, Univeristas Indonesia, Depok, Indonesia; Aninditio, M.L., Department of Electrical Engineering, Univeristas Indonesia, Depok, Indonesia
Abstract: The rapid growth of renewable energy calls for large and efficient energy storage system. Storage of photovoltaic and wind electricity in batteries could solve the mismatch problem between the intermittent supply of these renewable resources and variable demand. Most type of battery on the market, known as Solid-electrode batteries maintain discharge at peak power for far too short time to fully regenerate renewable energy. Electrochemical storage systems are seen as a solution of choice in most cases, since they present unique features of localization scalability, efficiency, and flexibility. Most of them are Redox flow battery exhibit very high potential. Most common utilization of redox flow battery is vanadium based battery, used mainly for commercial use. Application for redox flow battery in residential market for low scale is widely open. It shows that redox flow battery has advantages compared to Lithium or Lead-acid based battery. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: Towards a zero net energy community microgrid
Source title: 2016 IEEE Conference on Technologies for Sustainability, SusTech 2016
Affiliations: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez, Puerto Rico
Authors with affiliations: Jordan, I.L., Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez, Puerto Rico; O'Neill-Carrillo, E., Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez, Puerto Rico; Lopez, N., Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez, Puerto Rico
Abstract: Decentralization of vertically integrated electrical power systems can bring economic, reliability and environmental benefits to society. Microgrids are a step to a more hybrid, less centralized power industry. A key objection from traditional electric utilities to distributed renewable energy is the variation injected to the power grid from variables sources such as the sun. A significant milestone would be to manage that variation from renewable sources before it reaches the grid. Furthermore, if a renewable-driven subsystem demands a fixed block of power from the grid, the potential impacts from interconnecting renewable energy are minimized. This paper presents work on such seamless grid interconnection, focusing on zero or low net energy community microgrids. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand response; distributed generation; energy storage; Microgrids; public policy; PV energy

Authors: Yang L., Jingxin C., Jieru Z., Zhiyong T.
Title: Central decision intellective taxi system and multi ride algorithm
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: Beihang University, No.37 XueYuan Road, HaiDian District, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, L., Beihang University, No.37 XueYuan Road, HaiDian District, Beijing, China; Jingxin, C., Beihang University, No.37 XueYuan Road, HaiDian District, Beijing, China; Jieru, Z., Beihang University, No.37 XueYuan Road, HaiDian District, Beijing, China; Zhiyong, T., Beihang University, No.37 XueYuan Road, HaiDian District, Beijing, China
Abstract: In order to adapt to the rapid development of small vehicles, meet the needs of people on individual traffic, ease traffic congestion, reduce pollution and save energy, an intellective transportation scheme that contains intellective taxi routing and algorithm for multi-passenger taxi taking via GPS satellite positioning system is presented in this paper. Furthermore, this paper comes up with an optimization method of choosing the shortest path and an algorithm to avoid congestion. The system is according to the actual requirement of city taxi and based on central controlling as the overall design idea. It is mainly consist of two parts, the vehicle terminal and the monitoring and dispatching center. The vehicle terminal is to fulfill the collection of data, storage, and transmission and so on. Then it can turn to be intellective. Meanwhile, transmission can accomplish data processing, analysis, output and other basic functions. Besides, through the monitoring and dispatching center, we can watch the playback of vehicle track and realize real-time positioning. Also, via setting path property of data map, we do real-time positioning, monitoring and early warning to vehicles. Not only can this system be convenient to citizens, but it can decrease the rate of empty cars, have a positive effect on city traffic and pollution reduction as well. © 2017 Association for Computing Machinery.

Title: An environmentally powered wireless sensor node for high precision temperature measurements
Source title: SAS 2017 - 2017 IEEE Sensors Applications Symposium, Proceedings

Abstract: Wireless measurement systems will provide significant benefits to industrial applications, for production facilities as well as in mobile or R&D scenarios. However, in order to exploit the improvements by flexibility, scalability and easy reconfigurability brought by wireless sensor networks (WSN), industrial use cases often require a sustainable autonomous energy supply, while providing the reliability which is comparable with today's wired systems. In this work we introduce a sensor node implementation with a temperature measurement circuit design, optimized for low energy consumption, while providing industry-grade accuracy and resolution. A first implementation realizing the concept of a switched signal acquisition circuitry is discussed, demonstrating the impact of the energy harvesting and storage unit. In a second implementation, a coordinated signal conditioning and power management concept is introduced. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Design and control of photovoltaic/wind/battery based microgrid system
Source title: 2017 International Conference on Electrical Engineering, ICEE 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Sakarya University, Sakarya, Turkey; State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment and System Security and New Technology, School of Electrical Engineering, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; Electrical Engineering Department, Bahria University, Islamabad, Pakistan; Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Engineering and Technology, Lahore, Pakistan

Abstract: This paper deals with the design and control of a micro-grid, including various alternative energy resources (photovoltaic and wind) and battery energy storage system which operates in stand-alone as well as in grid-connected mode. The proposed micro-grid is controlled via various non-isolated converters while an energy management is performed through switching based algorithm. According to the strategy, the wind is used as the primary power source while the Photovoltaic (PV) is added to improve the reliability of system under different weather conditions. The battery module is utilized as an energy storage system during surplus power and/or backup device during demand. The proposed system used real record of weather pattern and load conditions for a small community at Islamabad, Pakistan. This city is gifted with several natural resources that can generate a significant amount of power energy for the region. MATLAB simulation results show the effectiveness of proposed system in terms of grid stability, power sharing, load tracking and power quality. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Fuzzy TOPSIS approach based on axiomatic fuzzy set for assessing thermal-energy storage in concentrated solar power (CSP) systems: CPS systems assessment

Abstract: In classical TOPSIS method, the criteria values and criteria weights are known precisely. However, the values of some criteria are often vague in real-life situation, and it expressed only by exact numerical values is inadequate, the application of linguistic variables or fuzzy terms in decision making is deemed to be relevant. Therefore, the aim of this paper is to develop a fuzzy TOPSIS method to deal with above multiple criteria decision making(MCDM) problems. Here, the linguistic variables are represented by membership degrees applying the axiomatic fuzzy set (AFS) theory, then the application of TOPSIS approach is extended. In addition, the semantic interpretations are provided for the decision results by AFS theory. The proposed method is used to assess thermal-energy storage in concentrated solar power (CSP) systems. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AFS theory; Fuzzy TOPSIS; Semantic interpretation; Thermal-energy storage
Index Keywords: Computer networks; Decision making; Fuzzy sets; Heat storage; Information systems; Information use; Semantics; Solar energy; Thermal energy; AFS theory; Axiomatic fuzzy sets; Concentrated solar power; FUZZY TOPSIS; Linguistic variable; Membership degrees; Multiple criteria decision-making problems; Semantic interpretation; Decision theory

Authors: Wei X.-J., Lu Q.
Title: Study on the economic evaluation model of wind, solar and energy storage combined power generation unit
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 International Conference on Network and Information Systems for Computers, ICNISC 2017
Affiliations: Department of Information and Communication, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; School of Control and Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, X.-J., Department of Information and Communication, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Lu, Q., School of Control and Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper studied and implemented a set of economic operation evaluation system of wind, solar and energy storage combined power generation unit. Firstly, according to the meteorological conditions, the unit output model was set up. Under the established coordinated operation strategy, wind, solar and energy storage combined power generation system was taken into grid as power generation unit with rated capacity. Then, starting from aspects of technical and economic benefit, financial benefit and social benefit, it constructed a comprehensive economic benefit index system. A comprehensive evaluation model was established by combining the subjective and objective value assignment method. Finally, through the development of the evaluation system, it completed the output simulation run on the power generation unit, in addition, it conducted visual analysis and display on evaluation results of different capacity matching schemes. The results showed that the research and development of the system could combine the performance characteristics of wind, solar and energy storage combined power generation technology to form the economic operation evaluation model of the power generation unit which conformed to the scale-up grid entrance, through the scientific process, it could form the evaluation result and then display this in a variety of chart forms to provide decision support for researchers. © 2019 IEEE.

Title: Operation of a grid connected microgrid with a variable load bus and a diesel generator set
Source title: 2017 Innovations in Power and Advanced Computing Technologies, i-PACT 2017

Abstract: A micro grid is a small scale power grid which can be operated in the grid connected mode as well as the isolated mode. When it is operated in the grid connected mode, it is connected to the grid at the point of common coupling (PCC). A micro grid normally consists of renewable energy sources, a diesel generator, storage facilities and a central controller. The micro grid described in this paper contains only a diesel generator, a wind emulator and the loads. Designing of central controller is the main objective of this research. This paper discuss how the governor of the diesel generator is controlled via a central controller in both the isolated and grid connected operations. Frequency should be controlled in isolated operation and the power flow through point of common coupling (PCC) should be controlled in the grid connected operation. MATLAB Simulink was used to simulate and analyze both of these situations. This paper discusses how it was used for generating the required result in order to accomplish the mentioned task. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: frequency controlling; isochronous governor; power controlling; Power system simulator; synchronous governor

Authors: El Mendili S., Bouzekri El Y.E., Hmina N.
Title: Association rules mining on MapReduce
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: Systems Engineering Lab, ENSA IBN TOFAIL University, Kénitra, Morocco; IDRISSI, Systems Engineering Lab, ENSA IBN TOFAIL University, Kénitra, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: El Mendili, S., Systems Engineering Lab, ENSA IBN TOFAIL University, Kénitra, Morocco; Bouzekri El, Y.E., IDRISSI, Systems Engineering Lab, ENSA IBN TOFAIL University, Kénitra, Morocco; Hmina, N., Systems Engineering Lab, ENSA IBN TOFAIL University, Kénitra, Morocco
Abstract: Many governments are considering adopting the smart city concept in their cities and implementing big data applications that support smart city components to reach the required level of sustainability and improve the living standards. Smart cities utilize multiple technologies to improve the performance of health, transportation, energy, education, and water services leading to higher levels of comfort of their citizens. One of the recent technologies that have a huge potential to enhance smart city services is big data analytics which have many challenges for analyzing urban datasets such as data volume. The user's requirement for information increases from minute to minute and the storage capacity gives an enormous size of data making it difficult to recognize useful information W∗ch! can be understandable and process by human brain for decision making. Data mining and knowledge discovery has emerged to extract useful, hidden and unknown patterns and knowledge from large database, It is big question what will a data collector do with this massive size of data? Answer is simple person wants knowledge from this data which satisfies users need. This paper deals with the study of different big data analytics tools provide by different companies , then we will focused on the association rules data mining technology. The advantages and disadvantages of Apriori algorithm which will be deeply analyzed, then the functioning of Hadoop and MapReduce Process finally, the performance of this algorithm is compared with the experimental results applied on different datasets taken from traffic accidents. © 2017 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Apriori; Association Rules; Big Data; Data analytics; Smart city

Authors: Liu Y., Seet B.-C.
Title: Optimal network structuring for large-scale WSN with virtual broker based publish/subscribe
Source title: Proceedings of the 2017 2nd Workshop on Recent Trends in Telecommunications Research, RTTR 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Y., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand; Seet, B.-C., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand
Abstract: Large-scale wireless sensor networks (WSNs) often need to be partitioned for efficient data acquisition. To enhance the scalability and reliability of publish/subscribe (pub/sub) systems implemented on a large-scale in WSNs, dedicated broker devices with large storage and computation capacities can be replaced with virtual brokers (VBs), each formed by multiple co-located sensor nodes that shared resources to collaboratively perform the role of a conventional broker. As communication is a major consumer of energy, which is a scarce resource in WSNs, how the WSN is structured in terms of the number of partitions and the size of VB can impact the energy consumption of the network. In this paper, we propose a novel approach to optimal network structuring of large-scale WSN with virtual brokers for pub/sub communication. Underlying the approach is an analytical model which determines the optimal number of partitions and VB size that jointly minimize the total communication overhead of the WSN. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Sun X., Shao C., Wang G., Yang L., Li X., Yue Y.
Title: Research on electrical brake of a series-parallel hybrid electric vehicle
Source title: 2016 World Congress on Sustainable Technologies, WCST 2016
Affiliations: Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Sun, X., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China; Shao, C., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, G., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China; Yang, L., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, X., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China; Yue, Y., Department of Chassis Part Technology, China North Vehicle Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: For the sake of high-efficiency energy recycling and brake security for series-parallel hybrid electric vehicle, an integrated brake system with an electric consuming brake subsystem and advanced strategy is proposed. The brake processes in different brake conditions are analyzed. A brake control strategy relying on the brake condition is applied in the series-parallel hybrid electric vehicle. In view of the complexity and dynamic characteristics, a coupled whole vehicle model which combined the driveline model and the thermal management system model is proposed to study the energy flow and utilization in the different electrical brake processes. A simulation of the whole vehicle under an UDDS driving cycle is studied. According to the simulation result, the integrated brake system and control strategy are effective for the series-parallel hybrid electric vehicle. It not only can ensure the security of the vehicle driving and battery energy storage, but also can enhance the energy utilization and prolong the life of mechanical brake device in the brake process. © 2016 Infonomics Society.

Authors: Rugwiro U., Chunhua G.
Title: Customization of virtual machine allocation policy using k-means clustering algorithm to minimize power consumption in data centers
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, East China University of Science and Technology, 130 Meilong Road, Xu hui District, Shanghai, 200237, China
Authors with affiliations: Rugwiro, U., School of Information Science and Engineering, East China University of Science and Technology, 130 Meilong Road, Xu hui District, Shanghai, 200237, China; Chunhua, G., School of Information Science and Engineering, East China University of Science and Technology, 130 Meilong Road, Xu hui District, Shanghai, 200237, China
Abstract: Cloud Computing provides rapid provision of computing resources like processing power, memory, network resources, storage, etc. Running computing resources for longer time, leads energy consumption, increase the emission of Carbon Dioxide (CO2) and increase the expenditure cost for the resources usage. Hence there is a necessity to minimize the execution time to reduce energy consumption in the cloud environment. One of the existing approaches to reducing energy consumption is based on Migration and Placement Policy for Virtual Machine, but still improving placement technique we can further minimize power consumption. In our proposed architecture for cloud resource allocation based on Clustering method, we do map a group of tasks to virtual machines. For clustering, we work on task usage of CPU, memory, and bandwidth. This proposed clustering technique further decreases energy consumption by efficient resource allocation. © 2017 ACM.

Authors: Gantumur Sh., Bekhbat G.
Title: Challenges of hybrid DGs for islanded micro-grid operation in west region energy system of Mongolia
Source title: Proceedings - 2016 11th International Forum on Strategic Technology, IFOST 2016

Abstract: In this paper, we deal with energetic aspects of electricity generation from the existing Hydro power and estimated large scale PV station in the Western Energy System of Mongolia, which is interconnected with Russian energy system and importing almost 70% of its electricity getting the amount of subsidies each year. The engineering concepts and calculations were made with the aims to investigate the technological and technical possibility for building up the capacity in this region to put the base stone of future study on detailed research activities on creating the challenges of islanded mode of the Western Energy System of Mongolia making suitable micro-grid with DGs. For achieving these goals the initial investigation was made in frame of the concepts, load profile trends and cases with hydro/PV hybrid plants concluding the benefits of such structure. The voltage-drop and power flow analyse was carried out in cases of:i) existing operation state of the Western Energy System with 5MW Durgun hydro, and ii) hybrid generation of 5 MW Durgun hydro + 3.4.5.7,5 and 10MW PV plants are connected to the System. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Weiss A., Weiss H.
Title: Photovoltaic cell electrical heating system for removing snow on panel including verification
Source title: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2016
Affiliations: Department 8Br, BGandBRG, Moserhofstrasse 5, Leoben, Austria; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Montanuniversitaet Leoben, Leoben, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Weiss, A., Department 8Br, BGandBRG, Moserhofstrasse 5, Leoben, Austria; Weiss, H., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Montanuniversitaet Leoben, Leoben, Austria
Abstract: Smalt photovoltaic plants in private ownership are typically rated at 5 kW(peak). The panels are mounted on roofs at a decline angle of 20° to 45°. In winter time, a dense layer of snow at a width of e.g. 10 cm keeps off solar radiation from the photovoltaic cells for weeks under continental climate conditions. Practically no energy is produced over the time of snow coverage. Only until outside air temperature has risen high enough for a rather long time interval to allow partial melting of snow the snow layer rushes down in an avalanche. Following this proposal, snow removal can be arranged electrically at an extremely positive energy balance in a fast way. A photovoltaic cell is a large junction area diode inside with a threshold voltage of about 0.6 V to 0.7 V (depending on temperature). This forward voltage drop created by an externally driven current through the modules can be efficiently used to provide well-distributed heat dissipation at the cell and further on at the glass surface of the whole panel. The adhesion of snow on glass is widely reduced through this heating in case a thin water film can be produced by this external short time heating. Laboratory experiments provided a temperature increase through rated panel current of more than 10°C within about 10 minutes. This heating can initiate the avalanche for snow removal on intention as described before provided the clamping effect on snow at the edge of the panel frame is overcome by an additional heating foil. Basics of internal cell heat production, heating thermal effects in time course, thermo-graphic measurements on temperature distribution, power circuit opportunities including battery storage elements and snow-removal under practical conditions are described. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Intentional internal cell heating; Photovoltaic energy output increase; Snow removal from panel

Authors: Weiss A., Ziegerhofer H.
Title: High safety photovoltaic insular power supply system employing re-used lithium-ion cells
Source title: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2016
Affiliations: Department 8Br, BGandBRG, Moserhofstrasse 5, Leoben, Austria; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Montanuniversitaet Leoben, Leoben, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Weiss, A., Department 8Br, BGandBRG, Moserhofstrasse 5, Leoben, Austria; Ziegerhofer, H., Institute of Electrical Engineering, Montanuniversitaet Leoben, Leoben, Austria
Abstract: Renewable energy sources must be combined with electrical energy storage components to obtain an off-grid insular power supply system. For low energetic footprint we prepare to employ Li-ion batteries from electric vehicles after their mobile service time. Some cells are weaker and some may have a higher self discharge rate. This paper proposes a high-safety wide operating temperature range system that introduces redundancies in sensors, calculation, supervision and action including balancing, provides a continuous supervision of cells and monitors system behaviour. Despite all precautions there is some risk left that working with Li-ion batteries in a re-use process ends up with a destroyed system. Special precautions are taken to avoid it as far as technically possible. But in case of destruction we want to know the reason by retrieving selected signals from the system in order to learn as re-use of Lithium-ion batteries is not an application field with wide knowledge and references. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: Simulated thermal response test for ground heat storage: Numerical and analytical modeling of borehole
Source title: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Renewable Energy Research and Applications, ICRERA 2016
Affiliations: Faculty of Technology, University of Vaasa, Vaasa, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Haq, H.M.K.U., Faculty of Technology, University of Vaasa, Vaasa, Finland; Martinkauppi, B., Faculty of Technology, University of Vaasa, Vaasa, Finland; Hiltunen, E., Faculty of Technology, University of Vaasa, Vaasa, Finland; Sivula, T., Faculty of Technology, University of Vaasa, Vaasa, Finland
Abstract: An understanding of behavior of a heat storage system provides possibility to design and build more optimal system. Improved optimal utilization of a seasonal heat storage system is possible with a better understanding the behavior of heat storage in a bedrock. For a small building or a house, heating or cooling demands can be met with efficient use of renewable energy. Majority of the heat energy production may be done with geothermal energy making it a cost effective and long term solution in Finland. In order to implement an efficient renewable energy source, geothermal energy is considered to fulfill the heating and cooling demands of a building. This paper deal with the modeling and simulation of a heat storage system designed in Kokkola city subject to study and understand the thermal property of the ground and answer some interesting questions a designer may have. Comsol is used for modeling and simulation purpose. The data from the design site is compared with the theoretical model. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Jahid A., Shams A.B., Hossain M.F.
Title: Energy cooperation among BS with hybrid power supply for DPS CoMP based cellular networks
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Electrical, Electronic and Communication Engineering, Military Institute of Science and Technology, Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Islamic University of Technology, Gazipur, 1704, Bangladesh; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, 1000, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Jahid, A., Department of Electrical, Electronic and Communication Engineering, Military Institute of Science and Technology, Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh; Shams, A.B., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Islamic University of Technology, Gazipur, 1704, Bangladesh; Hossain, M.F., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, 1000, Bangladesh
Abstract: Green cellular networking has drawn intensive attention recently for cellular operators in order to reduce the network operation cost and carbon footprints. In this paper, we consider base stations (BSS) powered by hybrid power supplies including both the conventional grid and the renewable solar energy. We propose a model for energy cooperation among BSS having individual energy storages which are connected through resistive power lines for energy sharing. Furthermore, dynamic point selection (DPS) CoMP technique is applied for selecting the best serving BS for users equipment (UE). Our goal is to maximize the green energy utilization leading to higher energy efficiency. Tempo-spatial variations of both the renewable energy generation and the traffic demand are exploited for the proposed BS cooperation. Extensive simulations are carried out for evaluating energy efficiency (EE) performance of the proposed cellular network in conjunction with DPS CoMP technique and energy sharing scheme. From simulation results we investigate the benefits of energy cooperation and effectiveness of CoMP technique in this regime. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Bakchy S.C., Islam M.R., Sayeed A.
Title: Human identification on the basis of gait analysis using Kohonen self-organizing mapping technique
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Bakchy, S.C., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Islam, M.R., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Sayeed, A., Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Abstract: Gait recognition is one of the most recent emerging technique of human biometric which can be used for security based purposes. In comparison with other bio-metric techniques gait analysis has some special security features. Most of the biometric techniques use sequential template based component analysis for recognition. Here we have proposed a developed technique for gait identification using the feature Gait Energy Image (GEI). It is implemented using Kohonen Self-Organizing Mapping (KSOM) neural network. GEI representation of gait contains all information of each image in one complete gait cycle and requires less storage and low processing speed. As only one image is enough to store the necessary information in GEI feature, recognition process is a bit easier than any other feature of gait recognition. Gait recognition has some limitations like viewing angle variation, walking speed, clothes, carrying load etc. Robust View Transformation Model (RVTM) is used to solve the problem of viewing angle. RVTM transforms the viewing angle data from various angle to specific angle. RVTM enhances recognition performance. Our proposed method compares the recognition performance with template based feature extraction which needs to process each frame in the cycle. We use GEI which gives all possible information about all the frames in one cycle and results in better performance than other feature of gait analysis. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Gait analysis; Gait Energy Image; Kohonen Self-Organizing Mapping network; Unsupervised learning

Authors: Datta D., Sheikh M.R.I., Islam M.M., Mahdi A.A.
Title: Terminal voltage regulation & output fluctuations minimization using governor-exciter controller
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: EEE Department, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; EEE Department, Varendra University, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Datta, D., EEE Department, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Sheikh, M.R.I., EEE Department, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Islam, M.M., EEE Department, Varendra University, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Mahdi, A.A., EEE Department, Varendra University, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Abstract: Energy is essential to life and the major source of energy comes from fossil fuels. As the human population increases, our rate of consumption of these fossil fuels also increases. On the other hand, world population continues to grow and the limited amount of fossil fuels begin to diminish, it may not be possible to provide the amount of energy demanded by the world by only using fossil fuels to convert energy. The solution to the problems of limited fossil fuels and their impact on the environment is to have renewable resources play a larger role in the supply of energy. In this case wind energy is the most promising green energy. As wind turbine output is proportional to the cube of wind speed, the wind turbine generator output fluctuates due to wind speed variation. Thus this paper focuses on the comparative study between conventional wind turbine models with modified pitch controller and proposed a new technique called modified pitch governor with exciter controller to control output voltage and frequency without using any costly energy storage devices. In this study variable load is considered and real wind speed data is taken to obtain realistic response. PSCAD/EMTDC software is used for simulation analyses. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Das J.P., Fatema R.J., Anower M.S.
Title: Feasibility study of low voltage DC distribution system for residential buildings in Bangladesh & hybrid home appliance design for tropical climate
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Das, J.P., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh; Fatema, R.J., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh; Anower, M.S., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh
Abstract: This paper describes a process to make the residential buildings more energy efficient. Three low voltage direct current (DC) distribution systems of different voltage levels are compared with the existing alternating current (AC) system in Bangladesh. Losses in the cable, internal losses of the devices, energy consumption cost, efficiency of the converters and initial cost for new wiring are the factors which have been assessed to obtain the best system. Through the analysis it is found that 48V DC system with optimized cable area is the most economical system among the others as it saves 1,36,859.2 BDT within a life time of 20 years. Besides, a hybrid appliance is prototyped consisting of air-cooler, refrigerator and electric stove altogether for higher efficiency. The wasted heat energies from the cooling devices are stored in a thermal storage by thermoelectric modules and used later for heating purposes for the better overall efficiency. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Hasan A.G.M.R., Sheikh M.R.I.
Title: Smoothening of wind farm output fluctuations using new pitch controller
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of EEE, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Hasan, A.G.M.R., Department of EEE, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Sheikh, M.R.I., Department of EEE, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology, Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
Abstract: Recently, renewable energy sources, like wind power generation, are widely being used in the world. Among various renewable resources, wind energy seems to be promising solution to provide reliable power supply with improved system efficiency. It is essential for wind farm to control the frequency as well as power. Some methods for smoothing the wind generator output fluctuations using several types of energy storage systems have been proposed, but these methods have a cost of problem. This paper proposes a new pitch control system for smoothing the wind generator output fluctuations. The simulation results show that the wind farm output fluctuations due to the wind speed variations can be smooth more effectively by the new pitch controller than the conventional pitch controller. It is confirmed that the wind farm output gives rise to fluctuations of system frequency more as the power capacity of wind farm becomes large. The wind farm output fluctuations, as well as energy and the power system frequency can be made more accurate by using new pitch controller. PSCAD software has been used for simulation analyses. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: Impact of energy storage devices on reliability of distribution system
Source title: ICECTE 2016 - 2nd International Conference on Electrical, Computer and Telecommunication Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Operations and Maintenance, Everest Power Generation Company Limited, Meghnaghat, Narayanganj, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Raihan, M.I.A., Department of Operations and Maintenance, Everest Power Generation Company Limited, Meghnaghat, Narayanganj, Bangladesh
Abstract: Modern society expects the power supply to be continuously available on demand because of its pattern of social and working habits. Hence, reliability is a key factor in power system designing and planning. Reliability of power system can be monitored at various levels of generation, transmission and distribution. This paper examines the impact of large scale energy storage on distribution system reliability. Both distributed and lumped placement of energy storage devices have been considered to calculate its impact on feeder as well as overall system reliability. DIgSILENT Power Factory 14.1 has been used as simulation tool. Results show that with introduction of energy storage devices into distribution system, duration of outage decreases in an annum. However, the inclusion of storage devices increases the frequency of outage to some extents. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang Y., Zhang T., Wang R., Liu Y., Guo B.
Title: Dynamic dispatch of isolated neighboring multi-microgrids based on model predictive control
Source title: 2016 International Conference on Smart Grid and Clean Energy Technologies, ICSGCE 2016

Abstract: This paper propose a mathematical formulation of energy management problem and its implementation in an energy management system (EMS) for isolated neighboring multi-microgrids. Using the model predictive control technique, the optimal operation of the microgrids is determined by utilizing an extended horizon of prediction and evaluation, which allows a proper scheduling of the energy storage units, responsive loads, and controllable distributed generators. A finite mixed integer quadratic programming problem is modeled and solved with both forecasts and newly updated system state information. Case study is employed to assess the performance of the proposed approach and simulation results show that the operation costs of coordinated multi-microgrids is lower than that of operated individually. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: The effect of different charging strategies on EV load frequency control
Source title: 2016 International Conference on Smart Grid and Clean Energy Technologies, ICSGCE 2016
Affiliations: China Southern Power Grid, Electric Power Research Institute, Guangzhou, China; Key Laboratory of Smart Grid, Ministry of Education, Tianjin University, Tianjin, China

Abstract: Due to the quick power reaction characteristic, the electrical vehicles (EVs) are used for load frequency control. An EV frequency control strategy is proposed considering the charging and discharging characteristics of the EV battery. Different from battery energy storage system, the availability of EVs largely depends on the charging behaviors. With different charging power and different charging time, three charging strategies are studied (dumb charging, smart charging and constant charging). The effects of EV load frequency control with three charging strategies are compared under a severe frequency event. The simulation results show that the EV load frequency control effect is closely related with the charging strategy. Considering the system load curve along a whole day, 'smart charging' is the most suitable for preventing severe frequency event. © 2016 IEEE.

Source title: 2016 International Conference on Smart Grid and Clean Energy Technologies, ICSGCE 2016

Abstract: In view of the condition and demand of HulunBuir power grid, it could play an important role in enhancing its restoration speed to find or build new power source applied for black-start. Firstly, a black-start scheme is proposed for it, in which the East Hailar Thermal Power Plant in Hailar district can be started through using the Daliang wind farm configured with high-capacity battery energy storage system. Secondly, the feasibility of the proposed black-start scheme is verified through analyzing the simulation results. Finally, some key technical problems needed to be further solved are proposed based on the study. © 2016 IEEE.

Title: Development of supervising system for battery energy storage system based on the two-level architecture

Abstract: The real-time monitoring of status parameters, such as cell voltage and state of charge (SOC), is an important guarantee of the safety operation of the battery energy storage system (BESS). And the two-level architecture of hardware system which includes several battery management units (BMU) and the central management unit (CMU) is designed with the communication protocol and data conversion algorithm for achieving the data acquisition and communication. Moreover, an enhanced SOC method involving the resting time and the terminal voltage is researched and programmed in the software system. The battery supervising system is verified by lots of experiments that it could satisfy the monitoring demand of BESS and has improved the accuracy of SOC estimation effectively. © 2016 IEEE.

Authors: Liu Y., Chen H., Li N., Zhang Y., Li Z., Zong J.
Title: The smoothing strategy of wind power combined with storage based on least square fitting
Source title: 2016 International Conference on Smart Grid and Clean Energy Technologies, ICSGCE 2016
Affiliations: North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Y., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China; Chen, H., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China; Li, N., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China; Li, Z., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China; Zong, J., North China Electric Power Research Institute Co., Ltd., Smart Grid and New Energy Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: More and more renewable power with large capacity has been incorporated into power system. The high fluctuation and randomness features of wind power present a number of challenges for the safety grid. 'Grid friendly' wind farm with storage device can reduce the volatility impact of grid safety. The optimal output strategy based on least-square polynomial fitting was established for the wind farm with the storage device. The results showed separate order correspond to separate smoothing effect. In the case of a 49.5MW wind farm, the third order polynomial model achieved the optimal output simulation of wind farm with storage device. In contrast to other numerical value filter methods, least-square polynomial fitting method has fast computation speed, and can calculate the slope of optimal output power in real time. © 2016 IEEE.
